loans.name: Josephine's Group

texts.en:
Josephine lives with her family in Lahore, Pakistan. She is an energetic lady. She sells clothes in the surrounding area in order to earn an income so that she can help her husband meet their family's financial needs. Her husband is a tailor and has a tailoring business in the market. They both have chosen their businesses because the people of Lahore are fond of clothes. That’s why these businesses have proven to be very successful and profitable.  

Sometimes her husband faces challenges fulfilling tailoring orders on time due to the heavy workload. As a result, he has decided to hire a worker to help in his tailoring shop. Josephine has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband. With the loan, he will buy another sewing machine for his worker. He hopes that, working together, they will fulfill the orders on time and generate a good income. Josephine is hopeful that this investment will help her husband to increase his income, which will bring financial satisfaction to his family.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Rose Akinyi Ochieng

texts.en: Rose Akinyi Ochieng O. is a shoe vendor at Oile Market in Kisumu Kenya. She started this business after finishing her education in 2001. Her sister, who was also a shoe vendor, influenced her to begin the business to help her generate income. Since then, Rose has being working hard to expand her business in order to earn considerable income. She buys her inventory in Nairobi every two weeks. With the number of her customers growing each day, Rose would like to increase her inventory. She would like to get a loan of KES 20,000 so that she can purchase more inventory. She believes this will enable her to earn a profit that will facilitate her plan to expand her business. She is 27 years old and a mother of five (5) children.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 32 years old. He is married and has two children, ages 3 and 7. Both children attend school. He is a farmer from Nkubu town in Eastern Kenya. He has been farming for 12 years and has employed four people from his community. His main products are milk, bananas, beans, green beans, and maize, which he sells to the local market.

His primary challenges have been a lack of market for his green beans, unfavorable market conditions for his bananas, and pests and diseases which affect his crops and animals.

Moses recently completed his second loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 50,000 KES and has requested this loan of 50,000 KES to upgrade his banana farming by purchasing fertilizers and manure. He says that these farm inputs will increase his production and earn him more income that will improve his family's standard of living.

In the future, he plans to purchase a car that will assist him in transporting bananas from his farm in Nkubu to Nairobi town. He says that Juhudi loans are flexible in the sense that they are paid monthly, which gives him ample time to get the money for repayment.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for bananas

loans.name: 03.05.21-Dien Bien Group

texts.en:
"Diep T. T. is a 39-year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoa.  Diep is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 21-Dien Bien (03.05.21).


Diep is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To making a living, Diep owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling rice products in the local community.  Diep has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 3.000.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2009, Diep joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Diep has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4.248.000 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business.  She is now requesting a new loan of 5.310.000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  The loan will be the second loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Diep plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  N. T. Mien is a 61 year-old female who is requesting a 5310000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector running a general store.


2.  L. T. Thiet is a 49 year-old female who is requesting a 5310000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.


3.  N. T. Khai is a 57 year-old female who is requesting a 5310000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector running a general store.


4.  V. T. Xa is a 42 year-old female who is requesting a 5310000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making & selling food.


5.  P. T. Lien is a 58 year-old female who is requesting a 4248000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector running a general store.


6.  L. T. Loc is a 69 year-old female who is requesting a 4248000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector making & selling food.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Diep T. T. (104) là 39 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa.  Diep là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 7 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 21-Dien Bien (03.05.21).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm từ gạo trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Diep thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 4 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Diep kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND.  Vào 2009, Diep đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Diep đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 4.248.000 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.310.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  N. T. Mien (108) là 61 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5310000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.


2.  L. T. Thiet (107) là 49 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5310000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


3.  N. T. Khai (106) là 57 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5310000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.


4.  V. T. Xa (105) là 42 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5310000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


5.  P. T. Lien (158) là 58 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4248000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.


6.  L. T. Loc (159) là 69 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4248000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.name: Salomat

texts.ru: Мирзоева Саломат проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст, 25 лет. Замужем, имеет 3 детей. Муж в России на заработках. Сама Саломат не имеет высшего образования. После отъезда мужа ей пришлось работать и прокормить семью. Сейчас она арендует помещение, где открыла дилерский центр. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже 4 года. Кредит просит на приобретения сим карт и карт для пополнения счетов. Она хочет расширить свой бизнес и получить больше прибыли.
texts.en:
Salomat M. lives in Hamadoni. She is 25 years old, married, and has three children. Her husband is working in Russia. Salomat does not have a higher education. After her husband left, she had to work to support her family. Now she rents a space where she has opened a cell phone kiosk. She has been doing this work for four years. She is taking out a loan to buy more SIM cards and cards that add minutes to phones. She wants to expand her business and earn greater profits.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying new SIM cards

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
The Kiva borrower is a 24-year-old single man living with his mother and 3 siblings. After the death of his father, he decided to stop his education and start working to earn income for his family. He started working as a constructor specialized on gypsum board work. He works with his brothers to cover the family expenses, home rental, hospitality expenses etc. He has been involved in his occupation for the past 5 years and he has been able, despite his young age, to build a good business reputation where a lot of entrepreneurs ask for his construction services. He is asking to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additional construction tools because his work is increasing and he needs to be prepared for any new projects.

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e., blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.) Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

About Ameen:

Ameen s.a.l. has been a major player in the Lebanese Microfinance sector since 1999. Originally, a micro-credit program created by CHF International, Ameen evolved to become Ameen s.a.l. in 2003, a Lebanese services company. In 2007, Ameen s.a.l. registered with the Central Bank of Lebanon to become the first Lebanese financial institution specialized in Microfinance.

At Ameen s.a.l. we pledge to provide financial services to the largest number of micro and small entrepreneurs and to the working poor, to help them develop their businesses and improve their incomes.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loans Kiva to offer lower-interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high-quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: To purchase additional construction tools.

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos is 23 years old and single. He is a farmer from Nkubu town in Eastern Kenya. He has been farming for the last year and sells his bananas to the local market. His biggest challenges in this business have been lack of fertilizers and insufficient water supply.

In future, he plans to construct a better grazing shed and purchase two more dairy cows and employ one farm-hand. He is grateful to Juhudi for giving loans to farmers.

Lady Brigette is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Lady Brigette from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Bayar

texts.en:
Bayar N. is 44 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a relative’s ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. His younger daughter Munkhzul is 17 years old and attends a secondary school. His wife Sarantuya is a builder, decorator. His son Azzaya is 26 years old and he works as a security guard. 

Bayar operates a trucking business with his truck, which has a capacity of two tons. He is a very hard-working person and his business is very important to him. 

Bayar says, “As a father, I would like to be financially available to provide a good education and other necessary expenses for my children until they grow up. Also, I would like to expand my business and to purchase my own apartment for my family in the future.” 

He is requesting a loan to change his old truck.

loans.use: To change his old truck

loans.name: Anwer's Group

texts.en:
Anwer lives in Lahore, Pakistan, where her husband has had a grocery shop in the market for the last five years. With a good reputation among his customers, his business is going well, and since being confronted with the challenge of competition from other grocery shops he has become more efficient. Anwer has decided to help him financially by requesting a loan from Asasah so that he can stock more groceries in his shop and become more competitive.

Anwer herself is a housewife who is very co-operative by nature. She sells artificial jewelry to help support her family with her husband. Anwer is very hopeful that with the loan, her husband will be able to increase his profits which he will use to enhance his family’s living standard and help ensure a bright future for their children.

loans.use: To purchase groceries for grocery shop

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en:
Chantal is 42 years old and married with two children who are 11 and 14 years old. Chantal makes a living by selling a variety of goods in her small shop. This is her third successful year in the business. The business hours are from early in the morning until late in the evening.

Chantal needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company. With this loan, Chantal will invest in the additional business of selling foodstuffs (rice, Irish potatoes, beans, etc.) and drinks. With this additional business, Chantal will hopefully earn more profits which, in turn, will allow her to continue taking care of her children as well as building a strong business.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs and drinks

loans.name: Fransisca Linet Achieng

texts.en:
Fransisca Linet Achieng O. used to be a charcoal vendor before starting her current business of hawking second-hand clothes in 2005. She says due to economic hardship, she had to quit the charcoal business because it wasn’t earning her sufficient income. 

The clothing business has been good for her as from the income earned, she can assist her husband in providing for the family with ease, though she claims that it is not enough. She wants to expand her business and that’s why she has applied for a loan worth 30,000 Kenyan shillings to add more stock and boost the business. This will ensure an increase in her earnings.

She is 20 years old, married and a mother of three children. She lives in Nyamasaria.

loans.use: Increase her stock

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.en:
Jean Claude was born 1977 and is single. He owns a restaurant and his family members work in the private sector. All of them have to work hard and contribute to their family. Jean Claude employs two people from the community as helpers. This is his fifth year of success in his business. The hours of his restaurant are from 6 in the morning to 9 in the evening, every day.

Jean Claude is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase foodstuff and other materials to be used in his restaurant. With this loan, Jean Claude expects to save money for his future.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Grace Achieng’

texts.en:
Grace Achieng’ O. defected from being just a housewife and started hawking clothes in 1984 to generate income and be self-reliant. Shortly after that, her husband passed away, leaving her as the sole breadwinner taking care of eight children. 

Joining KMET as a community health worker, Grace enrolled in the microfinance program, where she has been able to learn more about business management. She wishes to get a loan worth 50,000 Kenyan shillings that will be used to add more stock to boost her business. Her dream is to expand her business.

She lives in Manyatta.

loans.use: Increase stock

loans.name: Radnaabazar

texts.en:
Radnaabazar R. is a 60-year-old woman who lives with her husband in the Arhangai province of central Mongolia. Her family lives together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent.

Radnaabazar operates a dairy retail business with the help of her husband. She began her business in 1998 with working capital of 350,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT). Since then, she has created a wide customer base and now her working capital has grown to exceed 1,200,000 MNT. 

She would like to grow her business and be able to save money so that she can improve her quality of life. Radnaabazar is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase a variety of products at wholesale prices and provide local customers with a high quality of dairy products.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Sope Naby Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOPE NABY est créé le 30 décembre 2009. Il est composé de 34 femmes toutes mariées. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, mères d’au moins de 02 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles conjugales nucléaires avec leurs enfants et époux. Ces femmes se sont organisées par voisinage et affinité et sont toutes issues du même village.

Dans l’intention d’augmenter leur pouvoir d’achat, elles ont décidé d’adhérer à l’institution CAURIE MICRO FINANCE. Elles sont à leur deuxième expérience avec cette dite institution et tous leurs prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés. 
Madame Aya F., debout à l’extrême de la photo, de noir  vêtue, est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 38 ans. Elle fait un petit commerce de tissus, d’ustensiles de cuisine, de téléphones portables, etc. elle s’approvisionne à Nouakchott capitale de Mauritanie. Sa clientèle est composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Avec ce prêt elle compte renforcer sa marchandise énumérée ci-dessus qu’elle vendra dans son village.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice qui lui permettra de participer aux différents besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
The SOPE NABY solidarity group was created on December 30, 2009. It consists of 34 married women. On average, they are 40 years old and have at least two children. They live in nuclear families with their spouses and children. They were brought together by affinity and proximity, and they are all from the same village. In an attempt to increase their purchasing power, they decided to join the CAURE MICRO FINANCE organization. This is their second experience with this institution and their previous loans were repaid without incident. Mrs. Aya F., standing at the far right of the photo and dressed in black, is the head of the group. She is 38 years old. She has a small business selling fabrics, kitchenware, mobile phones, etc. She gets her stocks in Nouakchott, the capital of Mauritania. Her clientele consists mostly of women. She plans to use her loan to boost her stocks of merchandise, which she will sell in her village. She expects to make a profit that will allow her to provide for the various needs of the family.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acheter des tissus, des ustensiles de cuisine et des téléphones portables

loans.name: Altansuh

texts.en:
Altansuh C. lives with his wife and three children in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, in Arhangai Province in Mongolia. Altansuh operates a consumer goods retailing business which he began in 2005. He would like to grow his business and be able to save money so that he can improve his quality of life and be able to afford his children's education payments.

Hardworking and modest, Altansuh dreams of having his own clothing shop in his town and now is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan in order to purchase a variety of clothing at wholesale prices in Ereen, a border city of China.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Kiran's Group

texts.en:
Kiran lives in Pakistan’s second largest city, Lahore. She is a working lady but she also manages the household chores efficiently simultaneously. She takes care of her family and does her boutique business. She takes orders from different clothes shops and provides them with finished goods in a given time and makes an income. As she is getting many orders from her customers, her work load has increased which makes her unable her to complete all of the orders on time. Therefore, she has decided to hire a helper in her boutique business. 

She has applied for a loan from Asasah for her boutique business. With the loan amount she will buy items such as clothes, beads, colored thread and sketches in bulk and fulfill the large orders on time. She has good confidence in herself and she is sure that by increasing the working hands she can make a quite good income with her business.

loans.use: To purchase material for boutique business.

loans.name: Altansuh

texts.en: Altansuh T. is 28 years old and lives with his wife and son in Arhangai province of Mongolia in their own ger-a traditional Mongolian housing tent. He was able to build his own home because of the success he has achieved by running his consumer goods trading business with the help of his wife. He started this business in 2008 with working capital of 450,000 MNT. The capital has increased to 1,800,000 MNT since. The increased profits are due to his good business skills and good customer service. Altansuh has cultivated very good relationships with both his customers and suppliers and believes that these relationships are the key to his success. He wants one day to create his own workplace. Altansuh would like to expand his product offerings and is therefore requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan in order to buy a greater variety of products.

loans.use: To purchase inventory.

loans.name: Felecite

texts.en:
Felecite was born in 1983. She is married with three children. Felicite's husband is a driver. They both work hard for the benefit of their family. Felecite owns a business selling clothes. She employs one person from her community as a helper. This is her second year of success in her business. The hours of her shop are from 7 in the morning to 5 in the evening, every day except one in the week.

Felecite is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more clothes to sell. With this loan, Felecite hopes to earn more profit which will allow her to buy her own house.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Kalsoom's Group

texts.en:
Kalsoom lives in the city called Lahore, with her family, in Pakistan. Her husband runs a construction supplies business while she helps her husband financially by doing an embroidery business. She prepares embroidered dresses and sells them to different cloth shops and generates an income for her family. She has been doing this work for over seven years. Embroidered dresses are in very high demand by the local people because they wear them not only on special occasions but also to parties.  

Kalsoom's husband has a shop in the nearby market and his clientele base is mostly construction workers. He not only sells to them but also supplies his products to different shops as well. Kalsoom has appied for a loan from Asasah for her husband. With the loan amount he will buy the construction supplies such as cement and sand in bulk in order to increase his profit. She is hopeful that with the help of investment her husband will be able to make more money and receive more orders.

loans.use: To purchase construction supplies for selling.

loans.name: Batrentsen

texts.en:
Batrentsen S. is 36 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Arhangai province of Mongolia in their own ger-a traditional Mongolian housing tent. His family has been living in this place for six years. He started his business in 2006 with working capital of 1,500,000 MNT which has increased to 4,000,000 MNT since. The increased profits are due to his good business skills and good customer service. 

Batrentsen has cultivated very good relationships with both his customers and his suppliers. He believes that these relationships are the key to his success. He has worked hard to own a small clothing shop where he sells a variety of clothes. Batrentsen would like to expand his product offering and is therefore requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan. He will use the funds to import a greater number of products from Ereen, a border city of China.

loans.use: To purchase inventory.

loans.name: Sope Mame Diarra Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOPE MAME DIARRA est créé le 30 décembre 2009. Il est composé de 31 femmes toutes mariées. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, mères d’au moins de 03 enfants. Elles sont toutes issues du même village et se sont organisées par voisinage et affinité
Dans l’intention d’augmenter leur pouvoir d’achat, elles ont décidé d’adhérer à l’institution CAURIE MICRO FINANCE. Elles sont à leur deuxième expérience avec cette dite institution et tous leurs prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés. 
Bado F., debout à l’extrême de la photo, bras croisés, est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 56 ans. Elle est vendeuse de fruits de saison. Elle s’approvisionne à Louga et revende au détail dans son village
Ce nouveau prêt lui permettra de renforcer  régulièrement  des fruits en quantité
Elle contribue à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de la famille tout en renforçant son niveau d’épargne.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Sope Mame Diarra was created on December 30 2009. It is made up of 31 women, all married. They have an average age of 45, and are the mothers of at least 3 children. They all come from the same village and have come together as friends and neighbors. With the goal of increasing their purchasing power, the women decided to join the Caurie Micro Finance institution. This is their second time working with Caurie and all their previous loans have been properly repaid. Bado F., standing, edge of photo, arms crossed, is the group's leader. She is 56 years old, and sells fruits in season. She obtains her supplies in Louga and sells at retail in her village. This new loan will allow her to regularly increase her stock of fruits. She contributes to the improvement of her family's living conditions and at the same time, increases her level of savings.

Translated from French by Sarah Puchner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruit in season

loans.name: Byambadorj

texts.en: Byambadorj D. is 48 years old. He lives with his wife and daughter in Arhangai province, central of Mongolia. He and his family have been living together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, for eleven years. Byambadorj operates a used clothing retail business in his town. He began his business in 2008 with the help of his supportive wife and daughter. Now, the family business is getting more customers. Byambadorj works hard every day. He would like to expand his business and own a clothing shop in his town. Byambadorj is requesting a 300,000 MNT loan to purchase clothing at wholesales prices from Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.

loans.use: To purchase inventory.

loans.name: Bushra's Group

texts.en: Bushra is married to Amjed P., who operates a medical store in the main market of the city of Lahore, Pakistan. Bushra herself is a housewife. She carries out her responsibilities as a housewife and a mother as well. Life in a big city is not easy. It takes continuous effort and hard work in order to make money to fulfill basic needs. As inflation in Pakistan is increasing day-by-day, it has become harder to meet the basic needs of the family. To run a business in this situation, one can only survive when one has good existing stock to compete with other businesses. Therefore, Bushra has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband. With the loan, he will buy medicines in bulk and expand his medical store.

loans.use: To purchase medicines for a medical store

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 46-year-old married man with two children. He is an experienced construction worker. He is especially talented at completing woodwork projects. He works on a freelance basis upon request of customers or through some entrepreneurs that we work with. He is the main provider for his family; that's why he works very hard to meet their needs. He is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase more wood to be prepared for his newest project. Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him (i.e., blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his picture, not indicating his name and location, etc.) Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers. About Ameen: Ameen s.a.l. has been a major player in the Lebanese microfinance sector since 1999. Originally a micro-credit program created by CHF International, Ameen evolved to become Ameen s.a.l. in 2003, a Lebanese services company. In 2007, Ameen s.a.l. registered with the Central Bank of Lebanon to become the first Lebanese financial institution specializing in microfinance. At Ameen s.a.l., we pledge to provide financial services to the largest number of micro- and small entrepreneurs and to the working poor, to help them develop their businesses and improve their incomes. Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loans from Kiva to offer lower-interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high-quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: Purchase more wood

loans.name: Davaanyam

texts.en: Davaanyam D. is 45 years old and has been living with her two children in Arhangai province in central Mongolia for six years. She and his family live together in a ger (a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent). Davaanyam operates a used clothing business out of a stall in the local market of her town. She started her business in 2008 with 450,000 tugriks (MNT) initial working capital. In a short time, Davaanyam has made much progress in growing her business and her earnings have enabled her to afford her daughter's tuition fees. Her working capital has now reached 1,500,000 MNT. For the future, she hopes to grow her business further and says, "My future business growth will help me with buying my children their own house." Davaanyam is a friendly and hardworking woman who is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more clothes. She wants to increase her clothing inventory at wholesale prices and sell her stock out of a stall in her town.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Manal

texts.en:
Manal Qabani is a 35-year-old mother. She has two sons and one daughter who are 15, 4 and 1 year old. Manal is married to Khamees Qabani, who works as a taxi driver in Deir Al-Balah, a city in the Gaza Strip. 

Manal's husband has been a taxi driver for 4 years. The old car he uses needs expensive maintenance work, so he decided to sell it and buy a new one.

Manal's husband needs $2000 dollar to be able to buy a new car, so Manal came to FATEN and took a loan to help her husband, because the taxi is the only source of income for the family. 

Kahmees appears in the picture with his youngest son, Ali, because Manal comes from a very conservative family.

loans.use: Buy a new taxi

loans.name: Rukhsana's Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana is a resident of the city of Lahore with her husband and children. She is a housewife and stays at home to manage the household chores and take care of her family and home. Her husband sells construction supplies. He has had this business for the last nine years. He has a shop in the main market which enables him to reach more customers to sell his supplies. His business is not doing well these days, because he does not have sufficient stock to meet the orders of his customers. 

Rukhsana has applied for a loan from Asasah to help her husband. With the loan, her husband will buy construction supplies such as cement and sand in bulk for his shop which will increase his chance of making more money. Rukhsana is sure that her husband is a very hard worker and he will never let her down.

Note: In this photo, they are standing in Bushra's grocery shop (a group member).

loans.use: To purchase construction supplies to sell

loans.name: Phesila Akumu

texts.en: Phesila Akumu has been a cereal dealer since 2003 in Nyamasaria market in Kisumu. (She left her agri-base business which had many climatic challenges and could not adequately support her family.) She travels to Kibuye market on a daily basis to purchase her stock. Her endeavor to improve her business has been a great task due to insufficient capital, which is why she applied for a loan worth 20,000 (KES) to enable her to realize her dream of expanding her business. Phesila is 45 and married with four children.

loans.use: Improve her business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Philomene

texts.en:
Philomene is 34 years old and married with two children.  Philomene is commonly known for selling clothes and she has been in this business for about one year.  Her business hours are from 8 am to 8 pm every day.

Philomene needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company s.a.  Once given this loan, Philomene will purchase different styles of clothes.  With this additional business, Philomene will hopefully earn more profits and these profits will allow her to keep reinvesting for better financial stability.  In addition, she will create many sources of income in various areas, which will result in giving jobs to the people from her community.

loans.use: To buy different styles of clothes

loans.name: Munh-Erdene

texts.en: Munh-Erdene B. is 23 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in Arhangai province, central Mongolia. Munh-Erdene operates a retail clothing business which he began in 2008. He has proved to be a very hard-working entrepreneur with a lot of business and customer-service experience. He hopes to expand his business as well as enlarging the house in which the family currently lives. Munh-Erdene is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more clothing for his business from Ereen, a border city of China, and grow his working capital.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Nasira

texts.en:
Nasira N. lives in Kochkor, a village located four hours from the country’s capital. She has decided to take a loan to purchase two cows. Currently, she breeds and sells cattle after fattening them. Her husband helps. In her free time, and also to earn additional money, Nasira sews Kyrgyz national caps for men. Her husband is retired. She is 61 years old and has three children all of whom are married and live separately.

She has been breeding livestock for four years and makes 8000 soms each month. She would like to increase the number of cattle that she owns in order to earn more for her family.

Mol Bulak Finance is particularly proud of this loan since it is the organization's first individual loan! Please help us support Nasira!


--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase two cows

loans.name: Nargis Saleem's Group

texts.en:
Nargis Saleem is a resident of Murtaza Abad, which is located in a city called Vehari in Pakistan. She lives in a two-room brick house with her husband and five children: three sons and two daughters. Her eldest son runs a tea stall to financially assist his family. 
 
Nargis is a seamstress. She sews clothes for her neighboring clients to earn an income. She is very efficient in her work. She manages her sewing business and her domestic work very efficiently. She gives the required time to her family and takes care of them very well.
 
Her husband sells clothes. He buys clothes from the wholesale markets of Faisalabad and Multan and sells them in his local market to earn an income. His business is going well, but as the time is passing very rapidly, so are changes in dresses and designs in the fashion field. His business demands he keep aware of the new fashions and fabrics.
  
Therefore, Nargis has applied for a loan from Asasah for the fifth time for her husband. With the loan amount he will buy stock in bulk and increase the profit of his business. She is a regular client of Asasah. In the previous four years of loan experience, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed a single meeting.

loans.use: Purchase clothes for selling

loans.name: Sainte Bernadette Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de Solidarité Sainte Bernadette est créé depuis trois ans. Il est composé de 09 femmes toutes de l'Association des femmes Catholiques de la Paroisse de Louga. Elle participent pleinement aux diverses activité de ladite Paroisse. Elles sont toutes issues de la même communauté ecclésiale de Base.

Madame AWA S., debout à l'extrême gauche de la photo est responsable du groupe de solidarité. Elle est âgée de 39ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants en charge. 

Elle est membre du Banc Villageois des femmes Catholiques de Louga depuis trois. Elle a 6 fois de suite reçu de crédit. Elle n'a jamais eu de problème de recouvrement.

Elle est détentrice d'un kiosque  chez elle où elle vend divers produits tels; des cigarettes, du sucre, des biscuits, du savon en poudre et en morceaux, du thé etc. Elle pratique cette activité depuis 06 ans.

Son nouveau prêt lui permettra de renforcer son kiosque en marchandises et ainsi étendre son petit commerce.

Elle assiste son mari pour la prise en charge de la santé, la nourriture et la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
The Solidarité Sainte Bernadette group has been created three years ago. Its members are nine women belonging to the Catholic Women’s Association of the Louga parish. They full participate in various parish activities. They are all from the same church community of Base. Mrs. Awa S., standing on the far left on the photo is the group’s leader. She is 39 years old. She is married and the mother of seven children in her care.She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of Catholic Women for three [years]. She obtained loans six times, and never had any problems repaying them. She keeps a kiosk by her house where she sells miscellaneous products such as cigarettes, sugar, cookies, soap (powdered and in bars), and tea. She has been in this business for six years. Her new loan will permit her to expand her stock and grow her small business. She helps her husband to meet the expenses related to the healthcare, food, and schooling for her children.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing cigarettes, cookies, powdered soap, bars of soap, sugar etc

loans.name: Houssam

texts.en:
Houssam is a 38-year-old divorced man. He has four teenagers who are attending school. They live in Bint Jbeil. 

For the past four years, he has been working as a house painter as a freelancer to provide a better living for his family members. It’s been 12 years total for him in this domain of work.

This is Houssam’s fourth loan with Al Majmoua and he is requesting it in order to buy necessary industrial equipment to improve his business in a faster way. This loan will help him to greatly improve his family's living conditions and to improve his income to cover his most pressing needs as his economic limitations are an obstacle. His children will benefit from this new income since they need better conditions and independence.

loans.use: To buy necessary industrial equipment to improve his business

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 29-year-old single man living alone. He has owned a small cafeteria in his town since 2007 and has been working in this occupation for the past eight years. He offers all types of sandwiches. His freshly prepared goods are enjoyed by members of his village and neighboring towns. Being alone is very hard for him, and he has work hard to make his own business and meet his life needs. He is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase merchandise needed for his shop. In the future, he plans to enlarge his shop and make places to receive his customers, such as a restaurant. Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him (i.e., blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his picture, not indicating his name and location, etc.) Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers. About Ameen: Ameen s.a.l. has been a major player in the Lebanese microfinance sector since 1999. Originally a micro-credit program created by CHF International, Ameen evolved to become Ameen s.a.l. in 2003, a Lebanese services company. In 2007, Ameen s.a.l. registered with the Central Bank of Lebanon to become the first Lebanese financial institution specializing in microfinance. At Ameen s.a.l., we pledge to provide financial services to the largest number of micro and small entrepreneurs and to the working poor, to help them develop their businesses and improve their incomes. Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loans from Kiva to offer lower-interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high-quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy necessary merchandise

loans.name: Kassem

texts.en:
Kassem is a 32-year-old man. He is married and the father of four kids. Kassem pays attention to his future and the future of his family members so that he will walk in the world and prove himself a good human being. 

Kassem has been an expert at sticking tiles for 15 years, working as a freelancer since 1998. Kassem operates his business to bear the education expenses of his kids so that they get a quality education without any hurdles and financial problems.
 
Kassem has applied for a loan from Al Majmoua to start a new business, dealing with plastic greenhouses. In addition to necessary plants, he needs to extend an irrigation network. This is his first time requesting a loan and he hopes it’s going to be positive for his family's way of living.

loans.use: To start a new business, dealing with plastic greenhouses

loans.name: Petronille

texts.en:
Petronille was born in 1971 and is married with three children. The first child is 16 years old, the next is 11 years old and the last one is 9 years old. Petronille owns a small business selling empty Jeri cans; this business is profitable in her region. Petronille employs one person from her community as a helper. The hours of her daily activities are from 7 in the morning to 7 in the evening every day except one day a week.

Petronille is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via vision Finance Company in order to expand her business through purchasing more empty Jeri cans. With this loan, Petronille will be able to save money and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Martha's Group

texts.en:
Martha lives in a city called Borewala (famous for its shrines) with her family in Pakistan. She is a seamstress. She takes orders from nearby areas and finishes the orders on time to make an income for her family. She uses a room of her house which is filled with her sewing machine and the ordered clothes. 

Her husband runs a grocery shop in the main market. By working in the main market, he faces challenges from the other grocery shops every day. He is confident about his work and deals with his customers with confidence.  

Martha has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband. With the loan amount he will buy more groceries for his grocery shop. By offering more variety to his customers, he will be able to make more money, which will enhance his family’s living standard. 

Martha wants to construct a room in her house and she is hopeful that with the loan profit, she will be able to fulfill her desire.

loans.use: Purchase groceries for a grocery shop

loans.name: Galina's Group

texts.ru:
Члены данной группы являются жителями с. Тюп, что находится на берегу высокогорного, красивейшего оз. Иссык Куль. Здесь также протекает река с одноимённым названием Тюп, которая впадает в озеро. Своеобразный рельеф и природные условия сами собой обозначили характер жизнедеятельности местного населения. Жители в основном заняты животноводством. Галина Джанжалова – лидер группы. Галине сорок один год. К этому возрасту, Галина воспитала четверых детей. В этом году в семье Галины особое событие – старшая дочь, которой уже исполнилось восемнадцать лет, поступает в ВУЗ. Остальные трое сыновей учатся в школе: в десятом, пятом и третьем классах соответственно. Муж Галины занимается крестьянским хозяйством. Дети активно помогают отцу ухаживать за скотом и в повседневных заботах по дому. Галина же нашла свою нишу в продаже молока, яиц и различных молочных продуктах. Она ежедневно сдаёт девять – десять литров молока, яйца и сметану в местный магазин. От продажи всего этого, Галина выручает около двух тысяч сомов ежемесячно. Причина, побудившая Галину обратиться за этим кредитом, заключается в том, что Галине необходимо закупить продукты питания для дома. С теми средствами, что у неё имеются, она не смогла бы купить продукты по оптовой цене. Галина всё подсчитала и надеется сэкономить значительные средства. Она привыкла так поступать, так как знает, что ей нужно заранее копить средства, чтобы обучить остальных троих сыновей в ВУЗах. 
Партнёры Галины по группе:
Джазы Ковшановой пятьдесят шесть. Джазы уже несколько лет вдова. У Джазы двое детей, которые во время летних отпусков помогают маме по хозяйству, а Джазы работает медсестрой. Джазы нужен кредит, чтобы купить пять овец. 

Тумаре Жороевой сорок два года. Она – мать пятерых детей. Вместе с мужем они занимаются сельским хозяйством. У них есть участок земли, а также небольшое поголовье скота. Тумара обратилась за кредитом, так как ей нужно купить сто литров солярки. 

Сандикуль Иманкуловой сорок два. Сандикуль растит семерых детей. Старший сын уже учится в ВУЗе. Чтобы прокормить семью Сандикуль открыла магазин, а её муж занимается домашним хозяйством. Сандикуль надеется получить кредит и купить смородину и сахар для реализации. 

Улгельди Уркумбаевой пятьдесят лет. Она разведена и воспитывает одну дочь. Улгелди работает в библиотеке и помимо этого , у неё имеется кое – какая живность. Улгельди надеется получить кредит и купить пять голов овец. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
The members this group live in Tup, which is located on the shore of the beautiful, high-mountain lake, Issyk-Kul. Here is where the river Tup runs into the lake. The landscape and the environment have shaped the lifestyle of the local population. Inhabitants primarily work in animal husbandry. Galina J. is the leader of the group. Galina is forty-one years old. Galina has raised four children. This year Galina's family is having a special event. Her oldest daughter, who is eighteen, is starting college. The other three sons go to school in the tenth, fifth, and third grades. Galina's husband runs the family farm. The children help their father to look after the cattle and to do daily chores around the house. Galina has found a niche in the sale of milk, eggs, and various dairy products. Daily, she delivers nine or ten liters of milk, along with eggs and sour cream, to a local shop. From these sales, Galina earns about two thousand som every month. Galina has applied for this loan to buy household food supplies. With the money she makes, she is unable to buy goods wholesale. Galina has calculated her potential savings and they are considerable. She is used to doing this, and she knows she needs to start saving now to put her three sons through college. Galina's partners in the group include: Jazy K. is fifty-six years old. Jazy has been a widow for several years. Jazy has two children who, during their summer holidays, help their mother at home. Jazy works as a nurse. Jazy needs a loan to buy five sheep. Tumara J. is forty-two years old. She is the mother of five children. She and her husband work in agriculture. They have land and a small herd of cattle. Tumara has applied for a loan since she needs to buy a hundred liters of diesel. Sandikul I. is forty-two years old. Sandikul is raising seven children. The eldest son is already in college. To support seven children, Sandikul has opened a shop, and her husband works at home. Sandikul hopes to borrow money to buy currants and sugar for making preserves. Ulgeldi U. is fifty years old. She is divorced and is raising one daughter. Ulgeldi works in library and, additionally, owns some animals. Ulgeldi hopes get a loan to buy five head of sheep. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase covenience goods: sugar and crops

loans.name: Twige Group

texts.fr:
Aline C. est une commerçante âgée de 33 ans qui habite la Commune de Rugombo de la Province de Cibitoke à l’Ouest du Burundi. Elle fait le commerce de produits vivriers des legumes comme les obergines,oignons et le manioc au marché de Rugombo et parfois fournit le marche central de Bujumbura, il ya de cela 2 ans. Elle a fait ses études primaires jusqu’en 6e année. Elle est divorcée. Elle arrive au 7e cycle dans le crédit communautaire avec Turame. 

Elle  est mère de 6 enfants âgés de 13ans, 10 ans,9ans, 7 ans et 2 jumelles de 3ans. Les 4 premiers sont à l’école.
  
Elle demande le crédit Kiva pour  augmenter la quantité de produits vivriers qu’elle achète pour les revendre aux clients. Elle espère qu’avec du bénéfice généré de ce crédit dans le futur, être à mesure d’acheter une parcelle pour construire sa propre maison et subvenir à ses besoins divers, assurer les frais de scolarité de ses enfants et autres besoins essentiels. 

 Elle est une des membres du groupe  communautaire« Twige ».
texts.en:
Aline C. is a 33-year old trader, who lives in the municipality of Rugombo in the province of Cibitoke in the west of Burundi. For the past two years she has been selling food produce: vegetables such as egg plants, onions and cassava, at the market in Rugombo, and she sometimes provides supplies to the central market in Bujumbura. She went to primary school up until sixth grade and she is divorced. She is taking out a seventh community loan from Turame. She is mother to six children aged 13, ten, nine, and seven years old, as well as twins of three years old. The four eldest children are at school. She is asking for a Kiva loan in order to increase the quantity of food products she buys to resell to her customers. With the profit she generates from this loan, she is hoping in the future to be in a position to buy a piece of land in order to build her own house and to provide for her various needs. She is a member of the "Twige" community group.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the quantity of food products she buys to resell to her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more ready-made clothes

loans.name: Nurjamal's Group

texts.ru:
Всем известна общая тенденция стремления молодых людей уехать на заработок в зарубежные страны или хотя бы в город из родного села. Большой город манит всех своим большим выбором работы, освещёнными улицами, множеством развлечений и многообещающими перспективами на грандиозный успех. Лишь немногие из молодёжи рискуют остаться в родном селе и строить свою жизнь там, где другие давно потеряли надежду. Герои нашей истории из тех немногих людей, которые решили остаться и добиваться успеха постепенно. Нуржамал Ибраевой сорок шесть лет. Нуржамал – мать троих детей. Её старшему сыну двадцать два года. Когда мать овдовела, старший сын решил остаться возле матери и быть всегда рядом. Сейчас Нуржамал работает в школе учителем. Семь лет назад она получила кредит и купила бычков. Сын подрос и заняв место отца, взял всё домашнее хозяйство на себя. Второй сын решил работать на стройке, а младшая дочь в этом году закончила десятый класс. Общими усилиями семье Нуржамал в течение семи лет удалось купить земельный участок и построить дом. Нуржамал не хочет останавливаться на достигнутом. Она обратилась за кредитом и надеется купить корову. В её планах на данный момент увеличить поголовье скота и достроить дом. 
Партнёры Нуржамал:
Тамаре Торубаевой пятьдесят шесть лет. Тамара вырастила пятерых детей. Четыре дочери уже замужем и сын также женат. Тамара с мужем занимаются откормом скота и при этом им помогают внуки, которых они взяли к себе на воспитание. Тамара обратилась за кредитом с целью купить две овцы на откорм. 
Сабырбеку Сыдыкбекову сорок восемь лет. Сабырбек – отец пятерых детей. Старшая дочь – преподаватель, вторая дочь – медсестра, а старший сын в этом году закончил школу. Младший сын только собирается пойти в школу, и две дочери близнецы пока ещё в дошкольном возрасте. Сабырбек обратился за этим кредитом, так как хочет купить запчасти на комбайн. 
Гулзат Жусубалиевой сорок пять лет. Гулзат – вдова и мать четверых детей. Старший сын помогает Гулзат по хозяйству. Гулзат ежедневно сдаёт по четырнадцать – пятнадцать литров молока и занимается откормом скота. Ей нужен кредит, чтобы восемь голов овец.
Турсунбеку Оморбекову шестьдесят восемь лет. У Турсунбека двое сыновей. Оба женились. Младший сын помогает Турсунбеку ухаживать за скотом и собирать корм. Турсунбек надеется получить этот кредит и купить шесть голов овец.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Everyone knows that young men tend to leave to work in foreign countries, or at least in big cities far from their home villages. The city suits everyone: the broad choice of work, the shiny streets, the entertainment, and the promising prospects of great success. Only a few youth risk remaining in their native villages and building a life there where others have long since lost hope. The heroes of our story are some of those few people who have decided to remain and achieve success gradually. Nurjamal I. is forty-six years old. Nurjamal is the mother of three children. Her eldest son is twenty-two years old. When his mother became a widow, the eldest son decided to remain near her. Now Nurjamal works at a school as a teacher. Seven years ago she took out a loan and bought calves. The son has grown up and taken his father’s place, doing all the work at home himself. The second son has decided to work in construction, and the daughter finished tenth grade this year. By working together over the last seven years, Nurjamal’s family has managed to buy a plot of land and build a house. Nurjamal does not wish to rest on her laurels. She has applied for a loan and hopes to buy a cow. She plans to increase her head of cattle and to complete their house. Nurjamal’s Partners: Tamara T. is fifty-six years old. Tamara has raised five children. Her four daughters and her son are already married. Tamara and her husband work fattening cattle, and they are helped by their grandsons whom they are raising. Tamara has applied for a loan to buy two sheep to fatten. Sadyrbek S. is forty-eight years old. Sadyrbek is the father of five children. His oldest daughter is a teacher; the second daughter is a nurse, and the eldest son left school this year. The younger son is the only one going to school. Two twin daughters are preschool age. Sadyrbek has applied for this loan to buy spare parts for a combine. Gulzat J. is forty-five years old. Gulzat is a widow and the mother of four children. The eldest son helps Gulzat at home. Daily, Gulzat sells fourteen to fifteen liters of milk, and she is works fattening cattle. She needs this loan to buy eight sheep. Tursunbek O. is sixty-eight years old. Tursunbek has two sons. Both sons are married. The younger son helps Tursunbek to look after the cattle and to collect feed. Tursunbek hopes get this loan to buy six sheep.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Mariama is a 51 year old business person. She is married and has one child. Her husband is also a business man. She has basic business skills; her business is located along Church Street in Makeni city. Mariama has been selling food to a large number of families both in Makeni Township and its surrounding villages for the past 8 years.She got her initial business capital from a family member. She starts selling at 7:30am and is back home around 6:30pm daily.

Mariama is now soliciting a loan of 3,000,000 in order to buy variety of food for her business. She believes this will help her satisfy her customers and generate more profit, so that her business will continue to grow. 

Mariama intends to educate her child to university level and buy a piece of land from the proceeds of this loan.

loans.use: To buy additional palm oil (food).

loans.name: Ragheda

texts.en:
Ragheda is a 37-year-old mother who has a son, Wadei, who is two years old. Ragheda's husband owns a small store. Aala Din, Ragheda's husband, sells stationary, gifts, dolls, books, notebooks and other school supplies. Ala Din's store is next to a girls' school in Dir Al-Balah.

Ragheda and her husband need more new items for the store, so she took a $1,000 loan to buy the items and to prepare for the new school year.

Ala Din appears in the picture, because Raghida didn't approve of having her picture published.

loans.use: Purchase goods

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Aminata is a dedicated and focused businesswoman. She is 30 years old, married, and has three children, who all go to school.
Aminata has a business selling jeans under the cotton tree at the central main market of Makeni. Her business location is very strategic, which has made it possible for her to attract many customers, mainly young people. She got her business capital from a daily savings club called “Osusu” and started her jeans business immediately. For the past four years, Aminata has run this business successfully.
Aminata has a good loan repayment history, and needs a loan of 4,000,000 SLL to buy a large stock of different types of jeans from neighboring Guinea, where jeans are cheaper, enabling her to make more profit. Aminata intends to use the proceeds of her loan to help her husband educate their children to university level and build a family house.

loans.use: To buy more jeans

loans.name: C5269 Abarwanashyaka Group

texts.en:
Egidia is 40 years old and is married with three children: the first one is 17 years old; the next is 14 years old; and the last one is 11 years old.

Egidia owns a small business selling cow meat and has been in this business for four years. The hours of her business are from six in the morning to six in the evening every day.

Egidia is a group representative of this group which contains eight people with different business. Some of them sell spare parts, some sell clothes, operate a pub, and so on.

Now, Egidia and her group are requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand their businesses. With this loan, Egidia in particular will be able buy more cows which will allow her to satisfy her customers.

With the increased profits that Egidia expects to earn, she will save money for her future and pay her children’s school fees.

loans.use: To buy more cows to expand her business

loans.name: Obidohon's Group

texts.ru:
В повседневном труде человек приобретает очень ценные качества. Во – первых он становится терпеливым и расчётливым. Пролитый пот и усилия прививают бережливость и уважение к труду в целом. Именно поэтому даже в условиях безработицы и экономического упадка, герои нашей истории ещё раз показывают, что для человека трудолюбивого работа всегда найдётся. Обидохон Жураева – лидер данной группы. Ей шестьдесят лет и после смерти мужа, она осталась с двумя детьми. К счастью дети подросли, женились и теперь даже внуки помогают Обидохон в её деле. А Обидохон в настоящее время занимается разведением скота и выращиванием хлопчатника. Старшему сыну тридцать девять, а младшему – тридцать. Оба её сыновей уехали в Российскую Федерацию на заработки. Но уехали они лишь тогда, когда убедились, что внуки смогут ухаживать за бабушкой и смотреть за хозяйством. Обидохон занимается животноводством уже двадцать пять лет. Раньше Обидохон занималась только выращиванием хлопчатника. Однако усердие в работе и старания Обидохон привели её к тому, что вскоре ей удалось купить живность и начать разводить скот. Она сумела женить сыновей и сейчас уже подумывает о том, чтобы справить свадьбу внуков. Обидохон обратилась за кредитом, чтобы купить корову. 
Партнёры Обидохон по группе:
Дилмураджану Маматалиеву сорок один год. У Дилмураджана две дочери и один сын. Всей семьёй они занимаются выращиванием и реализацией подсолнуха, картофеля и моркови. Дилмураджан недавно начал строительство нового дома. Сейчас он надеется получить кредит и купить стройматериалы для стройки. Дилмураджан ожидает получить второй урожай, и сейчас все его усилия направлены в эту сторону. 
Дилнозе Камоловой двадцать пять лет. Она замужем. Муж Дилнозы – частный строитель. Чтобы помочь мужу, Дилноза занялась животноводством. Она откармливает скот и перепродаёт его на скотном рынке. Дилноза обратилась за этим кредитом, так как планирует купить бычков. В будущем Дилноза хотела бы построить большую конюшню.
Хатиче Марипжановой пятьдесят три года. Хатича – вдова и мать двоих детей. Чтобы не зависеть от детей Хатича усердно занимается откормом скота. У неё имеется корова с телёнком и две овцы. Она также продаёт молоко. Хатича хочет получить кредит и потратить средства на закупку овец. 
--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
When a person works every day, he gains very valuable traits. First, he becomes patient and prudent. Sweat spilled and effort expended imparts thrift and respect for work as a whole. For this reason, even during times of unemployment and economic decline, the heroes of our story once again show that hardworking people always find work. Obidohon J. is the leader of this group. She is sixty years old, and after her husband’s death she was left with two children. Fortunately, her children have grown up, married, and now there are even grandsons to help Obidohon with her business. Obidohon works raising cattle and cultivating cotton. Her elder son is thirty-nine, and her younger son is thirty. Both of her sons have left to work in the Russian Federation. However, they left only when they were convinced that the grandsons could look after their grandmother and take care of the household. Obidohon has been working in animal husbandry for twenty-five years. Earlier, Obidohon only grew cotton. However, through Obidohon’s diligence and hard work, she produced enough cotton to allow her to buy livestock and begin to raise cattle. She has managed to marry off her sons and is already thinking about celebrating the weddings of her grandsons. Obidohon is asking for a loan to buy a cow. Obidohon’s partners in the group: Dilmuradjan M. is forty-one years old. Dilmuradjan has two daughters and one son. The entire family works cultivating and harvesting sunflowers, potatoes and carrots. Dilmuradjan recently has begun building a new house. Now he hopes to obtain a loan to buy building materials. Dilmuradjan expects to receive a second harvest this season, and now all his efforts are directed towards this. Dilnoza K. is twenty-five years old. She is married. Dilnoza’s husband is a freelance builder. To help her husband, Dilnoza works in animal husbandry. She fattens cattle and resells it in the cattle market. Dilnoza is asking for a loan to buy calves. In the future, Dilnoza would like to construct a big stable. Haticha M. is fifty-three years old. Haticha is a widow and the mother of two children. So as not to be dependent on her children, Haticha industriously works fattening cattle. She has a cow with a calf and two sheep. She also sells milk. Haticha wants to take out a loan to buy a sheep. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more clothes for the summer season

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy additional household utensils and plastic products for resale

loans.name: Kodirjon

texts.en:
Kodirjon is a very responsible and hardworking father who has been dedicated to his business of buying and selling clothing for many years. The need to improve his income and provide education to his two dear children is the reason he is courteously requesting this loan. Kodirjon has so far accessed loans from Kiva partner, IMON International, twice and has seen his business expand. With the income, he said he was able to educate his children, which is most important to Kodirjon. Today, he is requesting a loan of 5000 TJS to expand his business so that he can generate more income for the wellbeing of his family. Kodirjon is very grateful to everyone who helps him achieve his dreams with this loan.

More about Tajikistan
Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, with its epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands of people to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase new clothing for resale

loans.name: Tohir

texts.ru: Иброгимов Тохир проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 49 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Тохир имеет среднее образование. Более 6 лет занимается торговлей. Он в основном продает женскую обувь на рынке "Тиджорат". У него большая семья и ему приходится много работать, чтобы прокормить семью. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота. Он намерен закупить новый ассортимент сезонного товара.
texts.en:
Tohir I. lives in Yavan. He is 49 years old, married, and has four children. His wife is a housewife. Tohir has a high school education. He has been working in sales for more than six years. He primarily sells women’s footwear in the market called Tidzhorat. He has such a large family that he must work very hard to feed them. He is taking out a loan to increase sales. He intends to buy a new assortment of seasonal goods.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing inventory

loans.name: Nargiza

texts.en:
K. Nargiza has a successful business selling high quality clothes for children. She is a very experienced entrepreneur who has been in business for seven years. She offers her customers polite service, reasonable prices and quality products. Nargiza is divorced and has three children. She has requested a loan of 4000 TJS to increase her business capital. This loan will allow her to continue investing in her business and pursue her future goals of expanding and opening new sales locations.

It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands of people to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.
