loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es:
Juana Maria de 36 años de edad es casada, tiene 2 hijos menores de 9 y 7 años cursando la primaria.  Se desempeña como costurera del municipio de Juigalpa, confeccionando trajes, uniformes y otro tipo de ropa de acuerdo al gusto de sus clientes.  

Esta solicitando su 1er credito con el objetivo de comprar materia prima para su negocio (telas, ziper, hilo, etc), lo cual le permitira brindar mejores precios a sus clientes y mostrar diversidad a la hora de escoger los colores y tipos de tela para los trajes que vaya a confeccionar.   

El mayor sueño que tiene es poder darle a su familia las mejores condiciones posibles.
texts.en:
Juana Maria is 36 years old, married, and has two young children. The children are eight and nine years old, and they go to elementary school. She works as a seamstress in the Juigalpa municipality. She makes dresses, uniforms, and other types of clothing according to her customers’ tastes. She is requesting her first loan to buy raw materials for her business (fabric, zippers, and thread, etc.). This will allow her to offer better prices to her customers. It will also allow her to offer diverse options when it is time to choose colors and types of fabrics for the dresses she will make. Her greatest dream is to be able to give her family the best living conditions possible.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw material

loans.name: Mukuza Women's Group, Kyenjojo

texts.en: K. Joachim is 44 years old and the leader of his lending group in Kyenjojo. He is a hard working and determined man. He is married with 11 children, 9 of whom are still in school. Joachim has been a farmer in Kyembogo for 10 years. His major drawback has been the poor seasons that have often affected his crops; however, he has learned to time his plantings as a result of experience. He is able to generate 150,000 UGX as monthly profits, which help so much with increased investment. He needs a loan that will help him with his plantations: to buy more seedlings and clear his farm to produce more and generate more income.

loans.use: Buying more seedlings and clearing his land for fresh plantations

loans.name: Marcelo Ronny

texts.es:
Marcelo de 35 años, vive en las Orquídeas de Guayaquil (zona urbana, llamada las orquídeas porque en su descubrimiento habían muchas flores orquídeas), el tiene una carnicería desde hace años cuando uno de sus amigos le aconsejo que podía tener mucho mas dinero y pasar mas tiempo con su familia. 

Cuando su mama le ayudo con el dinero para invertir en carnes el comenzó a trabaja en un puesto vendiendo carnes de vaca, pollos etc. Poco a poco con esfuerzo a podido implementar mas carnes y ha podido pasar mas tiempo con su familia. Trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 19h00pm todos los días.  

Con el préstamo quiere comprar carnes, huesos, pollo, chanchos para su negocio, en el futuro quiere ampliar el loca y incrementar productos.
texts.en:
Marcelo, 35, lives in Guayaquil’s Las Orquídeas area (an urban zone so called because when it was discovered it had lots of orchids). He has had a butcher shop for several years since a friend suggested it to him as a way of earning much more money and having more time to spend with his family. When his mother helped him with funds to invest in the butcher shop he started to work in a stand selling beef, chickens, etc. Gradually, his efforts have led to his being able to add more meats and he has been able to spend more time with his family. He works from 8am until 7pm every day. He will use the loan to buy meats, bones, chickens and pigs for his business. In the future, he’d like to enlarge the location and increase his stock items.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For meats and chickens.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es: Magdalena es de 40 años de edad, casada, tiene cuatro hijos tres varones y una mujer, se dedica a confeccionar blusas para vestir, en la actividad tiene aproximadamente cuatro años de edad, solicita su primer préstamo para aumentar su capital de trabajo en tela y materiales para confección, sus referencias personales indican que es  una persona responsable y trabajadora, con la ayuda de su esposo podrá realizar los pagos mensuales.
texts.en:
Magdalena is 40 years old and married. She has four children, three boys and a girl. She makes blouses. She has been doing this for approximately four years. She is requesting her first loan to increase her working capital and purchase materials for sewing. Her personal references indicate that she is a responsible and hard-working person. With her husband’s help she will be able to make the monthly payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sewing materials

loans.name: Sylvie Varthan

texts.fr:
Femme de 41ans,mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont l'âge varie de 18ans à 2ans, quatre de ses enfants vont a l'ecole.
 Aec une charge de 7 personnes, elle se lançe dans le commerce 1990 avec un capital de 15000,et sa vente moyenne et journaliere est 22000 a 35000 par jour.

ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son activité en ajoutant des Boîtes de laits,sacs  de sucre,de douzaine de boites de beurre,café,du chocolat,spagetti,de la margarine,des oeufs et d'autre produits de première necessité.
sa stratégie est de reserver un bon acceuil aux clients, de chercher des produits vivre frais sur le marché et aussi  épargner pour atteindre son objectif.
Son ambition est d'étendre son activité afin de mieux satisfaire ses clients,d'effectuer des voyages afin d'être grossiste.

elle aimerait améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille, faire scolarisé ses enfants dans des bonnes écoles. pour son entourage elle est une bonne femme tres entreprenante.
texts.en:
Sylvie Varthan K. is 42 years old, married and the mother of 5 children whose ages range from 2 to 18 years. Four of her children are in school. With responsibility for seven people, she went into business in 1990 with a capital sum of 15,000 XAF and her average daily sales are from 22,000 to 35,000 XAF per day. This loan will enable her to expand her business by adding canned milk, bags of sugar, around ten boxes each of butter, coffee, chocolate, spaghetti, margarine, eggs and other staple products. Her strategy is to give a warm welcome to her clients, to seek out fresh staple products at the market and also to save to reach her goal. Her ambition is to expand her business so she can better satisfy her clients and to make trips in order to be a distributor. She would like to improve the conditions of her family’s life and have her children educated in good schools. According to her circle of friends, she is a good and very enterprising woman.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of canned milk, bags of sugar, about ten boxes of chocolate and nescafe.

loans.name: Yvone

texts.en:
Yvone was born in 1986 and is single. She lives with her parents; she has to contribute to providing all the basic needs for her family. Yvone owns a small business selling shoes and handbags; this business is profitable in Kigali city. Yvone employs one person from her community; her daily activities are from 7 in the morning to 6 in the evening every day except on Sunday.

Yvone is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business through purchasing more shoes and handbags for the purpose of satisfying her customers. In this way, Yvone will be able to earn more profit which will help her to change her living conditions.

loans.use: Expanding her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Alba Marina

texts.es: Alba tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación, por lo que siempre está pensando en la forma de generar ingresos para su familia. Alba se dedica a una librería y brindar el servicio de costura, hace mas de 33 años que tiene este negocio y el mantenerlo ha sido muy difícil, pero con la ayuda de los financiamientos ha logrado seguir. Sus 4 hijos trabajan de manera independiente y le ayudan en la atención con sus clientes, por lo que también se mantienen pendiente de ayudarla en lo que ella necesita. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de cuadernos, lápices, borradores, hoja de block y en la compra de tela para la elaboración de sus prendas de vestir. Sueña con ampliar su actividad y seguir innovando con otros negocios.
texts.en:
Alba has collaborated with the Fundación for a long time. She is always looking for ways to generate family income. Alba has a stationery shop and she’s also a seamstress. She has been in this line of work for over 33 years. Keeping the business afloat has been very difficult but with the financial help she’s managed to persevere. Her four children work independently but help her take care of customers and are always watchful in order to help her out in any way they can. The requested funds will be used to buy stock items like: notebooks, pencils, erasers, paper. She will also use it to buy fabric to make clothes. She dreams with enlarging her activity and continue innovating with other types of business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her stationery shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy materials.

loans.name: Edwin Martin

texts.es: Edwin es de 23 Años de edad es soltero, se dedica apresta servicio de alquiler de teléfono, cuanta con tres aparatos de teléfono en el parque de su localidad, su madre tiene establecido una tienes de consumo en su casa de habitación, juntos han salido adelante, su papa falleció hace varios años, solicita su primer préstamo para comprar un aparato de teléfono lo que le ayuda a mejorar su servicio y aumentar sus ingresos, en la actividad tiene aproximadamente tres años de experiencia.
texts.en:
Edwin is 23 years old and single. He rents telephone service. He has three telephones in the park in his area. His mother has a grocery store in her house. Together they have gotten ahead. His father died several years ago. He is requesting his first loan to buy a telephone, which will help him improve his service and increase his income. He has approximately three years of experience in this business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a telephone

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.es: Eugenio es de 49 años de edad, es casado, tiene cinco hijos un varón y cuatro mujeres, se dedica a confeccionar playeras de diferentes estilos y tallas, en la actividad tiene aproximadamente ocho años, con la ayuda de su esposa han salido adelante, solicita su primer préstamo para aumentar su capital de trabajo en tela y material de confección, sus referencias personales indican que es una persona responsable y trabajador.
texts.en:
Eugenio, 49, is married and has five children, one boy and four girls. He makes t-shirts in different styles and sizes. He has been in this line of work for about 8 years. With help from his wife they have managed to succeed. He is asking for his first loan to increase his working capital buying fabric and sewing supplies. His personal references indicate that he’s a responsible and hard working person.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Salamata

texts.fr:
Madame Salamata  D. est  une femme mariée  de 56 ans qui habite dans la localité de Bambilor.
Madame D. a quitté Yeumbeul, une des banlieues de Dakar  depuis 1990 pour venir s’installer a Bambilor. C’est en ce moment la qu’elle a commence à s’activer dans le secteur du commerce  en vue   de soutenir son mari dans la gestion de la dépense quotidienne. Ainsi elle s’adonne depuis 10 ans à l’achat et la vente de légumes. 
Elle est membre de la caisse depuis le mois de mai 2010. Elle sollicite un crédit  de 75 000 frs dans l’intention d’augmenter son fond personnel et de  renforcer son étal en légumes  tels que piments, concombre, épices, ails, etc. Socialement  son activité lui permet de compléter  quotidiennement  la dépense  à la maison pour améliorer la qualité de leur alimentation.
texts.en:
Mrs. Salamata D. is a 56 year old married woman who lives in the town of Bambilor. Mrs. D. left Yeumbeul, one of Dakar’s suburbs, in 1990 to settle in Bambilor. It is at this time that she started getting involved in the field of business in order to help her husband with managing day-to-day expenses. She has thus been devoting her time for the past 10 years to buying and selling vegetables. She has been a member of the credit union since May 2010. She is requesting a loan of 75,000 CFA francs with the intention of increasing her personal capital and stocking up her display with vegetables such as peppers, cucumbers, spices, garlic, etc. Socially, her activity enables her to cover daily household expenses and improve the quality of their food.

Translated from French by Marie-Elodie Bazy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Eugene

texts.en:
Eugene was born in 1982. He is single. He is the only one in his family who works. For that reason, Eugene works hard in order to provide everything necessary for his family. Eugene owns a small business selling various products such as cooking oil, bread, cosmetic products and so on. Eugene is seasoned in his business because he has three years of experience. He employs one person from his community as a helper. The hours of his shop are from 6 in the morning to 10 in evening every day.

Eugene is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business through purchasing more products for his shop. Eugene hopes to earn more profits, which will allow him to save money for his future.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es:
José Antonio C.  vive en el sur occidente de la ciudad del Barranquilla, se dedica a comercializar desde una vitrina donde vende en un local del centro, llamado San Andresito, tradicionalmente conocido por que es un lugar donde se comercializa mucha mercancía extrajera, como  electrodomésticos y en ese sentido todo lo que tiene que ver con tecnología de punta; él es  casado y tiene 4 hijos en las edades de 21 a 30 años.

Desde 1984 se dedicó a la venta de relojería y también a su mantenimiento, posteriormente agregó calculadoras, radios, televisores, surtidos de baterías y accesorios; en la actualidad, agregó nuevos equipos de sonidos para vehículos, bafles amplificadores, plantas eléctricas. Este es su segundo crédito  a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el anterior José Antonio  surtió con mas precisión su negocio, porque le permitió tener un capital de trabajo adicional, con el que compró de contado y adicionó cámaras que antes no vendía, de esta manera sus ganancias aumentaron  y logró beneficiar mas  a su hogar,  porque puedo darse algunos gustos  y eso siempre aporta a momentos de felicidad; todo ello sin dejar de mencionar  el importante aporte que hace su hija pues ella también trabaja y ayuda al sostenimiento del hogar. Con su credikiva solicitado, comprará celulares de mayor tecnología, así como  de MP4 y MP5 y radios con DVD para vehículos.

Su meta es siempre invertir en lo que tenga mayor utilidad y que a el le de satisfacción el venderlo y cumplir con sus compromisos económicos con mucha responsabilidad. Su desafío ahora es aumentar su utilidad para ayudar a su hijo a estudiar y que en un futuro sea exitoso.
texts.en:
José Antonio C. lives in southwest Barranquilla. He has a display case in a downtown location, called San Adresito, which is known for being a place where lots of imported items, like home appliances and state-of-the-art electronics, are sold. He is married and has four children between the ages of 21 and 30. Since 1984 he has sold clocks and watches and has provided repair services as well. Later, he added calculators, radios, televisions, batteries and accessories to his stock. Most recently, he added new sound equipment for vehicles, loudspeakers, power plants. This is his 2nd loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He used his previous loan to stock his business. He was able to pay cash for the merchandise and add cameras to his stock, something he hadn’t sold previously. This led to higher profits and still more benefits for his home; he was able to provide a few treats for the family and this always means moments of happiness. He wants to make it clear that all this is possible thanks to the help he gets from his daughter who also works and contributes to the household support. With his Kiva loan he will buy more technologically advanced cell phones, like MP4s and MP5s as well as car radios with DVDs included. His goal is to always invest in items that are most profitable and that he get satisfaction from selling them and meeting his financial obligations in a responsible manner. His challenge now is to increase his profits so that he can help his son with his schooling so that his future will be more successful.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy technologically advanced cell phones, like MP4s and MP5s as well as car radios with DVDs included.

loans.name: Rosa Crsitina

texts.es: Rosa es de 28 años de edad está unida con su pareja, tiene dos hijos un varón y una mujer, se dedica a tejer cortes típicos de la localidad, en la actividad tiene aproximadamente cinco años de experiencia, con la ayudad de su pareja han salido adelante con el negocio y su familia, solicita su primer préstamo para incrementar su capital de trabajo, compra de hilo y materiales para tejeduría, sus referencia personales indican que es una persona responsable y trabajador.
texts.en:
Rosa is 28 years old, is married to her partner and has two kids, a boy and a girl. She weaves clothes in the local style, which she has been doing for 5 years, and with the help of her partner, their business and family have come out ahead. She is applying for her first loan to increase her working capital so that she can buy yarn and weaving materials. Her personal references indicate that she is a hard-working and responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Halea Meese, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Weaving Materials

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: Satos es de 51 años de edad es soltera, tiene un hijo varón, se dedica a confeccionar playeras, en la actividad tiene aproximadamente cuatro años de experiencia, solicita su primer préstamo para comprar dos maquinas lo que le ayuda a mejora y aumentar su producción de playeras, sus referencias personales indican que es un apersona responsables y trabajador, con la ayuda de su hijo podrá realizar los pagos mensuales.
texts.en:
Santos, 51, is single and has a son. She manufactures t-shirts. She has been in this line of work for about 4 years. She is asking for her first loan to buy two sewing machines that will help her improve and increase t-shirt production. Her personal references indicate she’s a responsible and hardworking person. Her son will help her meet her monthly payments.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sewing machines.

loans.name: Roberto  Enrique

texts.es:
Roberto Vásquez tiene 56 años y vive en el barrio la Central del Municipio de Soledad, con su cónyuge y sus 5 hijos en las edades de 22 a 35 años; Su negocio es un centro de llamadas o SAI, donde adicionalmente vende productos de dulcería  y galletería y tambien tiene un puesto en el centro de Barranquilla donde comecializa CD y accesorios para celulares. Inició su negocio cuando observó la necesidad del sector, pues él primero vendía lotería y se hizo a una clientela  importante, porque tuvo un equipo de vendedores por más de 30 años. Roberto procede del Carmen de Bolívar donde se desempeñaba como empleado y luego empezó a trabajar por su cuenta. Toda esta habilidad emprendedora surgió porque es el hijo mayor de una familia y la falta de su papá hizo que trabajara  desde muy joven  y se hiciera  responsable para poder ayudar a su mamá. 
Desde el año 2002 creó su propia alternativas de ingresos; posteriormente  inició con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo organización que le ha suministrado 3 créditos que le han permitido multiplicar su capital de trabajo y las utilidades le han servido para sostener los gastos del hogar, comprar muebles, electrodomésticos, mejorar su vivienda la que inicialmente fue un lote que compró, y que poco a poco ha ido construyendo con sus ahorros y con mucho esfuerzo. En la actualidad solicita un credikiva por valor de $1.300.000 para comprar planes de minutos más extensos pues su mercado se ha aumentado y no son suficientes los que tienen, para comprar C.D y MP3 para la venta. 
Su meta es crecer como persona y adicionar a su negocio computadores.Aunque sabe que su principal desafío es el mínimo capital con el cual trabaja, también tiene otros desafíos como el de ayudar a su hija a que termine sus estudios universitarios, pues en el momento está en octavo semestre de Ingeniería de sistemas.
Está muy contento con el entorno que rodea a su negocio porque allí se ha hecho muy conocido y esta rodeado de vecinos tranquilos y de convivencia pacifica.
texts.en:
Roberto Vásquez, 56, lives in Soledad’s La Central neighborhood with his wife and five children who are between 22 and 35 years of age. His business is a telephone call center but he also sells candy and cookies. In addition, he has a stand in downtown Barranquilla where he sells CDs and cell phone accessories. He began his business when he recognized the need that existed in his area. He used to sell lottery tickets and acquired an important customer base that way. He had a sales team for over 30 years. Roberto is from Carmen de Bolívar where he used to be an employee until he started to work for himself. All of this business ability arose because he is the first-born son of a family and the absence of his father required him to start working from a very early age; he needed to be responsible in order to help his mother. Since 2002 he created his own way of earning an income. Later, he started collaborating with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo which has granted him 3 loans to date that have made it possible for him to increase his working capital and profits that have helped him meet household expenses, buy furniture, home appliances and make home improvements (which started out as an empty lot he bought and gradually has been using savings and much effort to build his home). He is now asking for a Kiva loan in the amount of #1.300.000 to buy calling plans with more minutes included because his market has grown and the ones he has are insufficient; he also wants to buy CDs and MP3s to sell. His goal is to grow as a person and to add computers to his business. Although he knows that his main challenge is the minimal capital he works with, he also has other challenges like helping his daughter finish her university education; she is currently in the 8th semester of Computer Sciences. He is very happy with the location of his business because he is very well known there and surrounded by calm neighbors who like to get along with each other.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy calling plans with more minutes included because the market has grown and the ones they have are insufficient; to buy CDs and MP3s to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: For clothing, shoes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es: Paulina es de 24 años de edad es casada, tiene un hijo varón, se dedica a confeccionar pantalones de diferentes tallas y estilos, en la actividad tiene aproximadamente cuatro años de edad, solicita su primer préstamo para aumentar su capital de trabajo en telas y materiales para confeccionar, sus referencia personales indican que es una persona responsable y trabajador, con la ayuda de su esposo realizara los pagos mensuales.
texts.en:
Paulina, 24, is married and has a son. She manufactures pants in a variety of styles and sizes. She has been in this occupation for about 4 years. She is asking for her first loan to buy fabric and sewing supplies. Her personal references indicate that she is a responsible and hard working person. Her husband will help her make her monthly payments.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Rosine

texts.fr:
jeune femme de 40ans, celibataire avec 2 enfants dont l'age varie entre 16 et 20 ans. En 1990 Elle se lance dans la vente des  fournitures des bureaux et scolaires quand elle arrete ses etudes pour cause de soutien.

Son etalage est installe devant le Centre Culturel Francais,ou il ya plusieurs administrations, ecoles ,lycee et ministeres ou les gens ont besoin des ses fournitures.

Avec le pret qu'elle compte recevoir elle va acheter 10 rames de papiers, les cahiers de toutes tailles, des bics de differents qualites et couleurs, trombones, agrapeuses, chemises et sous chemises...tout ce dont on a besoin pour le bureau et la scolarite.
A l'avenir elle a un projet d'ouvrir une papeterie, et avec ses epargnes , elle va continuer a aider ses enfants a faire des longues etudes universitaires, tres accueillante elle est vraiment disponible pour ses clients
texts.en:
A 40-year woman, single with two children, 16 and 20 years of age. In 1990, when abandoning her studies because of the need to support herself, she started a business selling office and school supplies. Her stand is located in front of the French Cultural Center, in an area with many administrative and governmental offices and schools (including a high school), where people have a need for her supplies. With this loan she is hoping to receive, she will purchase 10 reams of paper, notebooks in various sizes, ballpoint pens of various quality grade and color, paper clips, staplers, file folders and subfolder inserts…everything that is needed for the office and classroom. In the future, she envisages opening a stationery store. With her savings, she will continue helping her children receive a full university education. She is very friendly and always there for her customers.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing office and school supplies

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité  de Mujeres  Unidas  está integrada por mujeres de los diferentes  barrios  de la zona urbana de la ciudad de Ybycuí, departamento de Paraguarí, está compuesta  por 17 miembros  entre ellas se encuentran mujeres quienes tienen actividades  como , ventas de comidas , frutas, carne de cerdo, ropas usadas y nuevas, queso  y otras  se dedican a las ventas de lencerias; entre ellas también existen  mujeres  quienes desean emprender otras actividades ya que todas son  de escasos recursos.
Agradecen a la Fundacion Paraguaya por la oportunidad de poder realizar una actividad en su propia casa sin descuidar la educación de sus hijos.
El comité demostró la intención de trabajar  para salir adelante,  se han comprometido en ser solidarias  y responsables ante las situaciones que se puedan presentar.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Nicolasa quien se dedica al comercio minorista y de esa forma forma obtiene ingresi para ayudar a su familia con los gastos de la casa.
Asi ella todos lo dia atiende su negocio con las labores de la casa y en ella ofrece productos como articulols de la casa para el consumo familia, para limpieza, frutas y verduraz, ademas cuenta con ropas para vender.
Ella solicta el prestamo para invertir en su negocio y de esa forma ampliar el negocio, ella desea compra harina, fideos, azucar, articulos de limpieza, remera, sueter, y otros.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Unidas (United Women) committee is composed of women from different neighborhoods in the city of Ybycuí’s urban zone, Paraguarí department. It has 17 members among whom are women who have the following activities: food sales, fruit sales, pork sales, used and new clothing sales, sale of cheese; some sell lingerie. Among them are other women who want to start other activities because all of them are of scarce resources. They are grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity to undertake an activity in their home thus not neglecting their children’s education. The committee showed their intention to work hard to get ahead. They have committed themselves to be mutually supportive and responsible in the face of whatever situation might present itself. One of the members if Nicolasa who is a retailer; this is how she generates income to help her family meet household expenses. She tends to her business daily as well as to her household chores. She stocks items that families use daily, cleaning supplies, fruits and vegetables. She also stocks clothes to sell. She is asking for funds to invest in her business so that she can expand. She wants to buy flour, pasta, sugar, cleaning supplies, t-shirts, sweaters and others.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise like: flour, pasta, sugar, cleaning supplies, t-shirts, sweaters and others.

loans.name: Rudy Domingo

texts.es: Rudy es de 29 años de edad es soltero, se dedica a confeccionar prendas para vestir, en la actividad tiene aproximadamente 10 años de experiencia, la cual le ha ayudado para sufragar sus gastos, solicita su segundo crédito para comprar una maquina collaretera, lo cual le ayudara para mejora su producción, sus referencia personales indican que es una persona responsable y trabajador, su crédito anterior lo pago normalmente.
texts.en:
Rudy is 29 years old, single, and works as a tailor creating clothing. He has around 10 years of experience in this line of work which has helped him defray his living expenses. He is asking for his second loan to buy a sewing machine, which will help him increase production. His personal references say that he is a responsible and hard-working person. He repaid his previous loan on time.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Margot

texts.es: Margot, de 26 años, es una joven muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. Trabajando todos los días arduamente en sus cultivos, Margot trata de cambiar la vida que actualmente lleva, poniendo todo su esfuerzo.  Siembra continuamente plátano y café, productos que vende en el mercado de la ciudad de La Merced, ya que es ahí donde mejores precios obtiene. Le gusta mucho cuidar sus plantaciones de la plaga, es así que tiene 7 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es trasladar sus cultivos hasta el mercado donde los vende, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados. Con el tiempo espera mejorar sus productos y así obtener mejores precios. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, siente que este crédito le será muy beneficioso en su crecimiento como agricultora. En su grupo comunal es una socia muy participativa y solidaria. Con los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para mejorar la tierra que tiene para cultivar.
texts.en:
Margot is 26 years old and a very cheerful and hard-working young woman. She lives in her own house, and what she desires most is to improve her quality of life. Margot is trying with all her effort to change her current standard of living. She continuously plants bananas and coffee, products which she sells at the market in the city of La Merced, since she obtains the best prices there. She enjoys protecting her crops from pests. She has done this work for 7 years, and she thinks the hardest part is taking her crops to the market where she sells them, since the sacks she carries are very heavy. With time, she hopes to improve her products and thus obtain better prices. This is her third loan with MFP, and she feels that this loan will be very beneficial to her in her growth as an agricultural producer. Within her communal bank, she is a very participative member with a strong sense of solidarity. With the 2500 Peruvian new soles she is requesting, she will buy more fertilizer to improve the soil in her cultivated fields.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying fertilizer

loans.name: Olga Marina

texts.es: Olga es de 33 años de edad es unida con su pareja, tiene cuatro hijos dos varones y dos mujeres, se dedica a realizar costuras hace unos 3 años, solicita su tercer crédito para sufragar gastos persónale, la cual le viene ayudar a su familia, sus referencias personales indican que es una persona responsable y trabajadora, su crédito anterior lo pago puntualmente, con la de su esposo pagaran las cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Olga is 33 years old and lives with her common-law husband. They have four children: two sons and two daughters. She has worked as a seamstress for three years. She is asking for her third loan to help defray her personal living expenses, which will help her support her family. Her personal references say she is a responsible and hard-working person. She repaid her previous loan on time, and she and her husband will make the monthly payments.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Personal expenses

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: El Señor Juan Carlos se dedica a la fabricación de sombreros de cholitas esta es un actividad muy dificil y de mucho trabajo manual, ya que necesita de mucho tiempo y esfuerzo, el es una persona que vive solo, ya que se separo de su esposano hace mucho sigue atravesando todavia con los problemas de sus separacion ya que para el fue dificil pero esta saliendo adelante, tiene en su taller varios productos entre acabados y materia prima, este oficio lo aprendio hace muchos años del Señór con el que trabajaba como operario,  hasta que puso su propio taller donde tiene bastante acogida, el dinero del credito lo utilizara para la compra de material para la fabricacion de los sombreros ya que por estas fechas se dan muchas fiestas de zonas, teniendo pedidos en sombreros, es una persona que fue recomendado por un cliente que vive por la zona.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan Carlos works making hats. It is a very difficult job that requires a lot of manual labor, time and effort. He now lives alone, following a separation from his wife not that long ago. He is still dealing with the problems of their separation, as it was difficult for him, but he is trying to keep going. In his workshop he has many products ranging from supplies to finished products. He learned this trade many years ago as an apprentice until starting his own workshop that was very well-received. He will use the loan money to buy supplies to make hats, as there are currently a lot of parties and celebrations in his area and he has orders for hats. He was recommended by a customer who lives in the area.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies to make hats

loans.name: Ndeye

texts.fr:
Madame Ndeye D. est une femme mariée, elle  habite dans la localité de Bambilor et elle âgée de 46 ans.
C’est pour soutenir son mari qu’elle s’est lancée dans l’activité de commerce. Mais par la même occasion elle parvient à satisfaire ses quelques besoins personnels par le biais de son activité.
Depuis 10 ans elle exerce l’achat et la vente d’objets d’art au lac rose. Elle est sociétaire de la caisse de Bambilor depuis février  2010. Elle sollicite un crédit  de 150 000 frs dans le but de renforcer  son commerce par l’achat d’avantage d’objets  d’art  mais aussi de la diversifier car elle voudrait démarrer  la vente de robes et autres articles divers. Ce crédit  pourra contribuer a l’accroissement substantiel de ses revenus.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ndeye D. is a married woman; she lives in the town of Bambilor and is 46 years old. It was to support her husband that Mrs. D. went into business. At the same time, she manages to meet her own small personal needs by means of her business. For 10 years, Mrs. D. has been practicing the purchase and sale of objets d'art from Lake Retba (Lac Rose). She has been a member of the Bambilor credit association since February 2010. She is seeking a loan of 150,000 CFA francs with the goal of strengthening her business by buying more objets d'art but also by diversifying since she would like to begin selling dresses and other various goods. This loan could contribute to the substantial growth of her income.

Translated from French by Jessalyn Pinneo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing working capital

loans.name: Alix Alicia

texts.es:
Alix Jiménez G., tiene 46 años vive en el barrio siete de Abril al sur occidente de Barranquilla, con sus cónyuge y sus 4 hijos de 14 a 28 años de edad. Vende mercancías como ropas para damas camisas y pantalones unisex y también se dedica a elaborar artesanías en cerámica. Desde sus 17 años se casó y tres años después inició cursos en el SENA  de cerámica, marquetería y empezó a trabajar en esta actividad que aprendió. Luego realizó el curso de pedrería y lo adicionó a su negocio con un nuevo mercado de decoración de camisas; en la medida en que fue ampliando su mercado fue adicionándole otras actividades comerciales y desde hace 5 años adicionó a su negocio la venta de mercancías variadas y productos  de revistas especializadas. Así comenzó con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y su negocio ha cambiado, se aumentaron sus ventas con la adición de este nuevo capital de crédito; sus utilidades han aportado considerablemente a incrementar los ingresos del hogar. Este es su segundo crédito con esta organización y lo invertirá en la compra de mercancías como ropa para damas, camisas y pantalones en todas las líneas. Así mismo comprará insumos y materias primas para elaborar  adornos en cerámicas que ya tiene encargado.

Sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales, personas útiles a la sociedad, tener un local donde exhiba sus artículos de cerámica y artesanías y continuar capacitándose para mejorar su visión de negocio.
Su desafío más importante es que sus hijos continúen el camino de las buenas costumbres y esto la hace estar alerta al medio en el que se desenvuelven. Su mayor desafío es la competencia, pero siempre tiene nuevas estrategias para enfrentarla, aprovechando que en su barrio se ha mejorado la infraestructura de vías y los espacios comerciales se han incrementado, porque la vecindad realiza muchas actividades gastronómicas para lograr la unidad y conseguir mejoras en esta comunidad gestionadota de crecimiento social.
texts.en:
Alix Jiménez G., 46, lives in the Siete de Abril neighborhood in southwest Barranquilla with her husband and four children who are between the ages of 14 and 28. She sells merchandise like women’s clothing and unisex pants. She also makes ceramic crafts. She was married at 17 and three years later took courses in SENA (National Learning Service) in ceramics and cabinet making and started working in these crafts. Later she took the beading course and added these skills to her business making decorated shirts. As she expanded her market she added other commercial activities and five years ago included general merchandise and specialty magazine sales. This is how she started out with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and her business has been evolving. Sales increased with the addition of new loan capital. Her profits have greatly increased family income. This is her second loan with this Institution and she will use it to buy merchandise like: clothing for women, shirts and pants of all brands. She will also buy raw materials and supplies to make ceramic decorations that she already has pending orders for. She dreams with her children becoming professionals, people that are useful to society. She’d like to have a location to display her ceramic items and crafts as well as to continue updating her skills to improve her business’ vision. Her most important challenge is that her children continue along the path of good habits and this makes her be very alert to the way they are developing. Her greatest challenge is competition but she always has new strategies to face it taking advantage of the fact that her neighborhood has improved the infrastructure of its roads and commercial spaces have increased because the neighborhood has many gastronomic activities that lead to unity in the community which in turn lead to social growth.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise like women’s clothing, shirts, pants of all brands as well as to buy ingredients and supplies to make ceramic decorations for which she already has pending orders.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel was born in 1972. He is married with six children between 2 and 21 years old. Emmanuel owns a business selling various products like as you see in the picture. Emmanuel is a new entrepreneur because he has only one year and half of experience in this field. He employs one person from his community as a helper. The hours of his daily activities are from 6 in the morning to 6 in the evening every day.

Emmanuel is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business through purchasing more products for his shop. This loan will help Emmanuel satisfy his customers. With the profit Emmanuel expects to earn, he will be reinvesting in his business and paying school fees for his children.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell

loans.name: Jose Abraham

texts.es: José es de 63 años de edad es casado, tiene siete hijos cuatro varones y tres mujeres, cinco de ellos ya no dependen de él, junto con su esposa tienen establecido un negocio de venta de papas fritas y atol de arroz con leche es su localidad, sus ventas lo realizan todos los días por las tardes, durante el día presta sus servicio como albañil, juntos han sacado adelante su familia, solicita su segundo préstamo para incrementar su capital de trabajo, el crédito anterior lo cancelo puntualmente.
texts.en:
José, 63, is married and has seven children, four boys and three girls. Five of them no longer depend on him. With his wife he has set up a fried potato and atol de arroz (a drink made with rice and sugar) business in their location. They are open for business every evening. During the day he works as a bricklayer. Together they have succeeded in raising their family. He is asking for his 2nd loan to increase his working capital. He repaid his previous loan on time.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients.

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
Ángel de 30 años, vive en la Perimetral de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, a su alrededor tiene el estero salado), el tiene una tienda de viveres desde hace años atrás cuando su esposa murió. 

Para poder mantener a sus dos hijos el comenzó a vender verduras y frutas poco a poco con esfuerzo alcanzo a tener suficiente dinero para comprar vitrinas y readecuar el loca, ahora trabaja desde las 06h00am hasta las 21h00pm todos los días, vende frutas, lácteos, bebidas, legumbres etc.  

Para seguir con su negocio y surtirlo mas el quiere con el préstamo comprar frutas y legumbres, en el futuro quiere tener otro negocio para sus hijos y tener una camioneta para mejor movilización de su mercadería.
texts.en:
Ángel, 30, lives along Guayaquil’s beltway (a periurban area surrounded by a salty estuary). He has had a grocery store for the last two years since his wife died. To support his two children he started to sell fruits and vegetables. Gradually, with much effort, he managed to have enough money to buy display cases and refurbish the locale. He now works from 6am until 9pm every day selling fruits, dairy products, beverages, vegetables, etc. To continue with his business and stock it better he needs funds to buy fruits and vegetables. In the future, he’d like to have another business for his children and have a van so that he can transport his merchandise more easily.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Juan Diego

texts.es: Juan es de 28 años de edad Soltero, tiene cuatro hijos un varón y tres mujeres, se dedica a confeccionar prenda para vestir de diferentes estilos y tallas, en la actividad tiene aproximadamente diez años de experiencia, solicita su segundo préstamo para comprar una  máquina para confeccionar sus productos lo que le ayuda mejorar su producción, su primer crédito lo cancelo normalmente.
texts.en:
Juan is 28 years old, single, and has four children, a son and three daughters. He manufactures clothing in different styles and sizes. Juan has approximately ten years of experience in this business. He is requesting his second loan so that he can buy a machine for making his products and improving his productivity. His first loan was repaid correctly.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: San Juan Group

texts.es:
El comité “San Juan” está integrada por 15  mujeres de los distintos   barrios de Ybycuí y del Asenamiento, departamento de Paraguarí,  entre ellas se encuentran mujeres quienes tienen actividades  como , ventas de remedio naturales, comidas , frutas, carne de cerdo, ropas usadas y otras  se dedican a la ventas de lencerias; dependiendo de la facilidad con que cuentan.
Asi cada una realiza cada una reliza su actividad y se sienten muyn satisfechas por la oportunidad que tienen con los credito ya que facilita mucho la realizacion de las actividades.
De esta forma una de las integrantes es la señora Cinthia quien se dedica a la  venta de lenceria por catalogos.
Ella trabaja visitando en horas de la tarde a sus cleintes y les ofrece sus productos mediante catalogos y de esa forma solicitan los productos de sus preferencias.
Esta metodologia de trabajp facilita el trabajo para ella ya que solo compra los pedidos de sus cleintes, y de esa forma no pierde el capital que invierte.
Solicita el prestamo para la compra de mercaderias como, lencerias en general, conjuntos de buzos con sueter, pantalones, y otros.
texts.en:
The San Juan Committee consists of 15 women from different neighborhoods in Ybycuí and Asenamiento, both of which are in the Department of Paraguarí. They are involved in various business activities selling items such as natural remedies, food, fruit, pork, used clothing, lingerie, and other items based on their respective abilities. Having their own businesses, the members are happy to come across such an opportunity. The loans have already helped facilitate the implementation of their businesses.

One of the members is Sra. Cinthia, who sells lingerie through catalogs. She works in the afternoons visiting her customers, offering them her products by showing them the catalogs, and taking orders based on their preferences. The work methodology endorsed by her group recommends that she buy only what her customers order, which prevents her from losing investment capital.

Cinthia is requesting a loan to buy merchandise such as lingerie, sweatshirts, sweaters, trousers, and other items.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase lingerie, sweatshirts, sweaters, trousers, and other items

loans.name: Nogaye

texts.fr:
Madame Nogaye S. habite à Bambilor. Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 10 et 26 ans. 
Elle a choisi l’activité  de commerce pour soutenir son mari dont les moyens sont  limités. Ainsi donc elle s’adonne depuis 16 ans à la commercialisation de légumes. 
Elle est membre de la caisse de Bambilor depuis le mois de mai 2010. Elle sollicite un crédit  de 100 000 frs pour acheter des légumes  et des condiments en vue de renforcer son étal. Ce crédit pourrait participer a l’accroissement de ses profits ce qui lui donnera l’occasion d’aider ses enfants à assurer les frais d’inscription et de scolarité et aussi a  payer leurs fournitures scolaires.
texts.en:
Mme Nogaye S. lives in Bambilor. She is married with five children aged between 10 and 26. She went into business to help out her husband, whose means are limted, For 16 years she has sold vegetables. She has belonged to the Bambilor caisse since May of 2010. She's asking for a loan of Fr 100,000 to buy vegetables and seasoning to stock her market stall. The loan will help to grow her profit so that she can pay her children's school fees and buy their school supplies.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Add to working capital

loans.name: Rack Top Mack Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité RACK TOP MACK est créé le 28 novembre 2008. Il est composé de 10 femmes toutes du même quartier. Elles se sont constituées en groupe par voisinage et par amitié. 

Fatou Bintou F. debout à l'extrême droite de la photo, emmitouflée avec une écharpe bleue est responsable du Groupe. Elle est âgée de 44 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants et tutrice de 2 autres enfants. 

Elle fait un petit commerce de fruits. Elle vend des oranges, des mangues et du pain de singe:(le pain de singe est le fruit du baobab) Elle pratique cette activité depuis plus de 5 ans. Elle s'approvisionne dans au marché du quartier pour faire du porte à porte pour vendre.

Avec son nouveau prêt elle va renforcer son niveau d'approvisionnement en achetant plus de fruits.

Les bénéfices réalisé à partir de son activité lui permettront de subvenir à ses besoins personnels et de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge financière de la famille.
texts.en:
The Rack Top Mack solidarity group was established on November 28, 2008. It is made up of 10 women, all from the same neighborhood. They formed the group based on their neighborhood and friendships. Fatou Bintou F. (standing at the far right of the photo, wrapped in a blue scarf) is the group's leader. She is 44 years old, married, the mother of 5 children and tutor to 2 other children. She manages a small fruit business. She sells oranges, mangoes and monkey bread (the fruit of the baobab tree). She has been running this business for more than 5 years. She gets her supplies at the neighborhood market in order go door to door to make her sales. With this new loan she will increase her stock by buying more fruit. The profits gained from her business will allow her to provide for her personal needs and to help her husband with the family expenses.

Translated from French by Jessalyn Pinneo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying mangoes, oranges and monkey bread (the fruit of the baobab tree)

loans.name: Nila

texts.es: Nila, de 48 años, es una mujer muy sincera y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. Los productos que con tanto esfuerzo y dedicación han logrado cultivar, le han ayudado mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. Todas las mañanas trabaja en sus tierras, ya que sabe que del cuidado que le brinde a sus platanales y cafetales dependerá la calidad de los productos que obtenga. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos y se siente muy feliz cuado los ve crecer abundantemente, tiene 28 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es llevar lo cosechado hasta el mercado de la ciudad de la Merced, que es el lugar donde lo vende, ya que los sacos en donde lleva los productos son muy pesados. En adelante, espera mejorar sus productos, para así poder obtener mejores precios. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente y esta dispuesta a hacerlo. En su grupo comunal es una socia muy solidaria y responsable. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para mejorar la producción de sus plantaciones.
texts.en:
Nila, age 48, is a very sincere and hard-working woman. She lives in her own house, and what she desires most is to improve her quality of life. With great effort and dedication, she has been able to cultivate crops which have helped her greatly in the progress of her work. Every morning, she works in her fields, since she knows that the quality of the products she obtains depends on the care she provides to her banana and coffee plantings. What she likes best about her work is taking care of her crops, and she feels very happy when she sees them growing abundantly. She has done this work for 28 years, and she thinks the hardest part is taking her crops to the market in the city of Merced, which is where she sells them, since the sacks in which she transports her products are very heavy. In the future, she hopes to improve her products so that she can obtain better prices. This is her second loan with MFP; she knows that she has to make all of her payments on time, and she is determined to do so. In her communal bank, she is a very responsible member with a strong sense of solidarity. With the 1000 Peruvian new soles she is requesting, she will buy more fertilizer to improve the productivity of her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying more fertilizer

loans.name: Bokk Xalaat Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité BOKK XALAAT est créé depuis deux ans. Il est composé de 11 femmes issues toutes du même village. Elle se sont organisées et constituées par voisinage et par affinité et partagent la même idéologie. 

Madame Aminata C., debout à l'extrême droite de la photo est responsable du groupe de solidarité. Elle est âgée de 58ans. Elle est mariée sans enfants mais a la charge de 03 enfants adoptés. 

Elle fait un petit commerce. Elle est détentrice d'une table à domicile où elle vend des beignets, des jus de fruits naturels, des balais traditionnels, des arachides etc.

Son prêt lui permettra d'acheter en quantité suffisante la marchandise énumérée ci-dessus. 

Son objectif est de construire une cantine et faire l'extension de son activité de petit commerce tout en renforçant son niveau d'épargne.
texts.en:
The Bokk Xalaat solidarity group was created two years ago. There are 11 women in the group, who are all from the same village. They decided to organize themselves because they lived close to each other, had the same interests and shared the same ideology. Mrs. Aminata C., standing at the extreme right of the photo, is the leader of the solidarity group. She is 58 years old and is married. She has no children of her own, but she is raising 3 adopted children. Mrs. C. runs a small business. She sells fritters, natural fruit juices, traditional brooms, peanuts, etc. from her home. The loan will allow her to buy stocks of these for her business. Her goal is to grow her business and build a canteen while putting aside some money for savings.

Translated from French by Eileen Jessop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies and expand her small business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: compra de materiales para confeccion y mercaderia

loans.name: Norbertina

texts.es:
Norbertina H. H., ha sido muy emprendedora. Sus padres con gran esfuerzo lograron darle una educación primaria y continuó por su cuenta con estudios secundarios y una carrera como técnico de oficina. Esta experiencia le enseñó la importancia de la educación, y ahora dirige todos sus esfuerzos para proporcionar una educación universitaria de su hijo. Está muy contenta con su anterior Credikiva y dice  que todos los tiene destinados para que su hijo finalice la carrera universitaria de Contaduría; En la actualidad  terminó de pagar el credikiva anterior y como su hijo ganó el semestre, pasó al séptimo, por eso ahora solicita un nuevo crédito por valor de $1.774.500 COP para pagarlo. Norbertina tiene un negocio de vender mercancia. Su primer crédito  con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo fue en el año 1994, por COP $ 110.000 , y desde entonces ha añadido 25 más préstamos individuales a su capital de trabajo. Continua con su meta de convertirse en una mayorista distribuidora y con su microempresa, quiere generar ingresos suficientes para mantener su hogar en las mejores condiciones posibles. Si usted desea conocer su historia este es su enlace en kiva:
http://partners.kiva.org/lend/169823
texts.en:
Norbertina H. H. has always been very enterprising. With great effort, her parents managed to provide her with a primary school education. She continued on to complete high school and start a career as an office technician. This experience taught her the importance of education and now she channels all of her efforts into providing a college education for her son. She is very happy with her previous loan from Kiva and says that it was used entirely for her son so that he can finish his university degree in accounting. Norbertina has already repaid this loan as her son competed the semester. Now that he is starting his seventh semester, she is requesting a new loan in the amount of 1,774,500 COP in order to pay for it.

Norbertina has a business selling merchandise. Her first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo was issued in 1994 in the amount of 110,000 COP. Since then she has taken 25 more individual loans to use as operating capital. She continues with her goal of becoming a wholesale distributor and with her microenterprise, she wants to generate sufficient income to maintain her household and provide the best possible conditions. To learn more about Norbertina’s story, details can be found from her previous Kiva loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for her son's seventh semester of university

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: BUYING FERTILIZER FOR HER FIELDS

loans.name: Modesta

texts.es: Modesta tiene 41años, por lo que tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación, por lo que ha sido un gran avance para su actividad. La actividad económica es una pulpería, en donde ofrecer una gran variedad de productos como granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos naturales, pan, jugos y otros productos para el consumo del hogar. Hace más de 22 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que es muy visitada por sus diferentes clientes, ya que además les ofrece la mejora atención. El destino del financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo necesaria para la materia prima de su establecimiento. Sueña con ampliar su negocio y aumentar su inventario.
texts.en:
Modesta is 41 years old and has worked with Fundación Leon 2000 for a long time. She operates a grocery store and has made great strides in her business. Modesta offers a wide variety of products such as basic grains, candy, natural sodas, bread, juices, and other items for household consumption. She has been in business for more than 22 years and has several different customers who come by to shop since she offers the best service.

The loan she is requesting will be used as needed operating capital to buy merchandise for her establishment. She dreams of expanding her business and increasing her inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to acquire more merchandise

loans.name: Sara Del Socorro

texts.es:
Sara es una mujer de 36 años, trabajadora, madre de dos hijos, casada, su esposo de oficio conductor.
Se dedica al negocio de venta de ropa y cosméticos desde hace dos años, pues ha contado con el apoyo de su familia como la de su esposo. Para la inversión.
Con el objetivo de poder aportar a los gastos, logrando mejores beneficios para su familia.
Mediante el financiamiento que la institución ha dado ha logrado mejorar su casa con el crédito anterior logro terminar un cuarto.
Y con este préstamo lograra hacer otro cuarto en la parte de atrás de su casa para poder cubrir la necesidad de privacidad de sus hijos ya que anteriormente todos dormían en un mismo cuarto lo que era incomodo. Y gracias a la oportunidad de Afodenic nuestras vidas han mejorado.
texts.en:
Sara is a hard-working 36-year-old woman. She is married and the mother of two children. Her husband is a professional driver. For the past two years, she has worked selling clothing and cosmetics. She received support from her family and from her husband for the investment involved. Sara's aim is to be able to contribute to the household expenses, thus achieving greater benefits for her family. Through the financing granted to her by the institution, she has been able to improve her home. With the previous loan, she was able to finish a room. With the current loan, she will be able to finish adding another room at the back of her home, so that she can satisfy her children's need for privacy. Previously, everyone slept in one room, which was uncomfortable. Thanks to the opportunity provided by Afodenic, she reports, "our lives have improved."

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying construction materials to add a room for her children at the back of her house

loans.name: Aissatou

texts.fr:
Madame Aissatou N. est une femme mariée. Elle habite dans la localité de Bambilor. 
Elle a choisi l’activité  de commerce pour soutenir son mari.  Ce qui l’intéresse  le plus c’est l’aspect lucratif de cette activité  qui lui permet de gagner des revenus. Elle pratique depuis 10 ans l’achat et la vente de légumes .Elle est membre de la caisse de Bambilor depuis le mois de mai 2010. Elle sollicite un crédit  de 150 000 frs qui est prévu pour l’achat de  piment, choux et carottes  dans le but de renforcer son activité. 
Madame N. a un projet d’achat d’une armoire c’est la raison pour laquelle elle pense que l’accroissement de son fond de roulement pourrait lui générer  des bénéfices plus  consistants ce qui lui permettra de réaliser  son rêve. Madame N. souhaite améliorer le cadre de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ms. Aissatou N. is a married woman who lives in the town of Bambilor. She chose this business to support her husband. Of greatest interest to her is the lucrative nature of this business, which allows her to earn an income. She has been buying and selling vegetables for ten years. Ms. N. has been a member of the Bambilor branch since May 2010. She is requesting a loan of 150,000 francs CFA for buying chili peppers, cabbage, and carrots with the goal of bolstering her business. Her plans are to buy an armoire. This is why she thinks that the increase in her working capital will be able to generate steadier profits for her. And this will enable her to realize her dream. She wishes to improve her family's living situation.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing her working capital

loans.name: Miguel Oswaldo

texts.es:
Miguel de 46 años, vive en la Perimetral de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, a su alrededor tiene el estero salado), hace años atrás el comenzó con una papelería y ahora ha implementado farmacia. 

Después DE tener su papelería el comenzó a trabajar en un hospital y decidió fusionarlo y tener también en su negocio una farmacia poco a poco con esfuerzo pudo readecuarlo. Desde ese tiempo ya tiene 25 años con su negocio trabajando desde las 08h00am hasta las 23h00pm. 

El quiere surtir mas su papelería- farmacia comprando con el préstamo cuadernos, plumas y medicinas. En el futuro quiere aumentar su negocio y readecuarlo.
texts.en:
Miguel is 46 years old. He lives along the Perimetral Highway of Guayaquil (a periurban area that is situated near a salt marsh). Several years ago he opened a stationery shop, but now he also has a pharmacy.

After he opened his stationery shop, he started a job at a hospital and decided to combine his two occupations by adding a pharmacy business. Over time he was gradually able to accommodate both ventures. Miguel has had his businesses in operation for 25 years. He works from 8am until 11pm.

With this loan, he wants to increase the inventory of his stationery shop and pharmacy by purchasing notebooks, pens, and medicines. In the future, he wants to expand his business and make the appropriate accommodations.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase medicines, notebooks, and pens

loans.name: Sope Serigne Babacar Samba Ka Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de Solidarité SOPE SERIGNE BABACAR SAMB. K. est créé le 30 décembre 2009. Il est composé de 29 femmes issues toutes du même village. Elles ont monté leur groupe par voisinage et affinité.

Madame Fatou L., mise en médaillon, tout à fait en haut à droit de la photo est responsable du Groupe de Solidarité. Elle est âgée de 44 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants et a la charges des 07 enfants de sa co-épouse décédée. 

Elle faisait de la transformation d'huile d'arachide. Mais avec ce nouveau prêt elle envisage faire de l'embouche ovine. 

Elle va acheter deux moutons qu'elle compte emboucher pendant au moins 5 mois avant de les revendre dans le marché de son village.

Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans le prise en charge de la famille surtout pour la nourriture.
texts.en:
The Sope Serigne Babacar SamB. K. Solidarity Group was created on December 30, 2009. There are 29 women in the group, all of whom are from the same village. They formed a solidarity group because they live near each other and have similar interests. Mrs. Fatou L., inset, is the leader of the Solidarity Group. She is 44 years old and married with two children of her own. She also cares for the 7 children of her deceased co-wife. Mrs. L. used to make peanut oil, but with this new loan she hopes to pasture fatten sheep for market. She will buy two sheep that she plans to fatten for at least 5 months before selling them in her village's market. Her goal is to help her husband meet the needs of the family, especially for food.

Translated from French by Eileen Jessop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two sheep to fatten for market

loans.name: Serigne Barra Sope Mohamed Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de Solidarité SERIGNE BARRA SOPE MOHAMED est créé le 30 décembre 2009. Il est composé de 21 femmes issues du même village. Les membres se sont regroupés par voisinage et par affinité.

Madame Anta F., debout à l'extrême droite de la photo et mise en médaillon en haut à gauche, est responsable du groupe de solidarité. Elle est âgée de 56ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants et a la charge de sa petite fille. 

Elle faisait la transformation et vente d'huile d'arachide. Avec son nouveau elle va changer d'activité en faisant de l'embouche bovine.

Elle va acheter une paire de moutons qu'elle va emboucher pendant 5 moins et les revendre dans les marchés de sa localité.

Son objectif est de constituer un bon capital épargne et de participer à la prise en charge familiale par la nourriture et la santé.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Serigne Barra Sope Mohamed was established on December 30, 2009. It is composed of 21 women from the same village. The members are grouped by community and by affinity. Ms. Anta F. (standing at the far right in the photo and appearing in the inserted portrait at the upper left) is the leaD. of the solidarity group. She is 56 years old, married, and the mother of five children. She also has responsibility for her granddaughter. Ms. F. makes peanut oil and sells it. With her new loan, she is going to switch to another business, the fattening of livestock. She is going to buy a pair of sheep, which she will fatten for five months and then sell at the markets in her town. Her goal is to save up enough capital and to help support her family by way of food and health care.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying two sheep

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es: El Sr. Lucio no esta casado pero es concubino(no es casado pero vive en pareja) con la Sra. Isabel tiene dos hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, Natural de Vallegrande hace 15 años mediante el sindicato agrario de Guaracal donde consiguio un terreno en la cual trabaja juntamente con sus hijos,en ella siembran (papa, maiz, yuca, arroz), para sacar a vender al mercado de El Torno. El señor trabaja ya 2 años con Emprender, también el es electricista en sus horas libres y tiene una casa en la ciudad de Sta. Cruz. el dinero de credito lo utilizara para contratar mano de obra para el chaqueo de su terreno se llama chaqueo al preparadon de la tierra para la siembra, dehierban aran la tierra, el Sr. Lucio es una persona muy trabajadora y esta muy agradecido con emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito. En la foto el Sr. Lucio esta acompañada de su querida esposa.
texts.en:
Sr. Lucio is not married, but he is in a relationship with his partner Sra. Isabel. They have two children who are of school age. He is a native of Vallegrande. Fifteen years ago, he joined the farmers’ union in Guaracal where he and his children work the land that he owns. They grow potatoes, corn, cassava, and rice and sell these products at the market in El Torno.

Lucio has been working two years with Emprender. During his free time, he works as an electrician and also has a house in the city of Santa Cruz. The money from this loan will be used to pay workers to prepare his land for planting using slash and burn techniques. They will also be responsible for plowing the land and removing weeds. Sr. Lucio is a hardworking individual who is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for demonstrating their trust by providing this loan. In the photograph, Sr. Lucio is accompanied by his beloved partner.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay workers to clear, plow, and remove weeds from his land

loans.name: Khadidiatou

texts.fr:
Madame Khadidiatou M. est une yoffoise  de 42 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 11 et 25 ans.
C’est la recherche de gains financiers  qui a poussé madame M. à épouser l’activité de commerce. Depuis plus de 6 ans elle évolue  dans la vente de  chaussures,  de tissus et d’autres marchandises diverses. 
Elle est sociétaire  de la caisse de Yoff depuis octobre 2009. L’argent qu’elle emprunte (200 000 frs) sera destiné à l’achat de chaussures et tissus pour la fête  de Korite qui est approximativement prévue au  debout  du  mois de septembre a Dakar.
Les bénéfices  réalisés  lui permettront d’assister son mari dans la prise en charge des besoins de leurs enfants dans le souci d’améliorer  leur cadre de vie.
texts.en:
Mrs. Khadidiatou M. is a 42 year old woman from Yoff. She is married and the mother of five children ranging in age from 11 to 25 years old. It was the search for financial gains that caused Mrs. M. to take on the job of running a store. For more than 6 years, she has increased her sale of shoes, fabrics and various other products. She has been a member of the Yoff fund since October 2009. The money she is borrowing (200,000 frs) will be put towards purchasing shoes and clothes for the festival of Korite which is expected to take place at the beginning of the month of September in Dakar. The profits she makes will allow her to help her husband to take care of the needs of their children in an effort to improve their standard of living.

Translated from French by Martha Schmitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase in Funds

loans.name: Maria De Lourdes

texts.es:
Doña Maria es una mujer que se ha esforzado en su trabajo un cafetín que logro ubicarse hace varios años, en donde hace una variedad de alimentos. El cual ha apoyado a su esposo en cubrir los gastos básicos, el trabaja de cadete de taxi, en donde hay días con pocos clientes.

Es por eso toma la iniciativa de trabajar para obtener ingresos. A través de los años ha venido mejorando su casa el cual lo ha logrado con el apoyo de la institución mediante el financiamiento ya que es el único medio para poder construir por que todo esta caro.
Lo que hará con este préstamo es la construcción de un cuarto, logrando privacidad. Y mejor comodidad ya que la casa es pequeña.
Comprara: piedra, diez láminas de zinc, diez bolsas de cemento, hierro, estribo y otros para comenzar la obra.
Sus planes es seguir trabajando, y lograr el equilibrio económico para cubrir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Maria is a woman who is dedicated to her work in a cafe. She was able to establish the cafe several years ago, and she makes a variety of food for it. This has helped her husband to cover the basic expenses. He is a taxi driver, and there are days when he has few customers. That is why she took the initiative to work in order to get income. Through the years she has been improving her house. She has done that with the help of a loan through the institution. It is the only way to be able to build because everything is expensive. She will use the loan to build a room for privacy and to be more comfortable. Her house is small. She will buy stone, ten zinc sheets, ten bags of cement, iron, buttresses, and other things to start the work. Her plans are to keep working and to achieve economic equilibrium to cover her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a room for privacy and to be more comfortable - buy stone, ten zinc sheets, ten bags of cement, iron, buttresses, and other things

loans.name: Vida 1 Group

texts.en:
Agustina is the coordinator of her group, Vida 1 (Life). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and three children. She says that her most difficult challenges are to keep her business and make it grow.  In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying spending time with her family.

Agustina is excited to be taking her fifth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and expanded her business, a fried food stand. She has had her business for over three years, after starting it with some savings. She plans to use this loan to invest in the food stand by buying plantains, potatoes, chicken, beef, flour, and other food items. She will use the profits to invest in her business by moving to another location. Currently her business is in her backyard and she wants to move to the main street of her neighborhood.
 
This Esperanza associate began with us because of the opportunity for people who want to invest in business. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in San Pedro de Macoris, a city famous for baseball players and sugar cane industries. The main economic activities are a free trading zone and a cement factory. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To buy goods for her fried food stand

loans.name: Vicenta Fermina

texts.es: Vicenta es de 19 años de edad, está unida con su pareja, tiene un hijo, se dedica a confeccionar delantales, en la actividad tiene aproximadamente seis años de experiencia, solicita su segundo préstamo para incrementar su capital de trabajo compra de materiales para confeccionar delantales, el préstamo anterior lo cancelo puntualmente, con la ayuda de su pareja podrá pagar las cuotas mensuales
texts.en:
Vicenta is 19 years old and united with her partner. They have one child.

Vicenta makes aprons and has approximately six years of experience in this activity. She is requesting her second loan so that she can increase her operating capital. Vicenta plans to buy materials for making aprons. Her previous loan was repaid on time and with help of her partner, she will be able to complete her monthly payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for making aprons

loans.name: Marta Yolanda

texts.es: Marta es de 21 años de edad, se dedica a confeccionar sudaderos de diferentes estilos y tallas, lo que le ha ayudado a sufragar sus gastos, en la actividad tiene aproximadamente seis años de experiencia, solicita su segundo préstamo para aumentar su capital de trabajo compra de materiales para confeccionar sudaderos, sus referencias personales indican que es una persona responsable y trabajado.
texts.en:
Marta is 21 years old and manufactures pullover jackets in different styles and sizes, which helps with covering her expenses. She has approximately six years of experience in this business.

Marta is requesting her second loan so that she can increase her operating capital. She plans to buy materials for making pullover jackets. Her personal references indicate she is a responsible and hardworking individual.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for making pullover jackets

loans.name: Bokk Jom Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de Solidarité BOKK JOM est né le 30 décembre 2009 lors de l'inauguration du Banc Villageois qui l'abrite: DIADIORDE. Il est composé de 22 femmes toutes issues du même village. Ce sont des membres qui ont des liens de familiarité et de parenté très étroits. 

Madame KENE S., debout à l'extrême droit de la photo est la responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 40 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants en charge. 

Elle fait un petit commerce de légumes. Elle s'approvisionne au marché hebdomadaire de Potou dans la communauté rurale de Léona distant à quelques vingtaines de kilomètres. 

Son prêt lui permettra d'acheter des légumes tels des carottes, des choux pommés, des navets etc.. Elle revend sa marchandise dans son marché local.

Son objectif est de prendre entièrement en charge sa famille par rapport à la nourriture, la santé, l'habillement Etc.
texts.en:
The solidarity group, Bokk Jom, was born December 30, 2009 at the time of the opening of the Village Bank which houses Diadiorde. It is made up of 22 women, all from the same village. These members have strong ties and are closely connected. Mrs. Kene S., the first on the far right of the photo, is the head of the group. She is 40 years old. She is married and the mother of 5 children, who are in her care. She runs a small vegetable shop. She re-stocks at the weekly market of Potou in the rural community of Léona, some twenty kilometers away. Her loan will allow her to buy vegetables such as carrots, cabbage hearts, turnips, etc. She resells her merchandise on the local market. Her goal is to meet the needs of her family entirely with regards to food, health, clothing, etc.

Translated from French by Martha Schmitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy vegetables

loans.name: Mateo Luis

texts.es: Mateo es de 29 años de edad, es soltero, se dedica a la carpintería fabricación de muebles, lo que le ha ayudado para sufragar sus gastos familiares, en la actividad tiene aproximadamente seis años de experiencia, solicita su primer crédito para incrementar su capital de trabajo, compra de madera, sus referencias personales indican que es una persona responsable y trabajador.
texts.en:
Mateo is 29 years old and single. He works as a carpenter and manufactures furniture in order to help his family cover their expenses. Mateo has approximately six years of experience in this business.

He is requesting his first loan so that he can increase his operating capital for purchasing wood. His personal references indicate that he is a responsible and hardworking person.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wood

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es: El señor Hugo, cliente antiguo de nuestra institucion se dedica a la actividad de filmaciones de eventos.Es un joven talentoso y muy dinamico ,ya que para los diferentes eventos que realiza pone todo  su empeño ,esfuerzo y dedicacion ,cabe recalcar que para todo filmacion de eventos toma los mejores angulos para asi mismo obtener un buen trabajo. el sr.
