Hugo, vive por el  norte mas especificamente  en el barrio juan pablo II,calle sinai , vive en la cuidad de santa cruz de la sierra. Don Hugo  acudio a nuestra Institución debido  a  que tiene bastante demanda y nesecita incorporar una nueva computadora mas para su negocio,(proceso de grabacion y modificacion en gral. en las filmaciones de eventos ),  por tal motivo decidio acceder a un Crédito en nuestra Institución, para poder de esta forma brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mr. Hugo, an old client of Emprender, films events. He is a talented and very dynamic young man who puts all of his determination, effort, and dedication into the different films he makes. It should be noted that for every event he films, he shoots from the best angles in order to obtain a good result. Mr. Hugo lives towards the north, more specifically on Sinai Street in the Juan Pablo II neighborhood, in the city of Santa Cruz de la Sierra. Mr. Hugo came to Emprender because he had a great deal of demand for his services and he needed to purchase a new computer for his business (filming and general editing of films of events). For this reason, he decided to take out a loan through Emprender, as this would allow him to offer better service to his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a computer for editing films of events

loans.name: Mame Isseu

texts.fr:
Mademoiselle Mame Isseu N. est une célibataire de 32 ans qui habite dans le quartier de Mbenguene  dans la localité de Yoff. 
Mademoiselle N. s’adonne à la vente de cigares  et d’accessoires pour fumeurs, une activité qu’elle a choisie par hasard lorsqu’elle a abandonné l’école. Elle pratique cette activité  depuis 7 ans au marché Kermel  au centre  ville à Dakar. C’est une collaboratrice de la société Marlboro.
Mademoiselle N. est membre de la caisse de Yoff depuis le mois de mai 2004.Elle a déjà  remboursé un prêt antérieur.  Elle sollicite un crédit  de 75 000 frs pour acheter des pipes, des cigarettes, des filtres cigarettes, des bonbons, etc en vue de diversifier ses produits offerts.
Elle espère  ainsi un accroissement de ses bénéfices, ce qui lui permettra d’améliorer  sa situation sociale.
texts.en:
Mlle Mame Isseu N. is a 32-year-old single woman. She lives in the Mbenguene neighborhood of Yoff. She sells cigarettes and smoking supplies, a trade she chose when she left school. She has been running her business for seven years at the Kermel marketplace in downtown Dakar. She holds a franchise from Marlboro. She has belonged to the Yoff branch since May, 2004, and has repaid one previous loan. She is asking for a loan of CFA 75,000 to buy pipes, cigarettes, filtered cigarettes and candy, planning to diversify her product lines. She hopes to increase her profits and so improve her standard of living.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Zoila Wendy

texts.es:
Zoila de 32 años, vive en una zona urbana en el suburbio de Guayaquil, hace unos años atrás ella hacia manualidades y dibujaba para tener ingresos para solventar sus gastos, pero como quería su propio negocio decidió invertir las ganancias de los dibujos en papelería.

Poco a poco desde que comenzó a dibujar e invertir su dinero comenzó a ganar dinero para hacer readecuaciones en su casa y construir un local para su negocio, por la buena decisión de tener más ingresos ella ahora tiene una papelería trabaja desde las 09h00am hasta las 20h00pm todos los días, su hija de 14 años le ayuda atender la papelería mientras que ella hace la comida. 

Para poder incrementar su papelería ella quiere comprar con el préstamo cuadernos, papelería, plumas, en el futuro quiere ubicar su negocio en un lugar mas concurrido.
texts.en:
Zoila, 32, lives in a built up area on the outskirts of Guayaquil. Until a few years ago she made handicrafts and drawings as a way to make ends meet, but wanted to start her own business and so decided to invest her profits from the drawings in a stationery shop. Little by little as she invested the money from her drawings, she began to earn enough to turn her home into a suitable location for her business. It was a good decision and she now has her stationery shop, where she works from 9am to 8pm every day. Her 14 year-old daughter helps in the shop when Zoila goes to make their meals. To grow the business, Zoila wants to buy notebooks, stationery, and pens with the loan. In the future she would like to relocate the business to a busier location.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Notebooks; stationery

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis V. tiene 52 esta casado, con Irene Rolón de 66 años   tienen  una hija de 14 años que esta estudiando, tiene su negocio hace más de 15 años, es una de las primeras despensas de su comunidad.
Su esposa le ayuda en el negocio, porque además don Luis trabaja en la chacra, cultivando para consumision familiar, y a la  cria cerdos,  dando fuente de ingreso a más de una familila de su comunidad.
Actualmente su despensa es una de las más surtidas y cuenta con muchos clientes, precisa del crédito para la compra de azúcar, fideos, harina, carne vacuna, aceite, etc., que lo va a conseguir a muy bajo costo.
texts.en:
Luis V. is 52 years old and is married to 66 year old Irene Rolón. They have a 14-year-old daughter, who is studying. Luis has had his grocery store for over 15 years and it is one of the mainstays of their community. His wife helps in the business, because Luis also works on the land, growing what the family needs for food and raising pigs as an additional source of income, which means the family is beter off than many in their community. The business has been successful and has many loyal customers. The loan will be used to purchase sugar, noodles, flour, beef, oil and other merchandise at a low price.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise including meat, vegetables, fruits, canned and packaged foods, cleaning products, haberdashery, hardware and gifts

loans.name: Mbollo Moy Dole Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de Solidarité MBOLLO MOY DOLE est créé le 30 décembre 2009. Il fait partie d'un des groupes de solidarité du Banc Villageois de DIADIORDE. Il est composé de 22 femmes toutes issues du même village. Elles ont monté leur groupe par voisinege et par affinité.

Madame Ndiouma B., debout à l'extrême droite de la photo est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 48 ans, elle est mariée et mère d'un enfant et tutrice de 02 autres. Elle est à sa secondes expérience avec l'institution de CAURIE-MICRO FINANCE. 

Elle fait un commerce de légumes. Elle s'approvisionne dans les marchés hebdomadaires pour revendre en gros et au détail dans son village. 

Son nouveau prêt lui permettra d'augmenter son approvisionnement en légumes. 

Elle soutien son mari dans la prise en charge familiale, par rapport à la nourriture, la santé et la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
The solidarity group, Mbollo Moy Dole, was created on 30th December 2009. It is one of the solidarity groups of the Banc Villageois in Diadiorde and is made up of 22 women coming from the same village. The women who set up the group are neighbors or friends. Mrs. Ndiouma B., who is standing on the extreme right of the photo, is in charge of the group. She is 48 years old, married and mother to one child, as well as being guardian to two other children. She is on her second loan from the Caurie microfinance institution. She trades in vegetables. She gets her supplies at the weekly markets in order to resell them on a wholesale and retail basis in her village. Her new loan will allow her to increase her stock of vegetables. She helps her husband to take care of the family, in terms of food, health and the children's schooling expenses.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase vegetables

loans.name: Cheikh Tidiane

texts.fr:
Monsieur Cheikh Tidiane G. habite aux Parcelles assainies  une des banlieues de Dakar. Il est célibataire et est âgé  de 37 ans.
Monsieur G. a une double activité. Il est tailleur,  une activité qu’il a choisie par passion et sur la recommandation de ses frères. Il  l’exerce pendant plus de 20 ans depuis qu’il a abandonné les études. ET les beaux habits qu’il confectionne et qu’il revend lui procure beaucoup  de plaisir a travers les profits qu’il réalise. Aussi parallèlement  il exerce l’entreprenariat en bâtiment  depuis 5 ans.
Monsieur G. est sociétaire de la caisse de Yoff depuis seulement Avril 2010.Il n’a jamais contracté de prêt au sein de l’institution. Il sollicite un crédit  de 500 000 frs pour renforcer son fond de roulement. Une partie de l’argent sera utilisée pour les besoins de la couture et une autre pour le financement de certains travaux commandés dans le domaine du bâtiment. Il aspire a l’accroissement de ses revenus pour ainsi améliorer  le cadre de vie de ses parents.
texts.en:
Mr. Cheikh Tidiane G. lives in Parcelles Assainies, one of the suburbs of Dakar. He is single and 37 years old. He has two activities. He is a tailor, an activity which he chose out of passion and on the recommendation of his brothers. He has been carrying this activity for over 20 years since he abandoned his studies. The beautiful clothes that he makes and sells give him significant pleasure as a result of the profits he makes. At the same time, he also has a building business. Mr. G. has been a shareholder-member of the savings institution in Yoff since April 2010. He has never had a loan from the institution. He is now requesting a loan for 500,000 francs in order to boost his working capital. Part of the money will be used for needs relating to his sewing activity and part for the funding of certain jobs that have been requested on the building front. His ambition is to increase his income in order to improve his parents' quality of life.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase of working capital

loans.name: Angelica Cecilia

texts.es: Angélica Cecilia tiene 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es brindar el servicio de panadería. Hace más de 5 años que tiene este negocio, cuando ella inicio no tenía el capital suficiente para ofrecerles a sus clientes una gran variedad de pan, debido a la buena administración de su negocio ha logrado que su  como semitas, picos, pan simple, rin y postres con el paso del tiempo y con sus clientes que recurren a su local ha mejorado. Actualmente solicita su primer financiamiento para la compra de materia prima como mantequilla, huevos, harina, sal, queso, leche entro otros productos necesarios. Ella sueña con poder construir su vivienda porque no tiene las condiciones necesarias.
texts.en:
Angélica Cecilia has 2 minor children who are in her care. She has had a bakery business for more than 5 years. When she started out she did not have sufficient capital to offer her customers a large variety of bread. Owing to the good management of her business, she has managed to now offer rolls, picos (a Nicaraguan specialty made with dough, sugar and cheese), plain bread, desserts and other items. Over time, and with her repeat customers, her business has improved. Now she requests her first loan to buy raw materials such as butter, eggs, flour, salt, cheese, milk, and other needed products. She dreams of being able to build her house, because she does not now have the necessary conditions to do this.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital to by supplies for her bakery

loans.name: Aurora Felicita

texts.es:
Aurora de 33 años, vive en Primavera de Duran (zona periurbana, con una ecología en disolución a las afuera de Guayaquil), ella tiene una papelería (en Ecuador se los llama “bazar”).   

Comenzó con la papelería para poder mantener a su familia, vendiendo cuadernos, plumas y papeles a sus vecinos y conocidos cuando completo el dinero para ubicar su pequeña papelería readecuo su casa y la ubico en la parte delantera de su casa. Trabaja desde las 07h30am hasta las 20h00pm todos los días.  

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cuadernos, plumas y vitrinas para su negocio. En el futuro quiere amplia su negocio y mercadería.
texts.en:
Aurora, 33, lives in Primavera de Duran (an urban area on the outskirts of Guayaquil whose natural ecology is fast disappearing.) She has a paper goods store (that in Ecuador is called a "bazar.") She started this business so that she could support her family, selling notebooks, pens and paper to her neighbors and acquaintances. When she gathered together enough money she reconfigured her home and located her store in the front part of her house. She works in the business from 7:30am until 8pm every day. With the loan, she will buy notebooks, pens and glass display cases for her business. In the future she wants to expand her business with more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy notebooks and paper goods

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Maricela is the coordinator of her group, Mujeres Luchadoras 1 & 2 (Fighting Women).  She makes her home in a simple structure with her long term partner and six children.  She says that her most difficult challenge is to build a house.  Now she pays rent.

Maricela is excited to take out her third loan through Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan to help grow her business. She has been in business for almost 15 years.  Maricela plans to use this loan to buy clothes like pants, t-shirt, cosmetics and vegetables to sell. 

She will use her profits to build a safe house and hopefully make her dream come true.  Maricela want to have a store and pay her loans back. 

---------------------------------------------
This Esperanza associate began with us because of the God's will and mercy. Her  story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in San Pedro de Macoris, a city famous for Baseball players and sugar cane industries, the main economic activity is Free trading zone, a cement factory, and others. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: Buy clothing and vegetable.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
La señora Miriam E. tiene ya mas de un año dedicándose a la venta de productos naturales, este negocio es una parte del ingreso familiar y que también su esposo trabaja.
Al negocio le esta haciendo falta mas mercancía ya que tiene varios pedidos pendientes para entregar y no tiene la mercancía. 
Solicita el préstamo para poder compara la mercancía ya que no cuenta con el dinero necesario y así mismo entregarla a tiempo a sus clientes.
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias que obtiene del negocio, ya que su esposo el señor Francisco Pérez se encargara de los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Miriam E. has been selling natural health products for more than a year. This business provides part of the family's income, as her husband also works. She needs more merchandise for her business, since she has various pending orders to deliver, but does not have the merchandise. She requests a loan so that she can buy merchandise since she does not have the necessary funds; in this way she can deliver her products on time to her customers. She plans to pay off the loan with the earnings she obtains from the business, since her husband, Francisco Pérez, is in charge of the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to invest in her business

loans.name: Rosavelia

texts.es:
Al negocio de la señora Rosavelia R. le está haciendo falta más variedad de mercancía y no tiene el capital necesario para la inversión que desea para su negocio.
Este negocio es la fuente de ingresos para su familia, ya que tiene un hijo que actual mente esta estudiando y quiere lo mejor para el.
Solicita el préstamo para que la inversión que necesita su negocio y así tener mas variedad de producto.
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias que obtiene del su negocio.
texts.en:
The business of Ms. Rosavelia R. is lacking a greater variety of merchandise and she does not have the necessary capital to invest in her business the way she would like to. This business is the source of income for her family. She has a son who is in school and she wants the best for him. She is requesting this loan to make the investment she needs in her business, and to offer a greater variety of products. She plans to pay back the loan with the earnings she will make from her business.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business

loans.name: Mujeres Positivas Group

texts.es:
Julia tiene 44 años y es conviviente, ambos confeccionan ropa. Ella tiene una bodega en el mercado D. la zona J D. Huaycán, venD. verduras y legumbres desD. hace más D. 15 años. Su negocio ha ido creciendo poco a poco. En un día normal ella atienD. aproximadamente 20 clientes en su negocio y le gustaría que Edaprospo realice más capacitaciones para tener más capital y ser capaz D. ampliar más su negocio.
Florina  tiene 43 años y es conviviente, tiene un comedor desD. hace 2 años. Preocupada por ayudar a sus hijos en sus estudios, tuvo esta idea.
Ella sirve en el almuerzo y desayuno y normalmente atienD. 50 platos en un día, utiliza sus préstamos para comprar el arroz y otras cosas para la cocina. Dice que es una gran ayuda para ella y que hace 4 años que trabaja con Edaprospo, además quisiera tener más talleres D. capacitación y aprender a cómo mejorar el servicio para sus clientes.
Sonia tiene 40 años, es separada y venD. ropa en el Mercado Central D. Huaycán ya desD. hace 8 años. Ella tiene su propio local y trabaja sola. Al principio vendía solamente juguetes pero ahora tiene más cosas como jeans, polos, chompas, etc. Le gustaría ampliar su negocio y tener más clientes porque en este momento solo atienD. 3 clientes por día.
texts.en:
Julia is 44 years old and lives with her partner. They both make clothing. She has a small stO. in the market in the J zone of Huaycán. She has been selling vegetables for mO. than 15 years. Her business has grown bit by bit. In a normal day she tends to approximately 20 customers in her business. She would like for Edaprospo to do mO. trainings so she could have mO. capital and be able to expand her business mO.. Florina is 43 years old and lives with her partner. She has had a small restaurant for the past 2 years. She got the idea to have this business because she was worried about being able to help her children with their studies. She serves breakfast and lunch and usually serves 50 meals per day. She uses her loans to buy the rice and other things for the kitchen. She says it is a big help for her and that she has been working with Edaprospo for 4 years. She would also like to have mO. training workshops and learn how to proviD. better service to her customers. Sonia is 40 years old and is separated. She has been selling clothing in the Central Market of Huaycán for 8 years. She has her own stO. and works on her own. At first she only sold toys, but now she has mO. things likes jeans, polo shirts, sweaters, etc. She would like to expand her business and have mO. customers because right now she only has about 3 customers per day.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products and ingredients

loans.name: Thelma Del Socorro

texts.es: Thelma del Socorro tiene 54 años, por lo que tiene más de 5 años que se dedica a su pulpería. Ya que esta es la forma de generar ingresos para su hogar por lo que siempre está pensando en ampliar su inventario. Esta no es su primera experiencia con financiamientos, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por mejorar su negocio. Ubicado en su actividad en su humilde vivienda, ya que la mayoría de sus clientes siempre llegan a buscar los granos básicos y otras cosas necesarias para el hogar. Este crédito es para la compra de materia prima y así aumentar su inventario con nuevos productos.
texts.en:
Thelma del Socorro is 54 years old, and she has had her local store for more than 5 years. As this is the means of generating income for her home she is always thinking of increasing her stock. This is not her first experience with financing, as she has always characterized it as a way of improving her business. Her business is located in her humble home, and the majority of her customers always come searching for basic grains and other things necessary for the home. This loan is for the purchase of raw material to increase her stock with new products.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchasing a pool table.

loans.name: Paulo

texts.es:
Paulo A. S.   es un señor de 42 años de edad el cual vive con su esposa en una comunidad llamada Santa Fe localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa y por estar muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, caña de azúcar, naranja.

Desde hace ya varios años Don Paulo  se dedica a la ganadería de doble propósito. Logra vender sus  productos a los vecinos de su comunidad quienes se muestran muy satisfechos con la calidad de los productos que ofrece,  en especial  La leche.

En estos momentos el desea obtener un microcrédito  por  ¢619.000 (seiscientos diecinueve mil colones), para comprar semilla de pasto  y mejorar las condiciones del corral donde tiene sus  vacas. Esto le ayudara a mejorar su negocio y generar los ingresos necesarios para construir su propia casa. 

Don Paulo es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Manantial de Santa Fe, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer   préstamo y con él espera crecer más a nivel personal y económico. Asegura que este crédito ha sido una gran motivación y trabajara fuertemente para seguir teniendo acceso a ellos y convertirse en un microempresario exitoso.
texts.en:
Paulo A. S. is a 42 year old man who lives in a community called Santa Fe, in Los Chiles in the province of Alajuela; this community is known for its mountains and for being very close to the northern border of our country. The main economic activities there are livestock and arable farming, specifically growing grains, sugar cane and oranges. For several years now, Paulo has been raising livestock. He sells his products in the local community, where people say they are very happy with the quality of the goods he sells, particularly the milk. He is currently seeking a loan of ¢619.000 colones ($1,200), to purchase grass seeds and improve conditions in the corral where he keeps his cows. This will help him improve his business and generate the income needed to build his own house. Paulo is a member of the Santa Fe Communal Bank, one of 100 such organisations EDESA runs in Costa rica. This will be his first loan and with it he hopes to improve himself personally and financially. He says that getting this loan is a great motivator for him and that he will work hard to ensure he can continue to access support and to become a successful micro-entrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wood and wire to build fences, and grass seed to improve the pasture

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
Santiago Gaitán R.    es un señor de 52 años de edad el cual vive con su esposa y tres hijos en una comunidad llamada Santa Fe localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa y por estar muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, caña de azúcar, naranja.

Desde hace varios años Don Santiago trabaja como peón de una Empresa exportadora de pina  de la Zona. Su espíritu emprendedor lo ha llevado a tomar la decisión de iniciar su propio negocio; venta de ropa a domicilio,  con el cual podrá mejorar sus ingresos y así compartir más tiempo con su familia.

El necesita un préstamo de ¢619.000 (seiscientos diecinueve mil colones) para comprar todo tipo de prendas y así poder venderlas en la comunidad. Asegura que su negocio  tendrá mucho éxito ya que no hay tiendas cerca de la comunidad.

Santiago es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Manantial de Santa Fe, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer   préstamo y con él espera crecer más a nivel personal y económico. Asegura que este crédito ha sido una gran motivación y trabajara fuertemente para seguir teniendo acceso a ellos y convertirse en un microempresario exitoso.
texts.en:
Santiago Gaitán R. is a 52 year old man who lives with his wife and 3 children in a community called Santa Fe, in Los Chiles in the province of Alajuela; this community is known for its mountains and for being very close to the northern border of our country. The main economic activities there are livestock and arable farming, specifically growing grains, sugar cane and oranges. For several years, Santiago has worked as a labourer for a company that exports pineapples. However, his entrepreneurial spirit has led him to decide that he will start his own business, selling clothes from his home. This will enable him to increase his income and also spend more time with his family. He needs the loan of ¢619.000 colones ($1,200) to buy all types of clothing that he will sell in the local community. He is sure that his business will be successful because there is no similar shop nearby. Santiago is a member of the Communal Bank of Santa Fe, one of 100 such organisations under the auspices of EDESA in Costa Rica. This is his first loan and with it he hopes to reach a new level of personal and financial success. He says that this loan is a great motivator and that he will work hard to ensure he can continue to access credit and to become a successful micro-entrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing that he will sell from home

loans.name: Rubén

texts.es:
A la vivienda de señor Rubén Muñez le está haciendo falta un cuarto al frente de su casa pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de realizar la mejora.
Es por eso que esta solicitando un crédito y empezar la construcción de un cuarto con el cual planea poner un negocio de venta de abarrotes.
Planea pagar el préstamo con una parte del sueldo que recibe de su trabajo en una agencia aduanal.
texts.en:
The home that Rubén Muñez is building for himself needs an additional room at the front. However, he doesn't have the money to buy materials and to pay someone to undertake the work. For this reason he is seeking a loan to begin construction of the extension, which he plans to use as a grocery store. He plans to repay the loan using part of his earnings from his job in an import-export agency.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To begin construction of an extension to his home

loans.name: Jessica Maria

texts.es: La Señora Jessica Maria tiene 23 años, su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general, hace mas de 2 años, que tiene esta actividad por lo que cuenta con muchos clientes por lo que siempre se preocupa por mantenerlos al ofrecerles productos como perfumes, cremas, ropa en general, sabanas, toallas, tratamientos y calzado. Para el futuro le gustaría ampliar su negocio y captar más clientes para así aumentar sus ventas para ella sería un buen beneficio. Es por eso que está muy contenta al solicitar este crédito pues es la primera vez así comprara la materia prima para su actividad.
texts.en:
Mrs. Jessica María is 23 years old, and for the past two years she has worked selling merchandise of all kinds. She has many clients that she provides with a variety of products like perfume, creams, clothing, linens, towels, and shoes. In the future she would like to grow her business and gain more clients in order to increase her sales. She is very content to be applying for her first loan because it will allow her to buy the necessary materials for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of general merchandise

loans.name: Jehova Es Mi Roca 4 Group

texts.en:
Marinelly is the coordinator of her group, Jehova es mi roca 4 (The Lord is my rock).  She makes her home here in a simple structure with her three children.  Being a single mom children, she says her most difficult challenges are to improve her business and to own a home.  Marinelly plans to continue to study and would like to travel.

Marinelly is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business.  She has had her business for over six years.  Marinelly plans to use this loan to invest in her business to buy bracelets, rings, watch, chains and others silver jewelry. She will use the profits to reinvest in her business and to build her house.
 
-----------------------------------------
This Esperanza associate began with us because she believe in Esperanza program, which come into community and give hope to those whose need help to do their business and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in San Pedro de Macoris, a city famous for Baseball players and sugar cane industries, the main economic activity is Free trading zone, a cement factory, and others. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: Buy items to sell.

loans.name: Aura Lila

texts.es:
Aura Lila de 52 años de edad es casada con el Sr. Octavio Lazo quien le apoya en la administracion de su pequeño negocio de venta de comida. Junto a ella y su esposo viven sus 2 hijos menores de 17 y 14 años respectivamente, estudiando la secundaria.  

Aura Lila esta solicitando su 7mo credito con el objetivo de fortalecer su negocio, comprando productos (arroz, aceite, otros) al por mayor para conseguirlos mas baratos y a la hora de procesarlos obtener mayores ganancias que le permitan el sosten familiar.  Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo y sus hijos quienes trabajan junto a ella.  

El mayor sueño que tiene es poder brindarle a sus hijos las condiciones necesarias para que viva bien.
texts.en:
Aura Lila is 52 years old and is married to Mr. Octavio Lazo who helps her in the administration of her small business selling food. She and her husband live together with their 2 minor children, age 17 and 14 years, respectively. They are studying at the High School. Aura Lila will be taking out her 7th loan with the objective of strengthening her business, buying products (rice, oil, etc) in bulk to get them cheaper so that they make a better profits that supports the family. She counts on the support of her husband and children who work together with her. Her biggest dream is to be able to support her children under the conditions necessary to live well.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase inventory

loans.name: Renato Juan

texts.es:
Renato de 50 años, , vive en la Perimetral de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, a su alrededor tiene el estero salado), el es comerciante informal de galones de agua, trabaja recorriendo y repartiendo las botellas de agua.

El comenzó alquilando departamentos pequeños para poder mantener a su familia pero como necesitaba mas ingresos decidió vender galones de agua en su casa, por esa buena decisión ahora vende cada galón a $ 2.50 y continua alquilando departamentos, su esposa le ayuda en la administración de los departamentos, mientras que el vende los galones. 

Para seguir con sus negocio el quiere comprar con botellones y cemento para mejorar los departamentos, en el futuro quiere tener una distribuidora de agua.
texts.en:
Renato, 50 years old, lives on the outskirts of Guayquil, and he works in the informal sector selling gallons of water. He works collecting and delivering water bottles. He began renting small apartments in order to provide for his family, but he needed more income. He decided to sell gallons of water from his home and now sells each gallon for $2.50. He still rents apartments, and his wife helps him manage his rental properties while he sells water. He wants to continue with his business and buy plastic bottles for water and cement to make improvements on his apartments. In the future he would like to be an official distributor of bottled water.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of gallons of water and cement

loans.name: Glenda Esther

texts.es:
Glenda es una mujer de 48 años de edad, comerciante de  cosméticos, y venta de comida los fines de semana. Logrando tener mejor ingreso
Gracias a su empeño ha logrado aumentar su inventario, y gracias al apoyo económico que Afodenic ha dado mediante los financiamiento.

Pues no ha sido fácil ya que es madre soltera de dos hijos que logro educar sola, el cual ahora aportan en  los gastos básicos como alimenticios.
Los productos que vende son marca Avon, pues trabaja mediante catalogos y encargos, pero siempre tiene productos. Aunque tiene poco es por eso con este financiamiento lograra la compra de variedad de productos como. Perfume de mujeres, de hombre, estuche de sombra, pintura de labios, maquillaje, vanidad, loción entre otros que son de necesidad y que se venden rápido
Su meta es poder poner una vitrina para exhibir sus productos y puedan apreciarlos para lograr ventas altas.
texts.en:
Glenda is a woman of age 48, a cosmetics retailer, and a weekend vendor of food. Through this she has achieved a better income. Thanks to her efforts and thanks to the economic support of Afodenic through financing, she has been able to increase her inventory. However, it has not been easy as she is a single mother of 2 children who has managed to educate herself, so that she now provides for the basic expenses such as food. She sells the Avon brand products, so she works through catalogs and orders, but she always has products, though only a few. That is why this funding will help her to buy a variety of products such as women’s perfume, men’s cologne, eye shadow, lipstick, make-up, and other products that are sold rapidly. Her goal is to have a display counter to display her products so that the customers appreciate the availability and she can achieve higher sales.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase inventory of perfume, lipstick, make-up etc for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buying calves

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a mill to grind corn and meat

loans.name: Fatima Del Carmen

texts.es: Fátima tiene 35 años, ella se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general y también brinda el servicio de triciclos, por lo que siempre está buscando la forma en cómo diversificar su negocio y mejorar sus condiciones económicas, ella ha demostrado ser una persona muy emprendedora con el tiempo ha ido mejorando, hace mas de 10 años que tiene esta actividad por lo que no ha sido fácil mantenerla. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de ropa, calzado, toallas, sabanas y cosméticos. Ella sueña con establecer una librería en su vivienda que le sea de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Fátima is 35 years old; she works sellling a variety of merchandise and also offers transportation service. She is always looking to diversify her business and improve her economic status. She is a self-starter and with time she has been improving her business. For more than ten years she has run this business, and it has not been easy. The loan will be used to buy clothing, shoes, towels, linens, and cosmetics. She dreams of opening a bookstore in her home, which would help her a lot.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing, shoes, linens, and cosmetics

loans.name: Cristales Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama CRISTALES porque la hija de la tesorera se llama Cristal, y en honor a la niña el grupo eligió ese nombre. Esta ubicado en  el Estado de Morelos. El grupo esta conformado por 13 integrantes.

La señora María R. M. ocupa el puesto de Presidenta del grupo tiene 24 años de edad, casada, estudió hasta la Secundaria, se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos

La señora Doris Arlen J. T. conocida por sus amigos como Doris, tiene 20 años y vive en unión libre,  trabajaba en una tortillería cuyos ingresos no le alcanzaban, por lo que inició con la venta de cosméticos, al paso del tiempo se dio cuenta que los ingresos por sus ventas eran mayores que el sueldo por su empleo por lo que decidió dejar de trabajar y dedicar el 100% del tiempo a sus ventas, mismas que hoy en día le permiten atender a su familia, tiene un niño de 2 años de edad, y su objetivo es tener un mejor nivel de vida.

En la actualidad esta diversificando el giro del negocio ya que esta iniciando con la venta de tupperware, sin descuidar la venta de los cosméticos, misma que le ha permitido salir adelante.

Con este crédito va a pagar sus pedidos de cosméticos y el primer pedido de Tupperware

En la fotografía de izquierda a derecha
Ma. De los Ángeles C. C.
Alejandra R. G.
Nataly C. C.
Cristina N. C.
María Teresa F. M.
Doris Arlen J. T.
Mercedes H. A.
Lucero R. C.
Noemí C. T.
María R. M.
Eufrosina J. L.
texts.en:
This group is called 'CRISTALES' because the treasurer's daughter is called Cristal, and the group elected this name in honour of her. CRISTALES is located in the Morelos state and is made up of 13 members. Señora María occupies the post of group President. She is 24 years old and married. María studied until secondary school and now works selling Mexican snacks. Señora Doris Arlen J. T., known to her friends as Doris, is 20 years old and lives with her partner. She used to work in a tortilla shop didn't earn enough so she began selling cosmetics. There came a moment when Doris realised that the earnings from her cosmetic sales were better than her salary as an employee, so she decided to leave her job and dedicate 100% of her time to selling cosmetics. This job also lets her attend to her family, as she has a 2 year old son. Doris's objective is to have a better quality of life. She is diversifying her business path and is beginning to sell tupperware, without neglecting her cosmetic sales. These have allowed her to move forward. In the photograph from left to right: Ma. De los Ángeles C. C. Alejandra R. G. Nataly C. C. Cristina N. C. María Teresa F. M. Doris Arlen J. T. Mercedes H. A. Lucero R. C. Noemí C. T. María R. M. Eufrosina J. L.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for cosmetics and Tupperware orders

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is a 60-year-old father of six who lives with his wife and two daughters in Los Chiles, located in the northern region of Costa Rica.

Like many member of the Los Chiles community, William is a farmer. He dedicates his time to the planting and harvest of various subsistence crops including, tubers and chili peppers. William is always busy, organizing his day so that in the morning he wakes up early, eats breakfast and then feeds his chickens and pigs. He then switches gears, taking on the work in the fields.

This loan will be used to finance the production of Habanero chili peppers. Specifically, William will use this money to purchase seeds, fertilizer, tools, pesticides, and other materials/ingredients necessary to the production of chili peppers. All labour and transportation tasks will be carried out by William and his family.

William dedicates part of his time as a hired hand on a nearby farm. He worries about the coming harvesting season and hopes that he will be successful this year. William’s goals are to maintain stability in his family, achieve higher production rates, improve his economic situation, and offer a better standard of living to his family.

A major difficulty and limitation for William has been his lack of working capital. He hopes to use this loan effectively to improve life on his farm for everyone.

Piper and Capiscum Processors Compañía Agrícola Industrial, or PROPICA, is an international buyer and seller of chili pepper and ground pepper products. In cooperation with Fundación Mujer, PROPICA has guaranteed to purchase the agricultural products (the peppers) that are to be produced with the help of this loan. PROPICA acts as a guaranteed client for small agricultural producers in the area of Los Chiles, thus ensuring that their products will reach market.

The collaboration of Fundación Mujer and PROPICA represents a unique opportunity to William, his family and his community. By offering a source of start-up capital, and a guaranteed client to purchase what is produced, this is a chance to improve family and community standards of living. Above all, William wants to take advantage of the current opportunity that has been presented; he wants to profit from this collaboration and see improvements in his neighborhood.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and nutrients necessary for the production of chili peppers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy corn, firewood, and gasoline.

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.en:
Ana is a 40-year-old mother of four who lives with her husband in Limón, located near the Caribbean coast of Costa Rica. The loan consultant who has been working with Ana over the past few months describes her as a humble, gentle woman who aspires to move up in the world.

In order to contribute to her family’s income, Ana has a business selling various products including bags, clothing and sandals. This loan will be used to invest in the purchase of such products which Ana will sell to members of her community.

Ana sells her products from her house. When she makes sales on credits, her sons help her to collect on what is owed to her. One of her sons contributes to the family income and Ana also takes care of a child from the community in order to earn extra money.

For business advice, Ana consults her husband and sons, although she must execute all the daily tasks associated with her business on her own (her children are usually studying).

Ana would like very much to one day own a small restaurant or “soda” as they say in Costa Rica. She feels that such an enterprise would allow her to better provide for her children. She hopes to send as many of them as possible to university. In the meantime, Ana says business is going well and she hasn’t had any problems yet.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing to sell

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras De Micaela Bastidas Group

texts.es:
La alcancía comunal “MUJERES EMPRENDEDORAS D. MICAELA BASTIDAS”, está conformada por 8 socios unidos y solidarios sobre todo personas muy trabajadoras que tienen metas por cumplir.
DesD. hace 10 años Diana Lourdes se dedica al negocio D. tipeos, fax y fotocopias, el cual lleva por nombre “CENTRO D. COPIAS ALBERT”, negocio que le ayuda a aportar con los gastos D. casa, la educación D. su hijo y otros gastos adicionales, ya que es madre soltera y solventa sola su hogar. Es una socia muy entusiasta por eso ella representa al grupo como presidenta.
Incursionó en ese negocio ya que hizo un estudio D. mercado y vio que era una zona estratégica para poner ese negocio, además se encontraba sola y con muchas necesidades que cubrir, con el esfuerzo D. su labor diaria en estos 10 años, ha logrado implementar su negocio y comprar tres fotocopiadoras. El gran sueño D. Diana es poner una cabina D. internet.
EL crédito recibido lo invertirá en la compra D. dos mostradores, todos nuestros socios se encuentran muy contentos y agradecidos por todas las oportunidades que les dan con los préstamos, porque D. esta manera ellos pueden tener una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
The communal bank "MUJERES EMPRENDEDORAS D. MICAELA BASTIDAS" [Women Entrepreneurs of Micaela Bastidas] is maD. up of eight partners who are solidly united,. Each of them are hard workers and have goals. For the past ten years, Diana Lourdes has been dedicated to the business of typing, faxing, and photocopying. She has operated using the business name "Centro D. Copias Albert" [Albert Copy Center]. This business pays for her home expenses, the education of her children, and for other expenses, as she is a single parent, and the sole provider for her family. She is a very enthusiastic member, and for this reason, she represents the group as president. She got started in this business after doing a market study which showed that this area was a strategically sound place to start such a business. She also got started when she found herself single with many expenses to cover. With her daily hard work over the past 10 years, she has gotten the business off the ground and has been able to purchase three photocopiers. Diana's big dream is to open an Internet cafe. This loan will be used to purchase two display counters. All of the members are extremely happy and grateful for the opportunities they have been given through these loans. Because of them, they have been able to gain a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Aaron Cannon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two display counters

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es: La Sra. Rosmery,  es Bioquímica de Profesión y hace 10 años que desempeña esta actividad de forma independiente en su Laboratorio Químico ubicado al frente del Hospital Francés, Zona Sur de nuestra Ciudad, cuenta con el apoyo de sus padres y su esposo Don Juan Carlos el cual desempeña actividades de recreación y aventura para Empresas del Sector Empresarial. Doña Rosmery trabaja con varias empresas importadoras del rubro de la medicina, las cuales le proveen de Insumos Quimicos (Reactivos) para su Laboratorio, ademas de aquello se encuentra estrategicamente ubicado al frente de un prestigioso Centro Medico como lo es el Hospital Frances. Los clientes de Doña Rosmery son por lo general niños y pesonas mayores con problemas de azucar, chagas, dengue, colesterol y drogas por lo cual necesita contar frecuentemente con diversos reactivos quimicos para sus análisis, este fué el motivo por el cual tuvo la necesidad de acercarse por nuestra Institución, ya que en los ultimos meses y por motivos de su embarazo no estuvo desempeñando sus actividades con total normalidad. Doña Rosmery al igual que su esposo no cuentan con deudas en ninguna otra Entidad Financiera razón por la cual no se le negó dicho prestamo y además de aquello cuenta con domicilio conocido en el B. Alto Palmira, Zona Sur de Nuestra Ciudad.
texts.en:
Rosmery is a biochemist by profession. She has been practicing this activity for 10 years independently in her chemical laboratory located across from the Hospital Francés, southern zone of our city. She has the support of her parents and her husband Juan Carlos, who provides recreation and adventure activities for businesses in the private sector. Rosmery works with various import businesses in the area of medicine, which provide her with her chemical (reactive) materials for her laboratory. In addition, she is strategically located across from a prestigious medical center, the Hospital Frances. Rosmery's customers are generally children and the eldery who have problems with blood sugar, chagas, dengue, cholesterol and drugs. Because of this, she frequently needs to have various reactive chemicals for her analises. This is why she found it necessary to approach our institution, since in the last few months, due to her pregnancy, she wasn't carrying out her activities normally. Rosmery and her husband don't have any debts with any other financial entity, and that is why this loan was not denied to her. She also has a home in B. Alto Palmira, southern zone of our city.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital (purchase of reactives for her laboratory)

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es: V. Teodora tiene 54 años, su actividad económica es la compra y venta de camarones. Hace más de 12 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que siempre ha sido una persona muy responsable, ella disfruta de este negocio, por lo que ha sido su medio de vida, por lo que sale todos los días muy temprano a vender sus productos ella tiene varios clientes que siempre están solicitando la buena calidad que ofrece y también el buen trato que obtiene por medio de sus clientes. Ella solicita este financiamiento para la compra de camarones en grandes cantidades pues ya tiene muchos pedidos. Para un futuro le gustaría establecer una pulpería en su vivienda y además seguir creciendo con su negocio.
texts.en:
Teodora V. is 54 years old. She has been buying and selling shrimp for a living for more than 12 years now and she has always been a very responsible person. She enjoys this business as it is her livelihood. She leaves early every day to sell her product. She has various customers that treat her well and are always requesting the good quality product that she offers. She is requesting a loan to buy shrimp in larger quantities, as she already has many orders. In the future she would like to have a store in her house and continue to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase shrimp in larger quantities

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es: La Sra. Claudia, es una ama de casa que debido a la mala situación económica que vive nuestro País y a los sueldos bajos que se dan en el ambiente laboral, decidió emprender su propio negocio, por tal motivo decidió colocar un billar en la casa donde vive, ya que esta viene a ser una muy buena fuente de ingresos sobre todo en lugares que carecen de este tipo de servicios, como es el caso. Doña Claudia cuenta con todo el apoyo de su familia y de su esposo el Sr. Eduardo ya que los ingresos que el genera por su cuenta no son suficientes como para generarles una buena condición de vida a ella y a su hija. Doña Claudia acudió a nuestra Institución debido a ciertos problemas que comenzó a enfrentar en su negocio, esto debido a las persistentes lluvias que se dan en nuestra ciudad, como se puede apreciar en las fotos su negocio no cuenta con las condiciones en cuanto a protección se refiere y por tal motivo decidió acceder a un Crédito en nuestra Institución, para poder de esta forma brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y al mismo tiempo proteger sus bienes materiales de las persistentes lluvias, viento y sol característicos de esta parte del país. Doña Claudia al igual que su esposo cuenta con poca experiencia crediticia razón por la cual no se le negó dicho crédito, además de aquello cuenta con domicilio conocido en la Calle Santa Isabel del Barrio 6 de Agosto, Zona de la Cuchilla entre 4to y 5to Anillo.
texts.en:
Claudia is a housewife who, due to the poor economic situation our country is going through and the low wages in the employment sector, decided to start her own business. She decided to open a billiards hall in the house where she lives, since this is a very good source of income, especially in places that lack this type of service, as is the case. Claudia has her family's and her husband Eduardo's support since his income is not enough to provide a good quality of life for her and her daughter. Claudia went to our Intitution due to certain problems she started to face in her business because of the persistent rains in our city. As can be seen in the photos of her business, she doesn't have protection that she needs and she decided to access a loan in our Institution, to be able to offer her customers a better service and at the same time prtect her property from the persistent rain, wind and sun that are typical in this part of the country. Claudia as well as her husband have little loan experience and that is why this loan was not denied. In addition, she has a home located on the Calle Santa Isabel of Barrio 6 de Agosto, in the Cuchilla area between the 4th and 5th ring.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Roof construction for her billiard hall

loans.name: Ingris Mercedes

texts.es:
Ingris Mercedes M. es una joven de  23 años, que  vive en el barrio la Esperanza de Malambo con su  hijo de 5 años, que depende totalmente de ella, porque  quedó sin su cónyuge y le tocó asumir la responsabilidad de su hogar.

Desde que su esposo enfermó se dedicó al negocio de distribuir conservas de leche, plátano y guayaba, consiguió un crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el cual compró varias vitrinas pequeñas las ubicó en diversas tiendas y las surtió de su exquisitos dulces de leche, plátano y guayaba que ella misma reempaca y exhibe en estos puntos comerciales. Este es su segundo crédito el cual invertirá en la compra de 100 cajas de conservas, 100 potes de arequipe, 200 cajas de gelatina y empaques, para distribuirlas como siempre lo hace en diferentes tiendas del municipio de Malambo, donde los transporta en una moto de su propiedad y que la adquirió como resultado de sus utilidades ahorradas; así ha facilitado su trabajo y ahora tiene mayores ingresos,  pues   antes  debía sacar dinero  para alquilarla. 

Ingris Mercedes conoció de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo por su cuñada que la recomendó a esta organización,  siendo una cliente asidua de de la Fundación. Desde hace más de 5 años empezó este negocio su cónyuge, hoy fallecido después de una penosa enfermedad; con él ha logrado sostener su hogar y como ha invertido su    créditos en el negocio, este ha crecido hasta permitirle aumentar sus ingresos por concepto de  ventas  y así mismo sus utilidades,  con las que logró comprarse la actual motocicleta, para seguir abriendo mercados mas distantes de su vivienda y adquirir un lote donde construir su casita.
 
Su mayor desafío es aumentar constantemente sus ventas pues cuando éstas se disminuyen, sobre todo en la época de lluvias,  por eso empezó enviando  también sus productos a Sabanagrande, Santo Tomás y algunos municipios del departamento de Bolívar y esto le ha permitido conseguir más de 800 clientes fijos, facilitándole su trabajo y generando así un nuevo empleo. Uno de los desafíos mas grande que afrontó hace 5 meses, fue la perdida de su cónyuge, situación que la obligo a asumir la jefatura de su hogar. Por ahora Ingrid sigue soñando con construir su casa en un buen sector, pues en la actualidad  vive en el barrio la Esperanza donde aun no ha llegado la pavimentación  y el principal medio de transporte es el mototaxismo.
texts.en:
Ingris Mercedes M. is a 23 year old young woman. She lives in the Esperanza de Malambo neighborhood with her 5 year old son that totally depends on her. Because she has been left without a husband, she has had to take on all the household responsibilities. Since her husband got sick she has been distributing dulce de leche (caramel sauce made from milk) and banana and guava preserves. She obtained a loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo with which she bought some small display cases that she put in various shops. She stocked them with her exquisite dulce de leche and banana and guava preserves that she repacks herself and displays in these shops. This is her second loan. She will use it to buy 100 boxes of preserves, 100 caramel pots, 200 boxes of gelatin and packaging supplies in order to distribute them. As always, she will put them in different shops in Malambo. She transports them with a motorcycle that she bought with the earnings that she saved. This has helped her business and now she has more income, whereas before she had to spend money to rent one. Ingris María heard of Fundación Mario Santo Domingo from her sister-in-law, who recommended them to her, as she is a long standing client of the Fundación. Her husband started this business more than 5 years ago, but has since died after a long illness. Along with him she has been able to sustain her household and invest money into the business. It has grown and helped her to increase her income. It also allowed her to buy the motorcycle with which she can continue to open new markets further from her home. She also bought a lot where she can build a small house. Her biggest challenge is to steadily increase her sales because, during times like the rainy season, sales decrease. For this reason she has started sending her products to Sabanagrande, Santo Tomás and some municipalities in the department of Bolívar. This has helped her to gain more than 800 steady customers, facilitate her business and generate new work. The loss of her husband 5 months ago is one of the biggest challenges the she has had to face. This forced her to assume responsibility for their household. Now, Ingris dreams of building a house in a good section of town, since currently, she lives in the Esperanza neighborhood where nothing is paved and the main means of transportation is the motocycle taxi.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase 100 boxes of preserves, 100 caramel pots,  200 boxes of gelatin y packaging supplies

loans.name: Eulalia Florinda

texts.es: La Sra. Eulalia, tiene un puesto de venta de golosinas en el patio de una Escuela, donde vive y trabaja de portera en el turno de la tarde, dicha escuela se encuentra ubicada en la calle 21 de la zona de Calacoto, ella tiene una hija de 12 años, quien estudia por la mañana y en la tarde le ayuda  en la venta, la señora tiene una antiguedad de 15 años en el trabajo, al margen de la venta ella percibe un  salario mensual por ese servicio, ahora el crédito que solicita es para comprar mercaderia que traerá de la ciudad de Oruro como dulces, galletas, refrescos, etc, además de las golosinas, comprara mercaderia en ropa de cama, ella vino recomendada por una cliente antigua.
texts.en:
Eulalia has a sweets stand on the patio of a school where she lives and works as a caretaker during the afternoon shift. This school is located on 21st Street in the Calacoto zone. She has a 12 year old daughter who studies in the morning and helps with sales in the afternoon. Eulalia has been doing this work for 15 years. Aside from the sweets sales, she receives a monthly salary for her caretaker service. The loan that she requests is to purchase merchandise that she will bring from the city of Oruro, such as candy, cookies, refreshments, etc. In addition to the sweets, she will buy merchandise such as bedding. Eulalia has been recommended by a long-time client.

Translated from Spanish by Rachael Mossey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa de 48 años, vive en Primavera de Duran (zona periurbana, con una ecología en disolución a las afuera de Guayaquil), ella tiene una tienda en la ventana de su casa (aparece en la foto) para solventar sus gastos.

Ella comenzó a comprar víveres para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos y también pasar mas tiempo con sus hijos, compro bebidas, granos, aceites etc. Cuando crecieron ella continuo con su negocio como no tuvo oportunidad de un local construyo un puesto para la tienda afuera de su casa.  Ahora desde ese tiempo hasta ahora trabaja desde las 06h30am hasta las 21h00pm todos los días.   

Con el préstamo quiere comprar materiales de construcción para su casa como cemento, pinturas. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Rosa is 48 year old. She lives in Primavera de Duran (an area in the outskirts of Guayaquil with a deteriorating ecosystem). She has a store in a window of her house (as shown in the photo) to help her meet her expenses. She started buying provisions to help her husband with their expenses, and also to be able to spend more time with her children. She purchased drinks, grains, oils etc. When her children grew up, she continued with the business. Since she didn't have a separate a store, she made a stand outside her home. Since then, she has worked in it from 6:30am until 9:00pm every day. With the loan, she wants to purchase construction materials for her house; materials like cement and paint. In the future, she wants to finish construction on her home.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cement, paint

loans.name: Delia María

texts.en:
Delia is a 42-year-old single mother who lives with her sister, nephew and son in San Francisco, Costa Rica.

Delia has a business working as a legal consultant. The quality of services she is able to provide to her lawyer clients depends on her ability to do research on laws, contracts, procurement, etc.  She hopes to use this loan to purchase a computer so that she will be able to provide better services to her clients and be able to do her work more efficiently.

At the moment, Delía uses her nephew’s computer (shown in the photo) when he isn’t at home. When her nephew needs the computer, Delia must go out to an internet café, accompanied by her son.

Outside of work, Delia has the goal of starting a library in her home because, in the city where she lives, there is no library.

loans.use: To purchase a computer for her business

loans.name: Juan Julio

texts.es: El Señor Juan es cliente antiguo de emprender trabajo anteriormente en el grupo Alalay, desde el año 2003,hasta el año 2006, retornando con este crédito para invertir en la compra de llantas para su transporte y otros accesorios,  el se dedica a la mecánica y al transporte urbano tiene su  taller en su domicilio donde vive con su esposa, quien se dedica a la venta de ropa y con sus 2 hijos que se  encuentran en  edad escolar,  es una persona muy responsable en sus pagos, y muy trabajador, esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Juan is an old client of Emprender. He previously worked in the group Alalay from 2003 to 2006. He has returned for a new loan to invest in the purchase of tires and other accessories for his vehicle. He works as a mechanic and in public transportation. His workshop is located in his home where he lives with his wife, who sells clothes, and with his two school age children. He is very responsible with his payments, a very hard worker, and is very thankful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence given him in granting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by David Cannon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tires

loans.name: Carla Patricia

texts.es: Carla Patricia tiene 28 años, tiene 2 hijos son menores de edad y están a su cargo. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es una pulpería, hace mas 6 años que se dedica este medio de vida, por lo que ella inicio vendiendo refrescos ya que tenía que hacerse cargo de sus hijos y no tenía ninguna ayuda de su esposo, por lo que es madre soltera que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado salir adelante y con todo los sacrificios que ha realizado. El destino del financiamiento es para la compra de granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos, jugos, pan entre otras. Sueña con realizarles mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Carla Patricia is 28 years old and has 2 children under sixteen who she looks after. She has been running a grocery store for the past 6 years, having started by selling soft drinks when she had to take care of her children and had no help from her husband. She is a single mother and, with a lot of hard work and sacrifice, she has managed to move forward. The loan will be used to buy basic grains, sweets, soft drinks, juices, bread, etc. She dreams of making improvements to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Stansfield, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Sandra Luz

texts.es:
Sandra es una joven de 28 años de edad,  comerciante de una pulpería que inicio con fondos propios de su trabajo anterior, como domestica, y ahorros que su esposo dio para comenzar. 

Tiene dos hijos el cual aun están pequeño. Y tiene la oportunidad de cuidarlos en casa.
Las dificultades es que tiene poco inventario, lo que las ventas han sido pocas, es por eso nace la iniciativa de poder obtener financiamiento para lograr la inversión de productos como: granos básicos, lácteos, golosinas, gaseosas, jugos, productos enlatados y otros para lograr obtener mejores ventas. 

Como objetivo es poder mantener estable su pequeña pulpería ya que es de gran ayuda económica para su familia. Ya que su esposo alquila parcela para sembrar chiltoma y tomate y a veces tarda para sacar la cosecha. 
Y hay que pagar los gastos básicos de agua y luz, alimentación que se ayudan con sus ganancias de su propio negocio.
texts.en:
Sandra is a young woman, 28 years old. She has a small grocery store that she started with her own funds from her previous job as a domestic servant, and with savings that her husband gave her to get started. She has two children that are still young and she has the opportunity to take care of them at home. The difficulty she has is that she has very little inventory, so she doesn’t make a lot of sales. This is why she has taken the initiative to secure a loan to invest in products such as: basic grains, dairy products, sweets, soft drinks, juices, canned foods, and others, so that she can achieve better sales. Her goals is to keep her store economically stable because it is of great help to her family. Her husband rents a piece of land to plant sweet peppers and tomatoes and sometimes it takes a long time before they are ready to harvest. They still have to pay the basic costs, like water, electricity, and food, so the earnings from her business are very helpful.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic grains, dairy products, sweets, canned foods, cereals, and other items so that she can achieve greater sales

loans.name: Oscar Tomas

texts.es: Oscar Tomas se dedica a brindar servicios múltiples, hace más de 50 años que tiene esta actividad, el inicio con servicios de mantenimientos de equipos telefónicos, por lo que anteriormente trabajaba en una empresa de telecomunicaciones fue ahí donde aprendió todo lo necesario para ofrecer estos servicios, siempre llegan a buscarlo a su vivienda para realizar algunos trabajos, el es un hombre muy trabajador y las ganas de proporcionarle a su familia lo necesario es muy importante. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de taladros, pinzas, destornilladores, alicates y otras herramientas.
texts.en:
Oscar Tomas has been a handyman for more than 50 years. He started with phone maintenance since he had worked in a telecommunications company and learned there all he needed to perform the services. People always come to his house to request his services. He is a hardworking men who values providing for his family. He requests a loan for the purchase of drills, tweezers, screw drivers, pliers and other tools.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Bertha Adilia

texts.es:
Doña Bertha es una mujer trabajadora, emprendedora de su propio negocio, tiene la edad de 33 años, con dos hermosos hijos, su esposo es albañil.
Desde hace varios años comienza a vender ropa y zapatos con el objetivo de aportar en los gastos de su hogar ya que solo con el trabajo de su esposo no da, ya que la canasta básica ah incrementado.
Lo que desea es  aumentar la compra de ropa, logrando captar clientes nuevos como aumentar sus ventas. Comprando variedad de estilo de mujer como caballero, ropa de niño, y cosméticos.
Contenta por que podrá dar otro jiro a su negocio ya esta logrando con el apoyo de la institución. Y que será de muchos beneficios para su familia.
texts.en:
Bertha is a hard working woman, and owner of her own business. She is 33 years old, with two beautiful children. Her husband is a builder. Several years ago she started to sell clothes and shoes with the goal of contributing to the household expenses as the work of her husband alone is not enough, since the basic food basket has increased. What she wants is to increase the purchase of clothes, and manage to gain new customers to increase her sales. Buying a variety of women's styles as well as men's, children's, and cosmetics. She is happy because she will be able to give a new focus to her business as she is managing to already with the support of the institution. And it will be of great benefit to her family.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy women's, men's, and children's clothes and cosmetics to be able to increase sales.

loans.name: Mbomane Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Mbobane est né depuis la création du Banc Villageois il ya 09 ans. Il fait partie du Banc Villageois de NEMA2. Il est composé de 06 femmes qui habitent tous dans le même quartier de TILENE à Ziguinchor. Elles ont monté leur groupe par voisinage et affinité

Madame Marcelle K. à droite de la photo est âgée de 54 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants et a en charge ses 5 petits fils. Elle a 19 expériences avec le crédit avec CAURIE-MICRO FINANCE

Elle vend des tissus Wax, KHARTOUME, Pagne tissé. Elle maîtrise bien cette activité pour  l'avoir mène depuis de 05 ans années.

Son nouveau prêt lui permettra  de s’approvisionner en quantité suffisante en  tissus et accroitre ainsi son chiffre d’affaire. 

Son objectif est  de développer son activité afin d’améliorer son niveau d’épargne.
texts.en:
The Mbobane solidarity group has been formed since the creation of the Banc Villageois nine years ago. It belongs to the Banc Villageois of Nema 2. The group is composed of six women who live in the same district of Tilene in Ziguinchor. They are friends and neighbors who decided to form a group. Mrs. Marcelle K., on the right on the photo, is 54 years old. She is married and is the mother of seven children and has five grandchildren in her care. She has had loans from Caurie-Mircofinance 19 times. She sells traditional colorful fabrics (wax, khartoume, pagnes). She knows this business well, having been doing it for five years. Her new loan will allow her to stock up an ample quantity of fabrics and to increase her revenues. Her goal is to grow her business to improve her level of savings.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing traditional fabrics

loans.name: Tesorito De Oro - Ocongate Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “TESORITO D. ORO - OCONGATE”; Los socios viven en el distrito D. Ocongate perteneciente a la provincia D. Quispicanchis departamento D. Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Mariza ella tiene 27 años D. edad y La socia es natural D. Ocongate y es conviviente, su conyugue es mecánico  y venD. lubricantes para autos,  ella tiene 2 hijos que están estudiando en la escuela pública D. Ocongate; La socia alterna sus actividades con la crianza D. animales menores, ella compra animales menores (cuyes, aves D. corral, chanchos); Ella compra los cría engorda y venD. los animales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar animales menores y así incrementar su negocio para tener mayor entrada. 

Los otros socios se dedican a diferentes actividades como tienda D. abarrotes, artesanía, agricultura, ganadería, venta D. ropa, florería, taxistas, venta D. quesos, artefactos. Las sociasSonia y Felipa, estaban presentes pero no quisieron salir en esta foto por motivos D. creencias ancestrales, ellas creen que cuando se les saca una foto ellos pierden un poco el alma.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este les permitirá crecer y mejorar su  negocio y D. este mismo modo mejorar su calidad D. vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. su cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “Tesorito D. Oro – Ocongate” communal bank. They live in the district of Ocongate, which belongs to the province of Quispicanchis, Cusco department. Mariza is 27 years old, is from Ocongate, and lives with her husband. Her husband is a mechanic and he sells lubricants for cars. She has 2 children who are studying in the public school in Ocongate. She alternates her household activities with raising small livestock. She buys small animals (guinea pigs, domestic fowl, pigs), fattens them, and sells them. She is requesting a loan to buy small animals and expand her business so she can have more income. The other members work in different businesses, such as small grocery stores, crafts, agriculture, cattle raising, clothing sales, floristry, taxis, cheese sales, and antiques sales. The members value and are infinitely grateful for the loan granted to them since it will allow them to grow and improve their businesses, and thereby improve their quality of life. They promise to make their payments in the stipulated time frame.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy small animals for fattening so she can increase her business and have more income

loans.name: Ngueterre Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité NGUETERRE est né depuis 09 ans. Il fait partie du Banc Villageois de NEMA2. Il est composé de huit braves femmes qui ont une même vision et ont pratiquement le même centre d’intérêt. Se sont des  Femmes très engagées et courageuses. Depuis le début du programme dans leur quartier elles se sont organisées en groupe de solidarité par voisinage et par affinité.

Madame Madeleine B., à droite de la photo est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 53 ans.
Elle fait le petit commerce comme. Elle achète avec le prêt reçu des balais traditionnels et du jus de citron dans les villages environnants pour les revendre à Ziguinchor et à Dakar. Elle évolue depuis plusieurs années dans se secteur. 
Son objectif est d’augmenter ses bénéfices et satisfaire ses besoins personnels. Alléger les charges financières à son mari
texts.en:
The Ngueterre solidarity group has been born nine years ago. It belongs to the Banc Villageois of NEMA2. It is composed of eight strong women who have the same vision and share their main interests. They women are very engaged and courageous. From the time the program had been launched in their neighborhood, they decided to form a solidarity group of neighbors and friends. Mrs. Madeleine B., to the right in the photo, is the group’s leader. She is 53 years old. She has a small business; with the loan, she will purchase traditional brooms and lemon juice in the neighboring villages in order to resell them in Ziguinchor and Dakar. She has been in this line of business for a number of years. Her goal is to increase her revenue and be able to provide for her personal needs, and to alleviate the financial burden on her husband.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing brooms and lemon juice

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 52-year-old mother of four who lives with her husband and youngest son in Roxana, near the Caribbean coast of Costa Rica. The loan consultant who has been working with Elizabeth describes her as humble, hardworking and enthusiastic about improving her standard of living.

Elizabeth has a business selling men’s and women’s clothing as well as underwear and bags. She hopes to use this loan to finance the purchase of more inventory which she plans to sell in her community.

Elizabeth began her sales business two years ago in an effort to earn an income to supplement that of her husband. Her main motivation has been the economic demands of financing the studies of her children. She balances her domestic tasks with the running of her business.

Most of Elizabeth’s clients are members of her community (nearby banana and pineapple field laborers), friends and acquaintances. She reaches her clients by bicycle; most of her sales are made on credit, to be collected on at a later date.

Elizabeth says she wakes up early and takes care of the domestic tasks. After that, she hits the road looking for new clients and checking up on existing ones. Her goal is to one day own a store in a central location where she could sell her products. Her main obstacle is a lack of access to working capital, which has hamstrung her ability to meet the demands of her clients.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing to sell

loans.name: Nguatamane Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité NGUATAMANE est né depuis la création du Banc Villageois il ya 09 ans de cela. Il fait partie du Banc Villageois de NEMA2. Il est composé de 07 femmes qui  habitent toutes dans le même quartier de TILENE dans la région de Ziguinchor. 

Madame Thérèse D. à droite de la photo est la responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 53ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants. Elle a la charge de ses 5 petits fils. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois depuis 9 ans
Elle fait un petit commerce depuis plus de 5 ans. Elle vend des balais traditionnels et de l’huile de palme
Elle a 19 fois de suite reçu de crédit et avec son nouveau prêt elle compte des balaies et de l'huile de palme dans les villages environnants pour les revendre à Ziguinchor. 

Son objectif est de faire la promotion de son activité, d’augmenter son niveau d’épargne et de soutenir son mari dans les différentes charges familiales.
texts.en:
The solidarity group NGUATAMANE was born 9 years after the creation of the “Banc Villageois.” It is part of the NEMA2 Banc Villageois. It is composed of 7 women who all live in the same TILENE neighborhood in the Ziguinchor region. Mrs. Thérèse D., at the right in the photo, is the leader of the group. She is 53 years old, married and the mother of six children. She has 5 small sons in her care. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois for nine years and has operated a small business for more than 5 years. She sells traditional brooms and palm oil. She has received 19 consecutive loans and with her new loan she plans to purchase brooms and palm oil in the surrounding villages to sell at Ziguinchor. Her goal is to promote her business, bolster her savings and help her husband with the various familial expenses.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy palm oil and brooms

loans.name: Bokk Kogne Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité BOKK KOGNE est créé depuis l’inauguration du Banc Villageois qui l’abrite : NEMA2. Il est composé de 06 femmes qui sont toutes issues du même quartier. Elles se sont organisées par voisinage et par affinité. C’est des femmes très motivées et qui développent un bon esprit de solidarité entre elles.

Madame Caroline K. à droite de la photo est la responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 53 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. 
Elle fait un petit commerce de fruits de saison. Elle mène cette activité depuis plus d’une décennie. Elle achète des oranges et des mangues dans les villages environnants pour les revendre à Ziguinchor et à Dakar.

Son objectif est d’augmenter ses revenus financiers, de prendre en charge ses besoins personnels et de participer au bien-être familial.
texts.en:
The solidarity group BOKK KOGNE was created after the inauguration of the NEMA 2 Banc Villageois where it is based. It is composed of 6 women who all come from the same neighborhood.
