They are organized by neighborhood and kinship. These women are very motivated and have developed a strong spirit of solidarity amongst themselves. Mrs. Caroline K. at the right in the photo is the leader of the group. She is 53 years old, married and the mother of four children. She operates a small business in seasonal fruits and has run this business for more than a decade. She buys oranges and mangos in the surrounding villages to sell in Ziguinchor and Dakar. Her goal is to increase her income, to provide for her personal needs and to contribute to the well-being of her family.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy oranges and mangos

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 43 años D. edad, es casada y vive junto a su familia en el distrito D. TambogranD., un distrito agrícola D. la provincia D. Piura, la población se dedica casi exclusivamente a sembrar arboles frutales, cuyos frutos son vendidos a plantas procesadoras que los manufacturan para exportarlos al extranjero, la zona pertenece a la región Piura y se encuentra ubicada a mas D. tres horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a ofrecer en venta productos D. primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en el domicilio donD. resiD., este negocio es D. mucha importancia para sus vecinos ya que pone al alcance D. sus manos productos D. consumo diario y también es importante para su familia ya que le ayuda a sostener la economía D. su hogar. Paralelamente ella cría animales, específicamente pavos, los cuales venD. a sus vecinos y a los negociantes que frecuentan el lugar.

Rosa desea ampliar su bodega comprando mas productos para ofrecer a sus clientes D. modo que sus ventas aumenten y pueda percibir mayores ganancias, para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad D. solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1500 nuevos soles.

Ella es una persona tranquila y que siempre trabaja arduamente para sacar a su familia adelante. En la zona donD. vive sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran una mujer responsable y carismática.
texts.en:
Rosa is 43 years old and married. She lives with her family in the TambogranD. district. It is an agricultural district in the Piura province. The population devotes itself almost exclusively to growing fruit trees. The fruit is sold to processing plants that prepare them for export to foreign countries. The area belongs to the Piura region. It is three hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. She devotes herself to selling basic needs products and groceries in a grocery store set up in her house. This business is very important to her neighbors because it puts products that are consumed daily within their reach. It is also important for her family because it helps support her household. She also raises animals, specifically turkeys. She sells them to her neighbors and the businessmen who frequent the area. Rosa wishes to expand her grocery store by purchasing more products to offer her customers. That way her sales will increase, and she will be able to get more income. To obtain that objective she has seen the need of asking Edpyme Alternative, for the first time, for a loan for 1,500 soles. She is a level-headed person who always works arduously to get her family ahead. In the area where she lives her neighbors and acquaintances consider her to be a responsible and charismatic woman.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products to expand the grocery store in her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For planting 3.5 acres of corn and buying two calves

loans.name: Olga Isabel

texts.es:
La Señora. Olga Isabel B. es socia del banco comunal Rosas Rojas, vive en la comunidad de La Estancia que es perteneciente al cantón Paute que se caracteriza por ser la mayor productora de flores, su gente en su mayor parte viven del la agricultura y ganadería.
 
Nuestra socia tiene 35 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos de 13, 9, 2 y 1 año de edad, su primer hijo está en el colegio y el segundo en la escuela, su esposo trabaja como operador de maquinaria pesada, gracias a el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

La Señora. Olga Isabel se dedica a la cría de pollos, los vende pelados en el mercado de Paute, realiza esta labor hace 2 años; para mejorar la economía de su hogar hace 8 meses se dedica a la venta de ropa en el mercado de su cantón los días miércoles y domingos,  vende principalmente ropa de damas.

Es nuestra socia hace 7 ciclos y los créditos le han permitido seguir creciendo en el negocio de pollos,  el nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa para surtir su mercadería. Su meta es que sus hijos lleguen a ser  buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Olga Isabel B. is a member of the “Rosas Rojas” (Red Roses) Communal Bank. She lives in the La Estancia community, which belongs to the Paute canton. It is characterized as being the greatest flower producer. Most of its people live from farming and livestock. Our member is 35 years old and married. She has four children; 13, 9, 2, and 1 years old. Her first child is in high school, and the second one is in elementary school. Her husband works as a heavy machine operator. Thanks to the couple’s work they have built their own house. Olga Isabel raises chickens. She sells the plucked chickens at the Paute market. She has been doing this work for two years in order to improve the household finances. For eight months she has been selling clothes in the market in her canton. She does that on Wednesdays and Sundays. She mostly sells clothes for women. She has been a member for seven cycles. The loans have allowed her to keep growing in the chicken business. The new loan is to buy clothes to stock her merchandise. Her goal is for her children to become good professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy blouses, skirts, pants, and dresses

loans.name: Lester René

texts.es:
El Sr. Lester René M. B. vive en el Mauricio del Viejo, Departamento de Chinandega. 

El va a utilizar el credito en la compra de 2 llantas para el camión ya que las que está usando las tiene un poco desgastadas.

El Sr. M. ha tenido un total de 3 créditos con la Institución de los cuales  los 2 anteriores los ha cancelado bien en tiempo y forma, el vive solo con su mama y sus hermanas.
texts.en:
Lester Rene M. B. lives in Mauricio del Viejo, in the department of Chinandega. He plans to use the loan to buy 2 tires for his truck, since those he is using are slightly worn. Mr. M. has taken out a total of 3 loans with the Institution, 2 of which he paid off on time and correctly. He lives alone with his mother and sisters.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tires for his truck

loans.name: Gloria Esperanza

texts.es:
La Señora Gloria Esperanza R. es socia del banco comunal Rosas Rojas, vive en la comunidad de La Estancia que pertenece al cantón Paute, y se caracteriza por ser la mayor productora de flores, su gente en su mayor parte viven de la agricultura y ganadería.

La Señora. Gloria Esperanza tiene 30 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 10, 9 y 8 años de edad, su esposo ha migrado fuera del país en busca de una mejor oportunidad de trabajo y así poder brindarles un buen futuro a sus hijos, con el esfuerzo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

Nuestra socia es comerciante de todo tipo de ropa hace 8 años, vende desde su casa de lunes a viernes,  los fines de semana trabaja un puesto propio que tiene en el mercado de su cantón. Se encuentra en su tercer crédito los mismos que le han beneficiado en su negocio, ahora su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más mercadería para surtir su negocio.

Su meta es hacer los acabados de a su casa.
texts.en:
Gloria Esperanza R. is a member of the Rosas Rojas (Red Roses) communal bank. She lives in the La Estancia community in the Paute district, which is a flower-producing area where most of the inhabitants earn their living from agriculture and livestock rearing. Gloria Esperanza is 30 years old, married and has three children who are 10, 9 and 8 years old. Her husband emigrated to look for better work opportunities and be able to offer their children a better future. The couple’s efforts have enabled them to build their own house. Our member has been selling a range of clothes for the past 8 years. She sells from her home from Monday to Friday, and at the weekend she works on her own stall in the district market. This is the third loan to help her business, and the new loan will be invested in the purchase of more stock.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Stansfield, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy blouses, trousers, T-shirts, pyjamas, etc.

loans.name: Dionila

texts.es:
Dionila tiene 52 años D. edad, es casada y vive junto a su familia en el distrito D. TambogranD., un distrito agrícola D. la provincia D. Piura, la población se dedica casi exclusivamente a sembrar arboles frutales, cuyos frutos son vendidos a plantas procesadoras que los manufacturan para exportarlos al extranjero, la zona pertenece a la región Piura y se encuentra ubicada a mas D. tres horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la venta D. prendas D. vestir en un puesto D. venta del mercado D. su distrito, ella ya tiene mucho tiempo dedicándose  a este negocio por lo que ya tiene un grupo D. clientes conocidos que siempre recurren a su negocio para adquirir sus productos, ella siempre se esfuerza por salir adelante por lo que trata D. adquirir productos D. calidad y ofrecerlos a sus clientes con un trato amable. Su esposo es agricultor y juntos siempre trabajan arduamente para salir adelante.

Dionila desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo mas mercaderia para ampliar su negocio, aumentar sus ventas y percibir mayores ingresos, para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 2000 nuevos soles.

Ella es una mujer bastante trabajadora y entregada a su familia sus clientes y compañeros la consideran una mujer amable y respetuosa
texts.en:
Dionila, 52, is married and lives with her family in the TambogranD. district. This is an agricultural district in the Piura province, where the population is dedicated almost entirely to the cultivation of fruit trees whose fruits are sold to the processing plants that manufacture and export them abroad. This area is part of the Piura region, and is located more than 3 hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. Dionila sells clothing from a stall in the market in her district. She has already been in this business for quite some time, and so has a group of loyal customers who she knows and who always return to her business to acquire their products. She always tries her best to make progress with her business; she tries to buy the best quality products and offer them to her customers with friendly service. Her husband is a farmer and together they always work arduously to get ahead. Dionila wants to expand her business by acquiring more merchandise and increasing her sales, so that she can have greater earnings. To achieve this objective she has decided to apply, for the first time, for a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 2,000 Peruvian soles. Dionila is a hardworking woman who is dedicated to her family and her customers, and her colleagues consider her to be a friendly and respectful woman.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy garments to expand her business selling in the market

loans.name: Julia Leonor

texts.es:
La Señora Julia Leonor R. es socia del banco comunal Rosas Rojas, vive en la comunidad de La Estancia que  pertenece al cantón Paute,  se caracteriza por ser la mayor productora de flores, su gente en su mayor parte viven del la agricultura y ganadería.

Nuestra socia se dedica al cuidado de una hacienda de la localidad hace 22 años,  su trabajo en ella es de sembrar plantas para jardines y hortalizas, en la hacienda le permiten criar animales, tiene pollos, chanchos y cuyes los que vende cuando tiene  alguna necesidad económica.
 
La Señora Julia Leonor tiene 44 años, es madre soltera de  5 hijos de 25, 23, 20, 16 y 13 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos son casados,  viven con ella y comparten los gastos del hogar, su tercer hijo trabaja y también le ayuda económicamente, sus dos últimos hijos están estudiando en el colegio, gracias a su trabajo ha logrado construir su casa propia.

Se encuentra en su cuarto ciclo y los créditos le han servido para comprar más animales, su crédito lo va a invertir en la construcción de un galpón para cuyes.

Su meta es tener una mejor situación económica.
texts.en:
Julia Leonor R. is a member of the “Rosas Rojas” (Red Roses) Communal Bank. She lives in the La Estancia community, which belongs to the Paute canton. It is characterized as being the greatest flower producer. Most of its people live from farming and livestock. Our member has been taking care of a ranch in her area for 22 years. Her work is to plant the flower gardens and vegetables. On the ranch they allow her to raise animals. She has chickens, pigs, and guinea pigs. She sells them when she needs the money. Julia Leonor is 44 years old. She is a single mother, and she has five children. The children are 25, 23, 20, 16, and 13 years old. Her first two children are married. They live with her and share the household expenses. Her third child works and helps with expenses. Her last two children are in school. Thanks to her work she built her own house. She is in her fourth cycle. The loans have helped her buy more animals. She will use the loan to build housing for guinea pigs. Her goal is to have a better financial situation.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build guinea pig housing

loans.name: Hazel

texts.es:
Hazel tiene 42 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos. Vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Oyotún, una zona agrícola situada a mas de hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de artículos de primera necesidad y abarrotes desde hace mas de diez años en una bodega instalada en el domicilio donde reside, el negocio es de mucha utilidad para su familia debido a que le brinda algunos ingresos con los cuales ayuda a su esposo a solventar los gastos familiares. Ella viaja constantemente  a la ciudad de Chiclayo para adquirir productos de buena calidad con los cuales pueda responder de buena manera a la demanda de sus clientes.

Hazel desea ampliar su bodega con la compra de mas productos de modo que pueda ampliar sus ventas y percibir mayores ingresos,  para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Hazel es una mujer trabajadora y responsable, ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado ser una cliente puntual y responsable al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Hazel is 42, married and has two children. She lives with her family in the district of Oyotun, an agricultural zone located more than an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo. She has sold basic necessities and groceries for over ten years in a store in the home where she lives. The business is very useful for her family, since it offers some income with which she helps her husband to cover family costs. She is constantly traveling to the city of Chiclayo to acquire good quality products with which she can respond well to her customers' demand. Hazel wants to stock her store through the purchase of more products in order to increase her sales and obtain a better income. In order to achieve this goal she has decided to request a loan of 2000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa. Hazel is a hard-working and responsible woman. She has worked with this institution before and demonstrated herself to be punctual and responsible with her repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of basic staples to stock the business in her home

loans.name: Epifania

texts.es:
Epifanía nació y vive en la ciudad D. Ollantaytambo. El distrito D. Ollantaytambo, se encuentra en la Provincia D. Urubamba, departamento del Cusco, localizándose a 91 km. D. la ciudad del Cusco a través D. la vía Asfaltada. Ollantaytambo es una ciudad encantadora que se remonta a los tiempos incas. Construida en la base D. la antigua ciudad inca. 

Epifanía que se dedica tradicionalmente a la agricultura, ve hoy en el turismo una oportunidad para mejorar su calidad D. vida, ella tiene un puesto D. venta en el mercado principal D. venta D. artesanía “Mañaraqui, donD. venD. chullos, guantes, sombreros, bolsos, carteras, ponchos y también venD. bebidas refrescantes como gaseosas y agua mineral. Hace 30 años que empezó este negocio y con un poco D. capital pero ahora, ella tiene un stand  y pertenece a la asociación  D. artesanos D. Ollantaytambo. La pueden encontrar en su puesto que está equipado con una variedad D. artesanía, ella sale a vender tres veces  a la semana desD. las 8 D. la mañana hasta muy tarD. o hasta que todos los turistas se vayan del mercado.  Epifanía desprenD. una imagen D. una mujer trabajadora y responsable. Un flujo D. turistas vistan el mercado y el negocio se anima bastante durante la hora en que llegan los turistas a visitar la hermosas ruinas Incas. Ella venD. sus productos a un precio cómodo y accesible para los clientes y sobre todo D. buena calidad, esto la distingue D. sus demás compañeras D. trabajo. 

Con su próximo préstamo, Epifanía espera recibir $ 300 dólares USD. Por el momento, desea incrementar el capital del negocio y va comprar más mercadería como por ejemplo, chullos, bolsas, guantes, ponchos y muchos productos más y así esta manera poder abastecer su puesto D. venta porque en estos meses es donD. llegan muchos turistas a visitar las ruinas Incas y a comprar artesanía.   Epifanía pertenece al banco comunal “La Amistad D. Ollantaytambo”, un término que hace honor a la amistad que tienen todas las socias del banco comunal.
texts.en:
Epifanía lives in the city of Ollantaytambo, where she was born. The Ollantaytambo district is in the province of Urubamba, department of Cuzco, located 91 km. from Cuzco on the highway. Ollantaytambo is a charming city that dates back to the time of the Incas, built on the base of the ancient Inca city. Epifanía had traditionally worked in farming, but today sees tourism as the opportunity to improve her standard of living. She has a sales booth in the Mañaraqui crafts market, where she sells “chullos” (Peruvian hat with earflaps maD. from vicuña, alpaca, llama or sheep's wool), gloves, hats, bags, purses, ponchos, and she also sells soft drinks and mineral water. She started this business 30 years ago with a little capital, but she now has a stand and belongs to the Ollantaytambo crafts association. She can be found in her stand, which is stocked with a variety of crafts. She goes out to sell three times a week, from 8 in the morning until very late, or until all tourists have left the market. Epifanía appears to be a hard-working, reliable woman. Crowds of tourists visit the market, and business is quite lively when they come to see the beautiful Inca ruins. She sells her goods at prices that are appropriate and reasonable for her customers, and especially good quality, which is what distinguishes her from her colleagues at work. Epifanía hopes to get $300 USD for her next loan. For now, she wants to increase her working capital and will buy more merchandise, such as chullos, bags, gloves, ponchos, and many other products. This way, she can stock her booth, for this is the time when many tourists visit the Inca ruins and buy crafts. Epifanía belongs to the Ollantaytambo Friendship communal bank, the name given in honor of the friendship enjoyed by all its members.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more merchandise, such as Peruvian-style caps, bags, gloves, ponchos, and other products.

loans.name: Américo Donato

texts.es:
Donato tiene 56 años y tiene un hijo llamado Alejandro de tres años. El vive en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo donde la mayoría de los  pobladores se dedican al turismo. Donato ve hoy en el turismo una oportunidad para mejorar su calidad de vida y por ese motivo, él brinda servicio de transporte a turistas y también tiene un pequeño hospedaje llamado “Rumi Wasi"  en Ollantaytambo. Hace 10 años que se dedica al negocio de turismo y le va muy excelente. 

Donato es natural de la ciudad del Cusco pero actualmente vive en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo junto con su hijo y su esposa, donde desde hace mucho tiempo Donato y su esposa participan en el banco comunal de “La Amistad de Ollantaytambo” pero Donato por un corto tiempo dejo de participar y ahora ha vuelto. Con su próximo préstamo, Donato espera recibir $300 USD. Por el momento, su hospedaje esta modestamente equipado con las necesidades más básicas. Le gustaría emplear el dinero de este préstamo para comprar termas, frazadas, toallas y otras cosas que se puedan necesitar para implementar el hospedaje.
texts.en:
Donato is 56 years old, and he has a three year old son named Alejandro. He lives in the city of Ollantaytambo. Most of the population works in tourism. Donato now sees an opportunity to improve his quality of life by working in tourism. He provides transportation service to tourists. He also has a small hostel (provides lodging) called “Rumi Wasi" in Ollantaytambo. He has worked in tourism for ten years, and it is going very well for him. Donato is from the city of Cusco, but he currently lives in Ollantaytambo with his son and his wife. Donato and his wife have participated in the “La Amistad de Ollantaytambo” (The Friendship in Ollantaytambo) Communal Bank for a long time. Donato stopped participating for a short time, but now he has returned. Donato hopes to receive $300 USD for his next loan. At the moment his hostel is modestly equipped with the more basic necessities. He would like to use the money from this loan to buy a water heater, blankets, towels and other things that are needed for his hostel.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a water heater, blankets, towels, and other things

loans.name: Erick

texts.es:
Erick vive y trabaja actualmente en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo donde el turismo cada día va creciendo y los pobladores ven la mejor manera de trabajar con el turismo. Este año Erick cumple 23 años y trabaja para la municipalidad de Ollantaytambo como técnico agropecuario. Las actividades que desarrolla son la evaluación de cultivos y los tratamientos de animales. 

Erick también se dedica en sus horas libres a la elaboración de artesanía de tipo muñequería como por ejemplo, muñecos, maletines y mantas.  Ya son seis meses que le contrataron en la municipalidad y le va muy excelente. 

Erick y su pareja viven en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo donde su mamá Noemí participa en el banco comunal “La Amistad de Ollantaytambo” quien le invito a formar parte de este grupo. Con el préstamo que  Erick espera recibir de los $300 USD. Por el momento, desea aumentar el capital de negocio comprando materiales como por ejemplo velar (tela especial) y algodón para confeccionar muñecas.
texts.en:
Erick lives and works in Ollantaytambo city, where each day tourism is growing and the townspeople look for the best way to work with tourism. This year Erick turns 23 years old. He works for the Ollantaytambo Municipality as a farming expert, doing activities such as crop evaluation and animal treatments. In his free time Erick works making artesanal goods, such as dolls, bags and cloaks. He has been working for the municipality for 6 months and it's going excellently for him. Erick and his partner live in Ollantaytambo city where his mother Noemí is part of the communal bank “La Amistad de Ollantaytambo”, and she invited him to be part of this group. With the loan Erick is seeking he wants to increase his working capital, purchasing materials such as fabric and cotton to make dolls.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric and cotton

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda H. is from the village of Acad, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 48 years old. Erlinda is married and has 6 adult-aged children. To make a living, Erlinda owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Erlinda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Erlinda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and women, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more products to expand the business

loans.name: Sofia Karem

texts.es:
Sofía nació, vive y trabaja en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo donde la mayoría de los pobladores se dedican al turismo. Sofía tiene 25 años y tiene su pareja pero que todavía no se casaron, hace mucho tiempo atrás ella se dedicaba a la fotografía en la ciudad del Cusco y tuvo que dejar de trabajar porque estaba embarazada. 

Decidida  a ser feliz con su pareja, Sofía se mudo a la ciudad de Ollantaytambo donde vive junto a su familia de su esposo. Sofía permanecía en su domicilio al cuidado de su hijo (José de dos años y medio) entonces su esposo le motivo para que ella abriera un pequeño restaurante y de nombre le pusieron “Doña Rumania” que debía estar ubicado en la avenida principal de la ciudad de Ollantaytambo. Actualmente, Sofía sirve menú y comidas especiales a varios clientes cada día. La pueden encontrar en su restaurante, que está equipado con varias mesas, sillas y una zona donde prepara sus comidas, los 7 días de la semana, desde muy temprano hasta bastante tarde en la noche, o hasta que se agote los platos de comida. Hace siete meses que abrió el restaurante y le va muy excelente. Sofía es una mujer emprendedora y alegre. Un flujo regular de clientes visita su restaurante y el negocio se anima bastante durante la hora del almuerzo. Ella sirve para cada cliente un plato de sopa de casa, un plato de fondo, un vaso de refresco y un postre. 

Con su próximo préstamo, Sofía espera recibir $300 USD. Por el momento, su casa está a medio construir y está equipado con las necesidades más básicas. Le gustaría emplear el dinero de este préstamo para techar su casa y desea comprar tejas y palos. Sofía pertenece a un banco comunal  “La amistad de Ollantaytambo” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú.
texts.en:
Sofía was born, lives and works in Ollantaytambo city, where the majority of the townspeople work in tourism. Sofía is 25 years old and has a partner, but they aren't married yet. Years ago Sofía worked in photography in Cusco city but have to leave her job because she was pregnant. Determined to be happy with her partner, Sofía moved to Ollantaytambo city where she lives together with her husband's family. Sofía used to stay home and care for her son (José, 2 1/2 years) until her husband prompted her to open a small restaurant which they called 'Doña Rumania', owing to the fact that it is located in the principal avenue in Ollantaytambo. Sofía serves a daily menu and special plates to a number of customers each day. You can find her in her restaurant, which she is equipping with tables, chairs and a zone to prepare the food, 7 days per week from very early in the morning until late in the night, or until the food is exhausted. She opened the restaurant 7 months ago and it is going very well. Sofía is an entrepreunerial and vivacious woman. A regular flow of customers visit her restaurant and the business is bustling during the lunch hour. Sofía serves each customer a plate of the house soup, a main meal, a glass of juice or something to drink, and a dessert. At the moment Sofía's house is half-constructed and is equipped with basic necessities. She wants to invest the money from this loan into her house's roof and purchase tiles and wooden planks. Sofía belongs to the communal bank “La amistad de Ollantaytambo”, part of Asociación Arariwa in Cusco city, Perú.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing roofing material such as tiles and wooden planks

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia P. is from the village of Brgy. Villa Coloma, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 42 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. Emilia owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling cosmetics and personal products in the local community. Emilia has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2007, Emilia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emilia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to purchase additional products to sell. Emilia is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Emilia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Marissa is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to expand her business.  This loan will be her third from GDMPC.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her general living conditions. 

-----------------------------------------------

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products

loans.name: Putri Mandiri Group

texts.en:
Ni Ketut R. is a 57-year-old female living in the town of Melaya - Bali. Ni Ketut R. is the group leader of this fourteen-member group loan offered by MUK. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Putri Mandiri (PK-10222).

Ni Ketut R. is married and has four school-aged children. She owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 170,000 IDR a month.

In 2010, Ni Ketut R. joined MUK to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a loan of 1,500,000 IDR which will be used to invest in expanding her business. The loan will be her first from MUK. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.


 About MUK:
The mission of Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) is to assist small businesses in Bali by providing training, business consultation and loans thereby helping the owners and their families improve their everyday lives.


*****************************************************
Ni Ketut R. merupakan 57 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Melaya - Bali. Ni Ketut R. adalah pemimpin kelompok sebuah kelompok peminjam yang terdiri atas 14 anggota. Meskipun setiap anggota kelompok menerima pinjaman perorangan, mereka semua bertanggung jawab untuk mengembalikan pinjaman rekan anggota kelompok mereka jika ada yang menunggak atau gagal membayar. Nama resmi kelompok peminjam ini adalah Putri mandiri (PK-10222).

Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual. Ni Ketut R. sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 2 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Ketut R. menghasilkan sekitar 170,000 IDR. Dalam 2010, Ni Ketut R. bergabung MUK untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. Ni Ketut R. meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari MUK. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1,500,000 IDR.

Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 1st pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari MUK.

Tentang MUK:
Misi Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) adalah untuk membantu usaha kecil di Bali dengan memberikan perlatihan, konsultasi bisnis, dan pinjaman uang, dengan demikian membantu pemilik usaha dan keluarga mereka memperbaiki hidup sehari-hari.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.use: Purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina R. is from the city of Ambalatungan Santiago. She is 27 years old, is married and has 2 infant-aged children. To make a living, Marina owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a direct selling business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling personal and home products in the community. Marina has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 1500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Marina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Marina is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase the materials needed to provide her service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Marina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide her service.

loans.name: Isabel Johana

texts.es:
La Señora. Isabel Johana V. es socia del banco comunal Sociedad 12 de Abril, vive por el centro histórico de la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que es reconocida por su belleza arquitectónica de su centro histórico, fue nombrada como Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad el 1 de diciembre de 1999, su gastronomía, su gente y su cultura hacen de esta una ciudad hermosa y calida.

La Señora. Isabel Johana tiene 25 años, es casada y tiene un hijo de 5 años de edad,  y va a ingresar este año al jardín de infantes, su esposo se dedica a trabajar en un taller de ropa deportiva, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Nuestra socia es comerciante de frutas, vende en un puesto que tiene en un mercado de la ciudad de Cuenca, trabaja todos los días desde las 7 a.m. hasta las 3 p.m., realiza esta actividad hace 3 años.

Se encuentra en su quinto ciclo en  la fundación y los créditos le han servido para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio, su nuevo crédito lo va a utilizar para comprar más frutas para su negocio.

Su sueño es  que su esposo tenga un negocio propio de confección de ropa deportiva.
texts.en:
Sra. Isabel Johana V. is a member of the Communal Bank “Sociedad 12 de Abril” (April 12th Society). She lives in the historical center of the city of Cuenca, which is known for having beautiful architecture and being named a World Heritage Site on December 1, 1999. The food, people, and culture make this city an inviting and friendly place.

Sra. Isabel Johana is 25 years old, married, and has a five year old son who attends kindergarten. Her husband works at a sportswear shop. Since they do not own a home, they currently live in a rental property.

Isabel is a fruit merchant. She sells from a stand at a market in the city of Cuenca every day from 7am to 3pm. Isabel has been in this business for three years. She is in her fifth loan cycle with Fundación ESPOIR and used her previous loans to invest in her business. This new loan will be used to buy more fruits.

Her dream is for her husband to have his own business manufacturing sportswear.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bananas, papayas, melons, mangoes, coconuts, and other fruits

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia D. is from the village of Villalin,Pana-on,Misamis Occidental. She is 47 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Delia raises crops, primarily by planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables like mangos and bananas for sale. Delia has been in business for over three years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Delia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Delia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. Delia is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP to purchase fertilizers. This loan will be her fourth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve/expand her business. 

---------------------------------
About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers such as manure

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products.

loans.name: Luz Mercedes

texts.es:
La Señora. Luz Mercedes Calderón es socia del banco comunal Sociedad 12 de Abril, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que es reconocida por su belleza arquitectónica de su centro histórico, fue nombrada como Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad el 1 de diciembre de 1999, su gastronomía, su gente y su cultura hacen de esta una ciudad hermosa y calida.

La Señora. Luz Mercedes tiene 35 años,  es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 15, 13 y 9 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos estudian en el colegio y su último hijo en la escuela, su esposo trabaja como estibador, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Nuestras socia es comerciante de verduras y frutas, realiza esta actividad hace 15 años, tiene un puesto propio en el mercado 12 de Abril, y labora de domingo a domingo sin descansar un solo día desde las 7 a.m. hasta las 5 p.m.

Se encentra en su quinto ciclo, los créditos anteriores los a invertido en su negocio, su nuevo préstamo es para comprar más frutas y verduras y así ampliar su negocio.

Su meta es llegar a tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Luz Mercedes Calderón is a member of the communal bank, Sociedad 12 de Abril. She lives in the city of Cuenca, a city recognized for its architectural beauty and its historic center. It was named an UNESCO World Heritage Site on December 1, 1999. Its cuisine, its people, and its culture make this a lovely and warm city. Luz Mercedes is 35 years old, married, and has three children aged 15, 13 and 9. Her oldest two children are in high school and her youngest is in elementary school. Her husband works as a longshoreman (dockhand). They don't own their own house, so they are renting one. She works as a fruit and vegetable merchant, which she has done for 15 years. She has her own stand in El Mercado 12 de Abril (The 12th of April Market). She works from Sunday to Sunday (7 days a week) without taking a day off from 7 AM to 5 PM. She is in her 5th loan cycle. She has invested the previous loans in her business. Her new loan will be used to buy more fruits and vegetables and to expand her business. Her goal is to eventually own her own home.

Translated from Spanish by David Cannon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Jamila's Group

texts.en:
Jamila applied for a loan from Asasah to financially assist her husband with buying a new auto rickshaw for him. She lives with her family in a city called Borewala, which is located in Punjab, Pakistan. 

A very talented and caring lady, Jamila owns a clothes-selling business. She purchases clothes from Multan and Lahore (famous for its textiles) and sells them in her native city of Borewala. Her clientele base is her neighborhood. She specifically sells ladies clothes. She has now started selling shawls (worn by women over the shoulders or head) as well. She does this work to make her family’s life easier.
 
Her husband's name is W. A. and he is a driver for a trade. He has driven a rented rickshaw for the last three years. She is hopeful that this investment will prove helpful for her husband’s business. He will be able to drive as much as he wants and increases his income without paying rent.

loans.name: Myriam Maritza

texts.es:
Myriam B. vive en el municipio de Arjona en el departamento de Bolívar muy cerca a Cartagena, ella es la propietaria de la tienda la  Fe de Dios; tiene dos hijos que se encuentran en las edades de 37 y 41 años  y son empleados de empresas importantes.
Desde hace 5 años cuando empezó su tienda, con un dinero que le regaló su hermana y su ex cónyuge inició su gran sueño de ser independiente.  El Hacer crecer su tienda ha sido su desafío constante, pues vive sola y sostiene su hogar con este negocio y dinero que  le dan sus hijos. 
Este es su cuarto crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo  y con ellos su negocio ha cogido fuerzas,  ha diversificado sus productos y ahora siempre tiene lo que los clientes necesitan gracias a Dios y a esta organización. En la actualidad solicita un credikiva que lo invertirá en la compra de víveres, abarrotes, arroz, azúcar aceite, plátano, yuca verduras, refrescos, condimentos  y productos de aseo, que es lo que más compra su clientela.
Su deseo es que ahora Kiva la siga apoyando porque sus intereses son más económicos y su tienda pueda crecer cada día más;  adecuar su local es su sueño, así como también comprarse un enfriador para conservar sus productos perecederos y carnes, por eso tiene como meta que con sus utilidades comprará un televisor nuevo, porque el actual proyecta una imagen deficiente y esta es su gran distracción.
texts.en:
Myriam B. lives in the municipality of Arjona in the Bolivar department close to Cartagena. She is the owner of the Fe de Dios store, has two children ages 37 and 41 who work at important companies. Five years ago she opened her store with some money from her sister and ex-husband with a dream of being independent. Growing her business has been a constant challenge since she lives alone and has to try to keep up her home with the business and some money that her children give her. This is her fourth loan with Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, and with it's help her business has strengthened and she has diversified her products. Now thanks to God and this organization she always has what her customers need. She's currently requesting a Kiva loan to purchase various goods, rice, sugar, plantains, cassava, vegetables, beverages, condiments and cleaning products which are the good her customers buy most. Her hope is that Kiva will keep helping her because their interest rates are more affordable and so her store will grow more every day. She also dreams of remodeling the store and buying a refrigerator to keep perishable items and meats. Her goal is to use her profits to buy a new television because her current one is damaged and it serves as a great distraction.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase various goods, rice, sugar, plantains, cassava, vegetables, beverages, condiments and cleaning products which are the good her customers buy most

All of the children attend the local school in Borewala. She and her husband both want to give their children a better future so they spend their life without any difficulty.  

Kubra’s husband S. M. is in the animal selling business. He purchases young cows and goats, raises them, and sells them for a good profit. He has loyal customers because of his deep knowledge of animal breeding which was passed on from his father who was also in the same trade.  He has been in this field for over ten years.

Kubra has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband so he can buy more cows and goats to sell.  Kubra is hopeful that this investment will prove beneficial for her husband and he will be able to do very well with it.

loans.name: Raeesa

texts.en:
Raeesa, age 45, lives in Yadgar a district of Lahore, Pakistan. This district is famous for bus stands.  Raeesa owns a small house there which she and her husband built with love and care. Unfortunately, she lost her husband a few years ago, a tremendous loss for her. She totally lost herself in the memories of him. Her husband was the only breadwinner of their family but now Raeesa’s three sons have started managing the financial expenses of family. Her elder son sells copper wires which are good conductors of electricity and heat. This has become the family business as his two brothers also help with the business. In this way they generate income for the family. They earn approximately 30,000 Pakistan Rupees each month. 

Raeesa is a housewife. She spends her time in taking care of her children and doing household chores. She has applied for a loan from Asasah for her sons. With the loan amount they will buy the copper wires in large quantity and fulfill the orders of their customers. 

Raeesa is a second year member of Asasah.  She successfully repaid her first loan and has shown good credit behavior.

loans.use: To buy copper wire for selling.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Like others, Emma and her family have experienced the many challenges of poverty. Then, in 1997, came the idea of joining Kiva's partner, ASHI, in order to secure access to capital for her farming business. This loan is her sixth, and she has made good use of the previous ones to expand her business and income. She has applied for a new loan of PHP 25,000 to support her farm by purchasing fertilizers, rice seeds, and other supplies. She hopes to further improve crop production someday through hard work and the continuous support of ASHI and Kiva.

Emma has given her best to develop her business. Her greatest dream is to have a rice production situated near her home and to finish educating her children until they complete college. She hopes that these dreams will come true and that ASHI will provide the best direction and opportunity for her family. Emma hopes to maintain a long-term sustainable farming business. The sacrifices that she has encountered are her weapons and inspiration to survive against poverty.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, rice seeds, and other supplies

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa P. is from the village of Tagdo, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 48 years old. Elsa is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Elsa owns and operates a business selling home products. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling personal and  home products to community members. Elsa has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 4500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Elsa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Elsa is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Elsa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Urantuya

texts.en: Urantuya D. is 43-year-old widow who lives in Hovd province, western Mongolia with her two children in their own house. Urantuya is a dentist who operates a dental clinic in her town. She serves local people with all types of dentistry as well as making artificial teeth. One artificial tooth costs from 15,000 to 18,000 MNT on average. As an experienced and skilled dentist, she has established a wide customer base and her services are well known among the local citizens. Urantuya is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan in order to expand her dental clinic.

loans.use: To expand her dental business

loans.name: Ganbaatar

texts.en: Ganbaatar T. is 23 years old and lives with his wife and son in a ger (a traditional Mongolian housing tent) in the Hovd province of Mongolia. His wife works as a baker in a local bakery shop while his son goes to a kindergarten in their town. Ganbaatar operates a taxi service between the countryside and the capital of the province. He has just started his business with a small car. Ganbaatar works very hard to provide for his family and says, “My only wish is to build a new house with my business earnings”. Ganbaatar is requesting a 250,000 MNT loan to purchase parts for his automobile.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for his car

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying necklaces, rings, bracelets, etc.

loans.name: Gombosuren

texts.en: Gombosuren J. is 32 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in Uvs province, western Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His daughter attends a local elementary school while he and his wife operate a clothing retail business in their town. The couple began their business in 2000 with working capital of 1,000,000 MNT. At that time, they operated their business in a rented stall at the local market. The couple has since expanded the business, purchased a small car and have begun to build a house which they own. Currently their working capital is approximately 8,000,000 MNT and the couple plans to open their own store one day. Gombosuren says, “My wish is to complete our family house with the business revenues.” Gombosuren is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan in order to import more goods and attract new customers.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Haltar

texts.en: Haltar N. is 47 years old and lives with her family in Hovd province, western Mongolia in their own ger, a traditional housing tent. Her oldest child currently attends university, another child goes to a local middle school and her husband works in Hovd University. Haltar began her business in 2000 and currently operates a clothing retail business out of a rented stall at the local market along with providing a veterinary service as a veterinarian. She has found success in her trade and has used her earnings to support her family and pay her son's tuition fees. In the future, she hopes to continue seeing her business succeed and grow. She is requesting a 3,500,000 MNT loan to purchase construction materials in order to complete their house building.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials in order to complete their house building

loans.name: Munhzul

texts.en: Munhzul H. is 44 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Hovd province in western Mongolia. He and his famliy live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent. He currently operates a food retail business in his town, traveling to purchase the products and supplies for the business. His wife, Mendsaihan, helps him with selling food. Munhzul and his family started their bakery and food trading business in 2004 and make a variety of breads and baked goods which they sell directly to their customers. After building a stable operation, Munhzul and his wife used their earnings to start selling food in addition to the bakery. The continued growth of both businesses recently enabled them to expand the business. They attribute their success to their ability to deliver quality products to the consumer. Munhzul hopes to continue to expand his family business in the future and is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase construction materials in order to enlarge their food shop.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials in order to enlarge their food shop

loans.name: Narantsetseg

texts.en: Narantsetseg D. is a 40-year-old woman who lives with her husband and four children in Hovd province, western Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. All of her four children attend a local middle school while her husband works as a repairman in a local company. Narantsetseg operates a clothing retail business out of a rented stall at the local market called Ih Buyan. She started her business in 2008 and has found success in her trade and used her earnings to support her family. Narantsetseg and her family have also grown some vegetables on their plot of land. She is requesting a 2,750,000 MNT loan to purchase more children's uniforms for her business.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Raheela

texts.en:
Raheela, the wife of A., lives in Shalimar, a district of Lahore famous for fresh seasonal fruits. People can get the fresh fruits from here without going anywhere else. Raheela has given birth to four daughters, all of whom are very good natured. Raheela brought them up with discipline and affection, habits her daughters have adopted as well. All of her daughters are enrolled in school and are getting a good education. They also help Raheela with her domestic chores after coming back from school.

Raheela's husband is involved in a business selling construction supplies. He has been in this business for over ten years, running a shop in the market where he fulfills the demands of every customer who comes to his shop. Raheela has applied for a loan from Asasah for the second time for her husband. He will use the loan to buy construction supplies in bulk and expand his business. Raheela has maintained good credit behavior and never missed a single meeting in the first year of her loan.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for the business

loans.name: Shairbubu's Group

texts.ru:
Тысячи граждан Кыргызстана уезжают в ближнее и дальнее зарубежье в поисках работы и заработка. Счёт уехавших граждан уже идёт на сотни тысяч. Вся сложившаяся ситуация объясняется низким уровнем жизни, отсутствием рабочих мест и перспектив. Когда – то известная всему миру как вторая Швейцария, наша страна сейчас далеко не претендует на это почётное звание. Однако простой народ продолжает жить и переживать свои правительства, которые приходят одно за другим. Шайырбубу Байдалитова – лидер группы. Ей шестьдесят лет. Шайырбубу вырастила дочь и сына. Она вдова и последние годы она прожила с сыном и снохой. У Шайырбубу имеется отличный абрикосовый сад. Она получает пенсию в размере двух с половиной тысяч сомов и ухаживает за садом. Сноха работает учительницей в школе и получает зарплату в две тысячи сомов, а сын работает на заправке. У него зарплата составляет пять тысяч восемьсот сомов. На первый полученный кредит Шайырбубу закупила саженцы, которые весной посадила. Её риск был оправдан. Сейчас в саду триста семьдесят деревьев. Шайырбубу надеется получить хороший урожай с сада. Но прежде всего надо позаботиться о сохранности деревьев в саду. Для этого она и обратилась за этим кредитом. Полученные средства, она собирается вложить на закупку проволоки и установку забора для сада. 
Партнёры Шайырбубу по группе:
Раисе Касеновой сорок восемь лет. Раиса разведена и у неё одна дочь, которая уже замужем и находится дома. Раиса занимается сетевым маркетингом. Она продаёт косметику фирмы «Фаберлик» имеет доход в размере четырёх тысяч сомов. Раиса обратилась за кредитом в потребительских целях. Скоро ей предстоит встречать сватов и надо готовиться. 
Айжамал Сакыбаевой тридцать лет. Она замужем и имеет дочь, которая ходит в свдик. Муж Айжамал – военный. Он служит старшиной роты и получает зарплату в размере десяти тысяч сомов. Айжамал также нуждается в получении этого кредита, так как надо встречать сватов. 
Татьяне Климовой сорок девять лет. Муж Татьяны работает электриком и получает зарплату в размере пяти тысяч сомов. А сама Татьяна работает преподавателем в средней школе. Татьяна обратилась за этим кредитом, так как ей нужны средства для покупки стройматериалов для пристройки во дворе. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Thousands of citizens of Kyrgyztan emigrate to near and far away countries in search for work and to earn money. The count of citizens that left the country is already reaching hundreds of thousands. This situation is explained by very low living standards, absence of jobs and possibilities. Some time ago our country was known as another Switzerland, but now it cannot hold itself up to this honorable title. However, the common folk continues to live and relive its governments which come and go one after another. Shairbubu Baydalitova is a leader of this group. She is 60 years old. Shairbubu has raised a son and a daughter. She is a widow and has lived with her son and daughter-in-law in the recent years. Shairbubu has an excellent apricot garden. She is receiving a pension in the amount of 2000 soms and takes care of the garden. Her daughter-in-law works as a teacher in school and receives a salary of 2000 soms, and her son works at the gas station. His salary is five thousand eight hundred soms. Shairbubu has used her very first loan to buy seedlings which she planted in the spring. Her risk was not in vain. At this time she has 370 trees in her garden. Shairbubu hopes to collect a good harvest from her garden. But before that she needs to take good care of the trees. She has come to apply for a loan for this reason. She will use the funds to buy a wire to install a fence for the garden. Shairbubu's group partners are: Raisa K. is 48 years old. Raisa is divorced and has one daughter who is already married and lives at home. Raisa does internet marketing. She sells cosmetic products of Faberlik brand and has an income of 4000 soms. Raisa has come to ask for a loan for personal use. Very soon she will need to meet her son-in-law's parents and she needs to be prepared. Aijamal S. is 30 years old. She is married and has a daughter who goes to kindergarten. Aijamal's husband is in the military. He is serving as a top sergeant and receives a salary of ten thousand soms. Aijamal also needs a loan as she needs to get ready to meet her parents-in-law. Tatyana K. is 49 years old. Tatyana's husband works as an electrician and receives a salary in the amount of 5000 soms. Tatyana works as school teacher. She has come to ask for a loan because she needs funds to buy building materials to build a shed in the yard.

Translated from Russian by Elena Bortnikoff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wire to install a fence

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en: Shahnaz, 48 years old, is the wife of A. H. and they live in Shalimar, a district of Lahore famous for fresh seasonal fruits. People can get the fresh fruits from here without going anywhere else. Shahnaz's husband has been involved in a business selling clothes for the last fifteen years, running a clothing shop in the market. Changes are rapidly happening in the fashion industry so he has to stay aware of new fabrics and designs. Shahnaz also assists him by selling clothes in her community. She has applied for a loan from Asasah for the second time for her husband. He will use the loan to buy clothes in bulk and expand his business. In Shahnaz's first loan period, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed a single meeting.

loans.use: Purchase clothes in bulk

loans.name: Marylou

texts.en:
Marylou S. is from the village of Kuguita, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 25 years old. Marylou is married and has one school-age child. To make a living, Marylou owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling and dealing personal products, such as lotions and lipsticks, from different suppliers in the local community. Marylou has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Marylou joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marylou is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Marylou from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en:
Felipa Sus, from the village of Tagdo, Mambajao, Camiguin Province, is 47 years old, married, and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Felipa owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Engaged in her business for over five years, she earns approximately 3500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Felipa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting her first loan of 3000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. Felipa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her store.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Zamira's Group

texts.en:
Many people have given up their regular occupations and started to engage in trade and commerce. The heroes of our story are also making their efforts towards improving their standard of living by trading in different things. Zamira S. is the leader of this group. She is 38, divorced and has raised her daughter by herself. To make a living and provide for herself and her daughter, she sells pants and women’s clothes in “Kyial” market. She has been doing this job for the last sixteen years and has been able to build a house. Now her monthly income averages about 20,000 KGS. She started in business by selling vegetables and then switched to clothes. Zamira is very active and does her job with passion and enthusiasm. She hopes to get married again and have a son. At this moment, Zamira needs a loan in order to purchase goods.

Zamira’s partners:

Sulaika S., 50, is a mother of three children. She sells secondhand clothes in a small shop. Eight years ago she sold her cow and purchased clothes in a shop. She then took these clothes to a big market and resold them, thus starting her business. Now she needs a loan to purchase children’s clothes.

Almabubu M., 47, is a widow and has raised her three children herself. Almabubu makes her living by selling jeans. She manages to earn 28,000 KGS a month. Almabubu hopes to obtain this loan and purchase clothes for the fall season. After selling clothes, she plans to save money to pay for her son’s college education.

Jyldyzbek K., 36, is single. He sells men’s clothes. Due to his business, he has been able to buy a flat and a car. Now Jyldyzbek needs a loan to purchase goods. He hopes to save enough money and get married.

Burulsun A., 33, is single. She is involved in selling clothes in the market. She has been doing this job for six years and has bought a one room flat. Now Burulsun needs a loan in order to purchase men’s and women’s clothes. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: to purchase goods

loans.name: Artemia

texts.en: Artemia O.'s main source of income comes from selling personal products such as lotions and deodorants from different suppliers in her community. She is 50 years old, married and has four school-age children. They are from the village of North Poblacion, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. Artemia has been in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Artemia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Artemia is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This will be her third loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Shamshad

texts.en:
Shamshad is M. A.'s wife. They live in Shalimar, a district of the city of Lahore in Pakistan. Shalimar is famous for its fresh seasonal fruits. People can get the fresh fruit here without going anywhere else. 

Shamshad is a very caring lady. She is a grandmother and her grandchildren are very attached to her because of her caring and loving nature. Her husband has a dairy business. He has a buffalo at home and Shamshad helps him with milking. He sells the milk to various milk shops to earn income. Nowadays, his buffalo is producing insufficient milk which is affecting his sales. Therefore, Shamshad has applied for a loan for her husband’s dairy business. With the loan, he will buy another buffalo and expand his dairy business. 

Shamshad is a second year member of Asasah. In her first year, she showed good credit behavior and never missed a single meeting.

loans.use: To purchase a new buffalo for a dairy business

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en: Francisca E. is from the village of Brgy. Nagcuartelan, Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 54 years old. Francisca is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Francisca owns and operates a business venture in the food sector. The main source of income for the business comes from making and selling snacks in the local community. Francisca has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,100 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2007, Francisca joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Francisca has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Francisca is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Francisca from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Latifa

texts.en:
Latifa is a 60-year-old woman from Jenin, a city in the northern part of Palestine. Latifa is the mother of four sons. One of her sons works in the Ministry of Education, one at the the Arab bank, and one at the Arab Specialist Hospital. Her fourth son is a college student.

Latifa and her sons started building their own house after her husband passed away. Her sons were helping with funds from their salaries. The house is now completely built and just needs finishing work.

Since the sons have been helping with the house for a long time, they cannot pay any more, so Latifa came to FATEN and took a $3000 loan.

Latifa, whom you see in the picture with her son, Omar, is a well-respected woman in Jenin and with a very good reputation.

loans.use: Finish house construction

loans.name: Carlosa

texts.en: Carlosa M.'s main source of income comes from selling specially manufactured products to local businesses and community members. She is 44 years old, married and has six children: some of them are adults and some of them are students. She is from the village of Balabag, Gulayon. Carlosa has been in her manufacturing business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2005, Carlosa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC which was used to to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. Carlosa is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase more raw materials to manufacture additional products. This will be her ninth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products

loans.name: Airen

texts.en: Airen R.'s main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. She is 30 years old, married and has four young children. They are from the village of Upper Bandera, Polanco, Zamboanga del Norte. Airen has been in her business for over six years and earns approximately 2,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Airen joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Airen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,500 PHP from PMPC which was used to purchase seeds, seedlings and young plants to raise. Airen is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be her second loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

They are from the village of Bagong Sikat, Alicia, Isabela. Felicidad has been in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2006, Felicidad joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. loans.name: Niña

texts.en: Niña L. is from the village of Sinonoc, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 23 years old. Niña is married and has an infant. To make a living, Niña runs a food stall. The main source of income for the business comes from selling specialty food products in the local community. Niña has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Niña joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Niña is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Niña from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao.
